  3921         /* Either we are not allowed to run hooks for this frame or no
  3922            window change has been reported for it since the last time
  3923            we ran window change functions on it.  */
  3924         continue;
  3925 
  3926       /* Analyze windows and run buffer locals hooks in pre-order.  */
  3927       windows = Fnreverse (window_sub_list (root, Qnil));
  3928       number_of_windows = 0;
  3929 
  3930       /* The following loop collects all data needed to tell whether
  3931          the default value of a hook shall be run and runs any buffer
  3932          local hooks right away.  */
  3933       for (; CONSP (windows); windows = XCDR (windows))
  3934         {
  3935           Lisp_Object window = XCAR (windows);
  3936           struct window *w = XWINDOW (window);
  3937           Lisp_Object buffer = WINDOW_BUFFER (w);
  3938 
  3939           /* Count this window even if it has been deleted while
  3940              running a hook.  */
  3941           number_of_windows += 1;
  3942 
  3943           if (!WINDOW_LIVE_P (window))
  3944             continue;
  3945 
  3946           /* A "buffer change" means either the window's buffer
  3947              changed or the window was not part of this frame the last
  3948              time window change functions were run for it.  */
  3949           window_buffer_change =
  3950             (frame_window_change
  3951              && (!EQ (buffer, w->old_buffer)
  3952                  || w->change_stamp != f->change_stamp));
  3953           /* A "size change" means either a buffer change or that the
  3954              total or body size of the window has changed.
  3955 
  3956              Note: A buffer change implies a size change because either
  3957              this window didn't show the buffer before or this window
  3958              didn't show the buffer the last time the window change
  3959              functions were run.  In either case, an application
  3960              tracing size changes in a buffer-locally fashion might
  3961              want to be informed about that change.  */
  3962           window_size_change =
  3963             (frame_window_change
  3964              && (window_buffer_change
  3965                  || w->pixel_width != w->old_pixel_width
  3966                  || w->pixel_height != w->old_pixel_height
  3967                  || (window_body_width (w, WINDOW_BODY_IN_PIXELS)
  3968                      != w->old_body_pixel_width)
  3969                  || (window_body_height (w, WINDOW_BODY_IN_PIXELS)
  3970                      != w->old_body_pixel_height)));
  3971 
  3972           /* The following two are needed when running the default
  3973              values for this frame below.  */
  3974           frame_buffer_change = frame_buffer_change || window_buffer_change;
  3975           frame_size_change = frame_size_change || window_size_change;
  3976 
  3977           if (window_buffer_change)
  3978             run_window_change_functions_1
  3979               (Qwindow_buffer_change_functions, buffer, window);
  3980 
  3981           if (window_size_change && WINDOW_LIVE_P (window))
  3982             run_window_change_functions_1
  3983               (Qwindow_size_change_functions, buffer, window);
  3984 
  3985           /* This window's selection has changed when it was
  3986              (de-)selected as its frame's or the globally selected
  3987              window.  */
  3988           if (((frame_selected_change
  3989                 && (EQ (window, old_selected_window)
  3990                     || EQ (window, selected_window)))
  3991                || (frame_selected_window_change
  3992                    && (EQ (window, FRAME_OLD_SELECTED_WINDOW (f))
  3993                        || EQ (window, FRAME_SELECTED_WINDOW (f)))))
  3994               && WINDOW_LIVE_P (window))
  3995             run_window_change_functions_1
  3996               (Qwindow_selection_change_functions, buffer, window);
  3997 
  3998           /* This window's state has changed when its buffer or size
  3999              changed or it was (de-)selected as its frame's or the
  4000              globally selected window.  */
  4001           if ((window_buffer_change
  4002                || window_size_change
  4003                || ((frame_selected_change
  4004                     && (EQ (window, old_selected_window)
  4005                         || EQ (window, selected_window)))
  4006                    || (frame_selected_window_change
  4007                        && (EQ (window, FRAME_OLD_SELECTED_WINDOW (f))
  4008                            || EQ (window, FRAME_SELECTED_WINDOW (f))))))
  4009               && WINDOW_LIVE_P (window))
  4010             run_window_change_functions_1
  4011               (Qwindow_state_change_functions, buffer, window);
  4012         }
  4013 
  4014       /* When the number of windows on a frame has decreased, at least
  4015          one window of that frame was deleted.  In that case, we want
  4016          to run the default buffer and configuration change hooks.  The
  4017          default size change hook is not necessarily run in that case,
  4018          but usually will be unless the deletion was "compensated" by
  4019          a reduction of the frame size or an increase of a minibuffer
  4020          window size.  */
  4021       window_deleted = number_of_windows < f->number_of_windows;
  4022       /* A frame changed buffers when one of its windows has changed
  4023          its buffer or at least one window was deleted.  */
  4024       if ((frame_buffer_change || window_deleted) && FRAME_LIVE_P (f))
  4025         run_window_change_functions_1
  4026           (Qwindow_buffer_change_functions, Qnil, frame);
  4027 
  4028       /* A size change occurred when at least one of the frame's
  4029          windows has changed size.  */
  4030       if (frame_size_change && FRAME_LIVE_P (f))
  4031         run_window_change_functions_1
  4032           (Qwindow_size_change_functions, Qnil, frame);
  4033 
  4034       /* A frame has changed its window selection when its selected
  4035          window has changed or when it was (de-)selected.  */
  4036       if ((frame_selected_change || frame_selected_window_change)
  4037           && FRAME_LIVE_P (f))
  4038         run_window_change_functions_1
  4039           (Qwindow_selection_change_functions, Qnil, frame);
  4040 
  4041 #if defined HAVE_TEXT_CONVERSION
  4042 
  4043       /* If the buffer or selected window has changed, also reset the
  4044          input method composition state.  */
  4045 
  4046       if ((frame_selected_window_change || frame_buffer_change)
  4047           && FRAME_LIVE_P (f)
  4048           && FRAME_WINDOW_P (f))
  4049         report_selected_window_change (f);
  4050 
  4051 #endif
  4052 
  4053       /* A frame has changed state when a size or buffer change
  4054          occurred, its selected window has changed, when it was
  4055          (de-)selected or its window state change flag was set.  */
  4056       if ((frame_selected_change || frame_selected_window_change
  4057            || frame_buffer_change || window_deleted
  4058            || frame_size_change || frame_window_state_change)
  4059           && FRAME_LIVE_P (f))
  4060         {
  4061           run_window_change_functions_1
  4062             (Qwindow_state_change_functions, Qnil, frame);
  4063           /* Make sure to run 'window-state-change-hook' later.  */
  4064           run_window_state_change_hook = true;
  4065           /*  Make sure to record changes for each live frame in
  4066              window_change_record later.  */
  4067           window_change_record_frames = true;
  4068         }
  4069 
  4070       /* A frame's configuration changed when one of its windows has
  4071          changed buffer or size or at least one window was deleted.  */
  4072       if ((frame_size_change || window_deleted) && FRAME_LIVE_P (f))
  4073         /* This will run any buffer local window configuration change
  4074            hook as well.  */
  4075         run_window_configuration_change_hook (f);
  4076     }
  4077 
  4078   /* Run 'window-state-change-hook' if at least one frame has changed
  4079      state.  */
  4080   if (run_window_state_change_hook && !NILP (Vwindow_state_change_hook))
  4081     safe_run_hooks (Qwindow_state_change_hook);
  4082 
  4083   /* Record changes for all frames (if asked for), selected window and
  4084      frame.  */
  4085   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  4086 }
  4087 
  4088 /* Make WINDOW display BUFFER.  RUN_HOOKS_P means it's allowed
  4089    to run hooks.  See make_frame for a case where it's not allowed.
  4090    KEEP_MARGINS_P means that the current margins, fringes, and
  4091    scroll bar settings of the window are not reset from the buffer's
  4092    local settings.  */
  4093 
  4094 void
  4095 set_window_buffer (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object buffer,
  4096                    bool run_hooks_p, bool keep_margins_p)
  4097 {
  4098   struct window *w = XWINDOW (window);
  4099   struct buffer *b = XBUFFER (buffer);
  4100   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  4101   bool samebuf = EQ (buffer, w->contents);
  4102 
  4103   wset_buffer (w, buffer);
  4104 
  4105   if (EQ (window, selected_window))
  4106     bset_last_selected_window (b, window);
  4107 
  4108   /* Let redisplay errors through.  */
  4109   b->display_error_modiff = 0;
  4110 
  4111   /* Update time stamps of buffer display.  */
  4112   if (INTEGERP (BVAR (b, display_count)))
  4113     bset_display_count (b, Fadd1 (BVAR (b, display_count)));
  4114   bset_display_time (b, Fcurrent_time ());
  4115 
  4116   w->window_end_pos = 0;
  4117   w->window_end_vpos = 0;
  4118   w->last_cursor_vpos = 0;
  4119 
  4120   if (!(keep_margins_p && samebuf))
  4121     { /* If we're not actually changing the buffer, don't reset hscroll
  4122          and vscroll.  Resetting hscroll and vscroll here is problematic
  4123          for things like image-mode and doc-view-mode since it resets
  4124          the image's position whenever we resize the frame.  */
  4125       w->hscroll = w->min_hscroll = w->hscroll_whole = 0;
  4126       w->suspend_auto_hscroll = false;
  4127       w->vscroll = 0;
  4128       set_marker_both (w->pointm, buffer, BUF_PT (b), BUF_PT_BYTE (b));
  4129       set_marker_both (w->old_pointm, buffer, BUF_PT (b), BUF_PT_BYTE (b));
  4130       set_marker_restricted (w->start,
  4131                              make_fixnum (b->last_window_start),
  4132                              buffer);
  4133       w->start_at_line_beg = false;
  4134       w->force_start = false;
  4135     }
  4136 
  4137   wset_redisplay (w);
  4138   wset_update_mode_line (w);
  4139 
  4140   /* We must select BUFFER to run the window-scroll-functions and to look up
  4141      the buffer-local value of Vwindow_point_insertion_type.  */
  4142   record_unwind_current_buffer ();
  4143   Fset_buffer (buffer);
  4144 
  4145   XMARKER (w->pointm)->insertion_type = !NILP (Vwindow_point_insertion_type);
  4146   XMARKER (w->old_pointm)->insertion_type = !NILP (Vwindow_point_insertion_type);
  4147 
  4148   if (!keep_margins_p)
  4149     {
  4150       /* Set fringes and scroll bars from buffer unless they have been
  4151          declared as persistent.  */
  4152       if (!w->fringes_persistent)
  4153         set_window_fringes (w, BVAR (b, left_fringe_width),
  4154                             BVAR (b, right_fringe_width),
  4155                             BVAR (b, fringes_outside_margins), Qnil);
  4156       if (!w->scroll_bars_persistent)
  4157         set_window_scroll_bars (w, BVAR (b, scroll_bar_width),
  4158                                 BVAR (b, vertical_scroll_bar_type),
  4159                                 BVAR (b, scroll_bar_height),
  4160                                 BVAR (b, horizontal_scroll_bar_type), Qnil);
  4161       /* Set left and right marginal area width from buffer.  */
  4162       set_window_margins (w, BVAR (b, left_margin_cols),
  4163                           BVAR (b, right_margin_cols));
  4164       apply_window_adjustment (w);
  4165     }
  4166 
  4167   if (run_hooks_p && !NILP (Vwindow_scroll_functions))
  4168     run_hook_with_args_2 (Qwindow_scroll_functions, window,
  4169                           Fmarker_position (w->start));
  4170 
  4171   /* Ensure that window change functions are run later if the buffer
  4172      differs and the window is neither a mini nor a pseudo window.
  4173 
  4174      Note: Running window change functions for the minibuffer is noisy
  4175      and was generally suppressed in the past.  Is there any reason we
  4176      should run them?  */
  4177   if (!samebuf && !MINI_WINDOW_P (w) && !WINDOW_PSEUDO_P (w))
  4178     FRAME_WINDOW_CHANGE (XFRAME (w->frame)) = true;
  4179 
  4180   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  4181 }
  4182 
  4183 DEFUN ("set-window-buffer", Fset_window_buffer, Sset_window_buffer, 2, 3, 0,
  4184        doc: /* Make WINDOW display BUFFER-OR-NAME.
  4185 WINDOW must be a live window and defaults to the selected one.
  4186 BUFFER-OR-NAME must be a buffer or the name of an existing buffer.
  4187 
  4188 Optional third argument KEEP-MARGINS non-nil means that WINDOW's current
  4189 display margins, fringe widths, and scroll bar settings are preserved;
  4190 the default is to reset these from the local settings for BUFFER-OR-NAME
  4191 or the frame defaults.  Return nil.
  4192 
  4193 This function throws an error when WINDOW is strongly dedicated to its
  4194 buffer (that is `window-dedicated-p' returns t for WINDOW) and does not
  4195 already display BUFFER-OR-NAME.
  4196 
  4197 This function runs `window-scroll-functions' before running
  4198 `window-configuration-change-hook'.  */)
  4199   (register Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object buffer_or_name, Lisp_Object keep_margins)
  4200 {
  4201   register Lisp_Object tem, buffer;
  4202   register struct window *w = decode_live_window (window);
  4203 
  4204   XSETWINDOW (window, w);
  4205   buffer = Fget_buffer (buffer_or_name);
  4206   CHECK_BUFFER (buffer);
  4207   if (!BUFFER_LIVE_P (XBUFFER (buffer)))
  4208     error ("Attempt to display deleted buffer");
  4209 
  4210   tem = w->contents;
  4211   if (NILP (tem))
  4212     error ("Window is deleted");
  4213   else
  4214     {
  4215       if (!EQ (tem, buffer))
  4216         {
  4217           if (EQ (w->dedicated, Qt))
  4218             /* WINDOW is strongly dedicated to its buffer, signal an
  4219                error.  */
  4220             error ("Window is dedicated to `%s'", SDATA (BVAR (XBUFFER (tem), name)));
  4221           else
  4222             /* WINDOW is weakly dedicated to its buffer, reset
  4223                dedication.  */
  4224             wset_dedicated (w, Qnil);
  4225 
  4226           call1 (Qrecord_window_buffer, window);
  4227         }
  4228 
  4229       unshow_buffer (w);
  4230     }
  4231 
  4232   set_window_buffer (window, buffer, true, !NILP (keep_margins));
  4233 
  4234   return Qnil;
  4235 }
  4236 
  4237 static Lisp_Object
  4238 display_buffer (Lisp_Object buffer, Lisp_Object not_this_window_p, Lisp_Object override_frame)
  4239 {
  4240   return call3 (Qdisplay_buffer, buffer, not_this_window_p, override_frame);
  4241 }
  4242 
  4243 DEFUN ("force-window-update", Fforce_window_update, Sforce_window_update,
  4244        0, 1, 0,
  4245        doc: /* Force all windows to be updated on next redisplay.
  4246 If optional arg OBJECT is a window, force redisplay of that window only.
  4247 If OBJECT is a buffer or buffer name, force redisplay of all windows
  4248 displaying that buffer.  */)
  4249   (Lisp_Object object)
  4250 {
  4251   if (NILP (object))
  4252     {
  4253       windows_or_buffers_changed = 29;
  4254       update_mode_lines = 28;
  4255       return Qt;
  4256     }
  4257 
  4258   if (WINDOW_LIVE_P (object))
  4259     {
  4260       struct window *w = XWINDOW (object);
  4261       mark_window_display_accurate (object, false);
  4262       w->update_mode_line = true;
  4263       if (BUFFERP (w->contents))
  4264         XBUFFER (w->contents)->prevent_redisplay_optimizations_p = true;
  4265       update_mode_lines = 29;
  4266       return Qt;
  4267     }
  4268 
  4269   if (STRINGP (object))
  4270     object = Fget_buffer (object);
  4271   if (BUFFERP (object) && BUFFER_LIVE_P (XBUFFER (object))
  4272       && buffer_window_count (XBUFFER (object)))
  4273     {
  4274       /* If buffer is live and shown in at least one window, find
  4275          all windows showing this buffer and force update of them.  */
  4276       object = window_loop (REDISPLAY_BUFFER_WINDOWS, object, false, Qvisible);
  4277       return NILP (object) ? Qnil : Qt;
  4278     }
  4279 
  4280   /* If nothing suitable was found, just return.
  4281      We could signal an error, but this feature will typically be used
  4282      asynchronously in timers or process sentinels, so we don't.  */
  4283   return Qnil;
  4284 }
  4285 
  4286 /* Obsolete since 24.3.  */
  4287 void
  4288 temp_output_buffer_show (register Lisp_Object buf)
  4289 {
  4290   register struct buffer *old = current_buffer;
  4291   register Lisp_Object window;
  4292   register struct window *w;
  4293 
  4294   bset_directory (XBUFFER (buf), BVAR (current_buffer, directory));
  4295 
  4296   Fset_buffer (buf);
  4297   BUF_SAVE_MODIFF (XBUFFER (buf)) = MODIFF;
  4298   BEGV = BEG;
  4299   ZV = Z;
  4300   SET_PT (BEG);
  4301   set_buffer_internal (old);
  4302 
  4303   if (!NILP (Vtemp_buffer_show_function))
  4304     call1 (Vtemp_buffer_show_function, buf);
  4305   else if (WINDOW_LIVE_P (window = display_buffer (buf, Qnil, Qnil)))
  4306     {
  4307       if (!EQ (XWINDOW (window)->frame, selected_frame))
  4308         Fmake_frame_visible (WINDOW_FRAME (XWINDOW (window)));
  4309       Vminibuf_scroll_window = window;
  4310       w = XWINDOW (window);
  4311       w->hscroll = w->min_hscroll = w->hscroll_whole = 0;
  4312       w->suspend_auto_hscroll = false;
  4313       set_marker_restricted_both (w->start, buf, BEG, BEG);
  4314       set_marker_restricted_both (w->pointm, buf, BEG, BEG);
  4315       set_marker_restricted_both (w->old_pointm, buf, BEG, BEG);
  4316 
  4317       /* Run temp-buffer-show-hook, with the chosen window selected
  4318          and its buffer current.  */
  4319       {
  4320         specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  4321         Lisp_Object prev_window, prev_buffer;
  4322         prev_window = selected_window;
  4323         XSETBUFFER (prev_buffer, old);
  4324 
  4325         /* Select the window that was chosen, for running the hook.
  4326            Note: Both Fselect_window and select_window_norecord may
  4327            set-buffer to the buffer displayed in the window,
  4328            so we need to save the current buffer.  --stef  */
  4329         record_unwind_protect (restore_buffer, prev_buffer);
  4330         record_unwind_protect (select_window_norecord, prev_window);
  4331         Fselect_window (window, Qt);
  4332         Fset_buffer (w->contents);
  4333         run_hook (Qtemp_buffer_show_hook);
  4334         unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  4335       }
  4336     }
  4337 }
  4338 
  4339 /* Allocate basically initialized window.  */
  4340 
  4341 static struct window *
  4342 allocate_window (void)
  4343 {
  4344   return ALLOCATE_ZEROED_PSEUDOVECTOR (struct window, mode_line_help_echo,
  4345                                        PVEC_WINDOW);
  4346 }
  4347 
  4348 /* Make new window, have it replace WINDOW in window-tree, and make
  4349    WINDOW its only vertical child (HORFLAG means make WINDOW its only
  4350    horizontal child).   */
  4351 static void
  4352 make_parent_window (Lisp_Object window, bool horflag)
  4353 {
  4354   Lisp_Object parent;
  4355   register struct window *o, *p;
  4356 
  4357   o = XWINDOW (window);
  4358   p = allocate_window ();
  4359   memcpy ((char *) p + sizeof (union vectorlike_header),
  4360           (char *) o + sizeof (union vectorlike_header),
  4361           word_size * VECSIZE (struct window));
  4362   /* P's buffer slot may change from nil to a buffer...  */
  4363   adjust_window_count (p, 1);
  4364   XSETWINDOW (parent, p);
  4365 
  4366   p->sequence_number = ++sequence_number;
  4367 
  4368   replace_window (window, parent, true);
  4369 
  4370   wset_next (o, Qnil);
  4371   wset_prev (o, Qnil);
  4372   wset_parent (o, parent);
  4373   /* ...but now P becomes an internal window.  */
  4374   wset_start (p, Qnil);
  4375   wset_pointm (p, Qnil);
  4376   wset_old_pointm (p, Qnil);
  4377   wset_buffer (p, Qnil);
  4378   wset_combination (p, horflag, window);
  4379   wset_combination_limit (p, Qnil);
  4380   wset_window_parameters (p, Qnil);
  4381 }
  4382 
  4383 /* Make new window from scratch.  */
  4384 Lisp_Object
  4385 make_window (void)
  4386 {
  4387   Lisp_Object window;
  4388   register struct window *w;
  4389 
  4390   w = allocate_window ();
  4391   /* Initialize Lisp data.  Note that allocate_window initializes all
  4392      Lisp data to nil, so do it only for slots which should not be nil.  */
  4393   wset_normal_lines (w, make_float (1.0));
  4394   wset_normal_cols (w, make_float (1.0));
  4395   wset_new_total (w, make_fixnum (0));
  4396   wset_new_normal (w, make_fixnum (0));
  4397   wset_new_pixel (w, make_fixnum (0));
  4398   wset_start (w, Fmake_marker ());
  4399   wset_pointm (w, Fmake_marker ());
  4400   wset_old_pointm (w, Fmake_marker ());
  4401   wset_vertical_scroll_bar_type (w, Qt);
  4402   wset_horizontal_scroll_bar_type (w, Qt);
  4403   /* These Lisp fields are marked specially so they're not set to nil by
  4404      allocate_window.  */
  4405   wset_prev_buffers (w, Qnil);
  4406   wset_next_buffers (w, Qnil);
  4407 
  4408   /* Initialize non-Lisp data.  Note that allocate_window zeroes out all
  4409      non-Lisp data, so do it only for slots which should not be zero.  */
  4410   w->nrows_scale_factor = w->ncols_scale_factor = 1;
  4411   w->left_fringe_width = w->right_fringe_width = -1;
  4412   w->mode_line_height = w->tab_line_height = w->header_line_height = -1;
  4413 #ifdef HAVE_WINDOW_SYSTEM
  4414   w->phys_cursor_type = NO_CURSOR;
  4415   w->phys_cursor_width = -1;
  4416 #endif
  4417   w->sequence_number = ++sequence_number;
  4418   w->scroll_bar_width = -1;
  4419   w->scroll_bar_height = -1;
  4420   w->column_number_displayed = -1;
  4421   /* Reset window_list.  */
  4422   Vwindow_list = Qnil;
  4423   /* Return window.  */
  4424   XSETWINDOW (window, w);
  4425   return window;
  4426 }
  4427 
  4428 DEFUN ("set-window-new-pixel", Fset_window_new_pixel, Sset_window_new_pixel, 2, 3, 0,
  4429        doc: /* Set new pixel size of WINDOW to SIZE.
  4430 WINDOW must be a valid window and defaults to the selected one.
  4431 Return SIZE.
  4432 
  4433 Optional argument ADD non-nil means add SIZE to the new pixel size of
  4434 WINDOW and return the sum.
  4435 
  4436 The new pixel size of WINDOW, if valid, will be shortly installed as
  4437 WINDOW's pixel height (see `window-pixel-height') or pixel width (see
  4438 `window-pixel-width').
  4439 
  4440 Note: This function does not operate on any child windows of WINDOW.  */)
  4441   (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object size, Lisp_Object add)
  4442 {
  4443   struct window *w = decode_valid_window (window);
  4444   EMACS_INT size_min = NILP (add) ? 0 : - XFIXNUM (w->new_pixel);
  4445   EMACS_INT size_max = size_min + min (INT_MAX, MOST_POSITIVE_FIXNUM);
  4446 
  4447   int checked_size = check_integer_range (size, size_min, size_max);
  4448   if (NILP (add))
  4449     wset_new_pixel (w, size);
  4450   else
  4451     wset_new_pixel (w, make_fixnum (XFIXNUM (w->new_pixel) + checked_size));
  4452 
  4453   return w->new_pixel;
  4454 }
  4455 
  4456 DEFUN ("set-window-new-total", Fset_window_new_total, Sset_window_new_total, 2, 3, 0,
  4457        doc: /* Set new total size of WINDOW to SIZE.
  4458 WINDOW must be a valid window and defaults to the selected one.
  4459 Return SIZE.
  4460 
  4461 Optional argument ADD non-nil means add SIZE to the new total size of
  4462 WINDOW and return the sum.
  4463 
  4464 The new total size of WINDOW, if valid, will be shortly installed as
  4465 WINDOW's total height (see `window-total-height') or total width (see
  4466 `window-total-width').
  4467 
  4468 Note: This function does not operate on any child windows of WINDOW.  */)
  4469      (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object size, Lisp_Object add)
  4470 {
  4471   struct window *w = decode_valid_window (window);
  4472 
  4473   CHECK_FIXNUM (size);
  4474   if (NILP (add))
  4475     wset_new_total (w, size);
  4476   else
  4477     wset_new_total (w, make_fixnum (XFIXNUM (w->new_total) + XFIXNUM (size)));
  4478 
  4479   return w->new_total;
  4480 }
  4481 
  4482 DEFUN ("set-window-new-normal", Fset_window_new_normal, Sset_window_new_normal, 1, 2, 0,
  4483        doc: /* Set new normal size of WINDOW to SIZE.
  4484 WINDOW must be a valid window and defaults to the selected one.
  4485 Return SIZE.
  4486 
  4487 The new normal size of WINDOW, if valid, will be shortly installed as
  4488 WINDOW's normal size (see `window-normal-size').
  4489 
  4490 Note: This function does not operate on any child windows of WINDOW.  */)
  4491      (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object size)
  4492 {
  4493   wset_new_normal (decode_valid_window (window), size);
  4494   return size;
  4495 }
  4496 
  4497 /* Return true if setting w->pixel_height (w->pixel_width if HORFLAG)
  4498    to w->new_pixel would result in correct heights (widths)
  4499    for window W and recursively all child windows of W.
  4500 
  4501    Note: This function does not check any of `window-fixed-size-p',
  4502    `window-min-height' or `window-min-width'.  It does check that window
  4503    sizes do not drop below one line (two columns). */
  4504 static bool
  4505 window_resize_check (struct window *w, bool horflag)
  4506 {
  4507   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
  4508   struct window *c;
  4509 
  4510   if (WINDOW_VERTICAL_COMBINATION_P (w))
  4511     /* W is a vertical combination.  */
  4512     {
  4513       c = XWINDOW (w->contents);
  4514       if (horflag)
  4515         /* All child windows of W must have the same width as W.  */
  4516         {
  4517           while (c)
  4518             {
  4519               if (XFIXNUM (c->new_pixel) != XFIXNUM (w->new_pixel)
  4520                   || !window_resize_check (c, horflag))
  4521                 return false;
  4522 
  4523               c = NILP (c->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (c->next);
  4524             }
  4525 
  4526           return true;
  4527         }
  4528       else
  4529         /* The sum of the heights of the child windows of W must equal
  4530            W's height.  */
  4531         {
  4532           int remaining_pixels = XFIXNUM (w->new_pixel);
  4533 
  4534           while (c)
  4535             {
  4536               if (!window_resize_check (c, horflag))
  4537                 return false;
  4538 
  4539               remaining_pixels -= XFIXNUM (c->new_pixel);
  4540               if (remaining_pixels < 0)
  4541                 return false;
  4542               c = NILP (c->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (c->next);
  4543             }
  4544 
  4545           return remaining_pixels == 0;
  4546         }
  4547     }
  4548   else if (WINDOW_HORIZONTAL_COMBINATION_P (w))
  4549     /* W is a horizontal combination.  */
  4550     {
  4551       c = XWINDOW (w->contents);
  4552       if (horflag)
  4553         /* The sum of the widths of the child windows of W must equal W's
  4554            width.  */
  4555         {
  4556           int remaining_pixels = XFIXNUM (w->new_pixel);
  4557 
  4558           while (c)
  4559             {
  4560               if (!window_resize_check (c, horflag))
  4561                 return false;
  4562 
  4563               remaining_pixels -= XFIXNUM (c->new_pixel);
  4564               if (remaining_pixels < 0)
  4565                 return false;
  4566               c = NILP (c->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (c->next);
  4567             }
  4568 
  4569           return remaining_pixels == 0;
  4570         }
  4571       else
  4572         /* All child windows of W must have the same height as W.  */
  4573         {
  4574           while (c)
  4575             {
  4576               if (XFIXNUM (c->new_pixel) != XFIXNUM (w->new_pixel)
  4577                   || !window_resize_check (c, horflag))
  4578                 return false;
  4579 
  4580               c = NILP (c->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (c->next);
  4581             }
  4582 
  4583           return true;
  4584         }
  4585     }
  4586   else
  4587     /* A leaf window.  Make sure it's not too small.  The following
  4588        hardcodes the values of `window-safe-min-width' (2) and
  4589        `window-safe-min-height' (1) which are defined in window.el.  */
  4590     return (XFIXNUM (w->new_pixel) >= (horflag
  4591                                        ? 2 * FRAME_COLUMN_WIDTH (f)
  4592                                        : FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f)));
  4593 }
  4594 
  4595 
  4596 /* Set w->pixel_height (w->pixel_width if HORFLAG) to
  4597    w->new_pixel for window W and recursively all child windows of W.
  4598    Also calculate and assign the new vertical (horizontal) pixel start
  4599    positions of each of these windows.
  4600 
  4601    This function does not perform any error checks.  Make sure you have
  4602    run window_resize_check on W before applying this function.  */
  4603 static void
  4604 window_resize_apply (struct window *w, bool horflag)
  4605 {
  4606   struct window *c;
  4607   int edge;
  4608   int unit = (horflag
  4609               ? FRAME_COLUMN_WIDTH (WINDOW_XFRAME (w))
  4610               : FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (WINDOW_XFRAME (w)));
  4611 
  4612   /* Note: Assigning new_normal requires that the new total size of the
  4613      parent window has been set *before*.  */
  4614   if (horflag)
  4615     {
  4616       w->pixel_width = XFIXNAT (w->new_pixel);
  4617       w->total_cols = w->pixel_width / unit;
  4618       if (NUMBERP (w->new_normal))
  4619         wset_normal_cols (w, w->new_normal);
  4620 
  4621       edge = w->pixel_left;
  4622     }
  4623   else
  4624     {
  4625       w->pixel_height = XFIXNAT (w->new_pixel);
  4626       w->total_lines = w->pixel_height / unit;
  4627       if (NUMBERP (w->new_normal))
  4628         wset_normal_lines (w, w->new_normal);
  4629 
  4630       edge = w->pixel_top;
  4631     }
  4632 
  4633   if (WINDOW_VERTICAL_COMBINATION_P (w))
  4634     /* W is a vertical combination.  */
  4635     {
  4636       c = XWINDOW (w->contents);
  4637       while (c)
  4638         {
  4639           if (horflag)
  4640             {
  4641               c->pixel_left = edge;
  4642               c->left_col = edge / unit;
  4643             }
  4644           else
  4645             {
  4646               c->pixel_top = edge;
  4647               c->top_line = edge / unit;
  4648             }
  4649           window_resize_apply (c, horflag);
  4650           if (!horflag)
  4651             edge = edge + c->pixel_height;
  4652 
  4653           c = NILP (c->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (c->next);
  4654         }
  4655     }
  4656   else if (WINDOW_HORIZONTAL_COMBINATION_P (w))
  4657     /* W is a horizontal combination.  */
  4658     {
  4659       c = XWINDOW (w->contents);
  4660       while (c)
  4661         {
  4662           if (horflag)
  4663             {
  4664               c->pixel_left = edge;
  4665               c->left_col = edge / unit;
  4666             }
  4667           else
  4668             {
  4669               c->pixel_top = edge;
  4670               c->top_line = edge / unit;
  4671             }
  4672 
  4673           window_resize_apply (c, horflag);
  4674           if (horflag)
  4675             edge = edge + c->pixel_width;
  4676 
  4677           c = NILP (c->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (c->next);
  4678         }
  4679     }
  4680   else
  4681     /* Bug#15957.  */
  4682     w->window_end_valid = false;
  4683 
  4684   if (!WINDOW_PSEUDO_P (w))
  4685     FRAME_WINDOW_CHANGE (WINDOW_XFRAME (w)) = true;
  4686 }
  4687 
  4688 
  4689 /* Set w->total_lines (w->total_cols if HORFLAG) to
  4690    w->new_total for window W and recursively all child windows of W.
  4691    Also calculate and assign the new vertical (horizontal) start
  4692    positions of each of these windows.  */
  4693 static void
  4694 window_resize_apply_total (struct window *w, bool horflag)
  4695 {
  4696   struct window *c;
  4697   int edge;
  4698 
  4699   /* Note: Assigning new_normal requires that the new total size of the
  4700      parent window has been set *before*.  */
  4701   if (horflag)
  4702     {
  4703       w->total_cols = XFIXNAT (w->new_total);
  4704       edge = w->left_col;
  4705     }
  4706   else
  4707     {
  4708       w->total_lines = XFIXNAT (w->new_total);
  4709       edge = w->top_line;
  4710     }
  4711 
  4712   if (WINDOW_VERTICAL_COMBINATION_P (w))
  4713     /* W is a vertical combination.  */
  4714     {
  4715       c = XWINDOW (w->contents);
  4716       while (c)
  4717         {
  4718           if (horflag)
  4719             c->left_col = edge;
  4720           else
  4721             c->top_line = edge;
  4722 
  4723           window_resize_apply_total (c, horflag);
  4724           if (!horflag)
  4725             edge = edge + c->total_lines;
  4726 
  4727           c = NILP (c->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (c->next);
  4728         }
  4729     }
  4730   else if (WINDOW_HORIZONTAL_COMBINATION_P (w))
  4731     /* W is a horizontal combination.  */
  4732     {
  4733       c = XWINDOW (w->contents);
  4734       while (c)
  4735         {
  4736           if (horflag)
  4737             c->left_col = edge;
  4738           else
  4739             c->top_line = edge;
  4740 
  4741           window_resize_apply_total (c, horflag);
  4742           if (horflag)
  4743             edge = edge + c->total_cols;
  4744 
  4745           c = NILP (c->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (c->next);
  4746         }
  4747     }
  4748 }
  4749 
  4750 DEFUN ("window-resize-apply", Fwindow_resize_apply, Swindow_resize_apply, 0, 2, 0,
  4751        doc: /* Apply requested size values for window-tree of FRAME.
  4752 If FRAME is omitted or nil, it defaults to the selected frame.
  4753 
  4754 Optional argument HORIZONTAL omitted or nil means apply requested
  4755 height values.  HORIZONTAL non-nil means apply requested width values.
  4756 
  4757 The requested size values are those set by `set-window-new-pixel' and
  4758 `set-window-new-normal'.  This function checks whether the requested
  4759 values sum up to a valid window layout, recursively assigns the new
  4760 sizes of all child windows and calculates and assigns the new start
  4761 positions of these windows.
  4762 
  4763 Return t if the requested values have been applied correctly, nil
  4764 otherwise.
  4765 
  4766 Note: This function does not check any of `window-fixed-size-p',
  4767 `window-min-height' or `window-min-width'.  All these checks have to
  4768 be applied on the Elisp level.  */)
  4769      (Lisp_Object frame, Lisp_Object horizontal)
  4770 {
  4771   struct frame *f = decode_live_frame (frame);
  4772   struct window *r = XWINDOW (FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f));
  4773   bool horflag = !NILP (horizontal);
  4774 
  4775   if (!window_resize_check (r, horflag)
  4776       || (XFIXNUM (r->new_pixel)
  4777           != (horflag ? r->pixel_width : r->pixel_height)))
  4778     return Qnil;
  4779 
  4780   block_input ();
  4781   window_resize_apply (r, horflag);
  4782 
  4783   fset_redisplay (f);
  4784 
  4785   adjust_frame_glyphs (f);
  4786   unblock_input ();
  4787 
  4788   return Qt;
  4789 }
  4790 
  4791 
  4792 DEFUN ("window-resize-apply-total", Fwindow_resize_apply_total, Swindow_resize_apply_total, 0, 2, 0,
  4793        doc: /* Apply requested total size values for window-tree of FRAME.
  4794 If FRAME is omitted or nil, it defaults to the selected frame.
  4795 
  4796 This function does not assign pixel or normal size values.  You should
  4797 have run `window-resize-apply' before running this.
  4798 
  4799 Optional argument HORIZONTAL omitted or nil means apply requested
  4800 height values.  HORIZONTAL non-nil means apply requested width
  4801 values.  */)
  4802      (Lisp_Object frame, Lisp_Object horizontal)
  4803 {
  4804   struct frame *f = decode_live_frame (frame);
  4805   struct window *r = XWINDOW (FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f));
  4806 
  4807   block_input ();
  4808   /* Necessary when deleting the top-/or leftmost window.  */
  4809   r->left_col = 0;
  4810   r->top_line = FRAME_TOP_MARGIN (f);
  4811   window_resize_apply_total (r, !NILP (horizontal));
  4812   /* Handle the mini window.  */
  4813   if (FRAME_HAS_MINIBUF_P (f) && !FRAME_MINIBUF_ONLY_P (f))
  4814     {
  4815       struct window *m = XWINDOW (f->minibuffer_window);
  4816 
  4817       if (NILP (horizontal))
  4818         {
  4819           m->top_line = r->top_line + r->total_lines;
  4820           m->total_lines = XFIXNAT (m->new_total);
  4821         }
  4822       else
  4823         m->total_cols = XFIXNAT (m->new_total);
  4824     }
  4825 
  4826   unblock_input ();
  4827 
  4828   return Qt;
  4829 }
  4830 
  4831 /* Resize frame F's windows when F's inner height (inner width if
  4832    HORFLAG is true) has been set to SIZE pixels.  */
  4833 
  4834 void
  4835 resize_frame_windows (struct frame *f, int size, bool horflag)
  4836 {
  4837   Lisp_Object root = f->root_window;
  4838   struct window *r = XWINDOW (root);
  4839   int old_pixel_size = horflag ? r->pixel_width : r->pixel_height;
  4840   int new_size, new_pixel_size;
  4841   int unit = horflag ? FRAME_COLUMN_WIDTH (f) : FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f);
  4842   Lisp_Object mini = f->minibuffer_window;
  4843   struct window *m = WINDOWP (mini) ? XWINDOW (mini) : NULL;
  4844   int mini_height = ((FRAME_HAS_MINIBUF_P (f) && !FRAME_MINIBUF_ONLY_P (f))
  4845                      ? (unit + m->pixel_height
  4846                         - window_body_height (m, WINDOW_BODY_IN_PIXELS))
  4847                      : 0);
  4848 
  4849   new_pixel_size = max (horflag ? size : size - mini_height, unit);
  4850   new_size = new_pixel_size / unit;
  4851 
  4852   if (new_pixel_size == old_pixel_size
  4853       && (horflag || r->pixel_top == FRAME_TOP_MARGIN_HEIGHT (f)))
  4854     ;
  4855   else if (WINDOW_LEAF_P (r))
  4856     {
  4857       /* For a leaf root window just set the size.  */
  4858       if (horflag)
  4859         {
  4860           r->total_cols = new_size;
  4861           r->pixel_width = new_pixel_size;
  4862         }
  4863       else
  4864         {
  4865           r->top_line = FRAME_TOP_MARGIN (f);
  4866           r->pixel_top = FRAME_TOP_MARGIN_HEIGHT (f);
  4867 
  4868           r->total_lines = new_size;
  4869           r->pixel_height = new_pixel_size;
  4870         }
  4871 
  4872       FRAME_WINDOW_CHANGE (f)
  4873         = !WINDOW_PSEUDO_P (r) && new_pixel_size != old_pixel_size;
  4874     }
  4875   else
  4876     {
  4877       Lisp_Object delta;
  4878 
  4879       if (!horflag)
  4880         {
  4881           r->top_line = FRAME_TOP_MARGIN (f);
  4882           r->pixel_top = FRAME_TOP_MARGIN_HEIGHT (f);
  4883         }
  4884 
  4885       XSETINT (delta, new_pixel_size - old_pixel_size);
  4886 
  4887       /* Try a "normal" resize first.  */
  4888       resize_root_window (root, delta, horflag ? Qt : Qnil, Qnil, Qt);
  4889       if (window_resize_check (r, horflag)
  4890           && new_pixel_size == XFIXNUM (r->new_pixel))
  4891         {
  4892           window_resize_apply (r, horflag);
  4893           window_pixel_to_total (r->frame, horflag ? Qt : Qnil);
  4894         }
  4895       else
  4896         {
  4897           /* Try with "reasonable" minimum sizes next.  */
  4898           resize_root_window (root, delta, horflag ? Qt : Qnil, Qt, Qt);
  4899           if (window_resize_check (r, horflag)
  4900               && new_pixel_size == XFIXNUM (r->new_pixel))
  4901             {
  4902               window_resize_apply (r, horflag);
  4903               window_pixel_to_total (r->frame, horflag ? Qt : Qnil);
  4904             }
  4905         }
  4906     }
  4907 
  4908   if (FRAME_HAS_MINIBUF_P (f) && !FRAME_MINIBUF_ONLY_P (f))
  4909     {
  4910       m = XWINDOW (mini);
  4911       if (horflag)
  4912         {
  4913           m->total_cols = new_size;
  4914           m->pixel_width = new_pixel_size;
  4915         }
  4916       else
  4917         {
  4918           m->total_lines = mini_height / unit;
  4919           m->pixel_height = mini_height;
  4920           m->top_line = r->top_line + r->total_lines;
  4921           m->pixel_top = r->pixel_top + r->pixel_height;
  4922         }
  4923     }
  4924 
  4925   fset_redisplay (f);
  4926 }
  4927 
  4928 
  4929 DEFUN ("split-window-internal", Fsplit_window_internal, Ssplit_window_internal, 4, 4, 0,
  4930        doc: /* Split window OLD.
  4931 Second argument PIXEL-SIZE specifies the number of pixels of the
  4932 new window.  It must be a positive integer.
  4933 
  4934 Third argument SIDE nil (or `below') specifies that the new window shall
  4935 be located below WINDOW.  SIDE `above' means the new window shall be
  4936 located above WINDOW.  In both cases PIXEL-SIZE specifies the pixel
  4937 height of the new window including space reserved for the mode and/or
  4938 header/tab line.
  4939 
  4940 SIDE t (or `right') specifies that the new window shall be located on
  4941 the right side of WINDOW.  SIDE `left' means the new window shall be
  4942 located on the left of WINDOW.  In both cases PIXEL-SIZE specifies the
  4943 width of the new window including space reserved for fringes and the
  4944 scrollbar or a divider column.
  4945 
  4946 Fourth argument NORMAL-SIZE specifies the normal size of the new window
  4947 according to the SIDE argument.
  4948 
  4949 The new pixel and normal sizes of all involved windows must have been
  4950 set correctly.  See the code of `split-window' for how this is done.  */)
  4951   (Lisp_Object old, Lisp_Object pixel_size, Lisp_Object side, Lisp_Object normal_size)
  4952 {
  4953   /* OLD (*o) is the window we have to split.  (*p) is either OLD's
  4954      parent window or an internal window we have to install as OLD's new
  4955      parent.  REFERENCE (*r) must denote a live window, or is set to OLD
  4956      provided OLD is a leaf window, or to the frame's selected window.
  4957      NEW (*n) is the new window created with some parameters taken from
  4958      REFERENCE (*r).  */
  4959   Lisp_Object new, frame, reference;
  4960   struct window *o, *p, *n, *r, *c;
  4961   struct frame *f;
  4962   bool horflag
  4963     /* HORFLAG is true when we split side-by-side, false otherwise.  */
  4964     = EQ (side, Qt) || EQ (side, Qleft) || EQ (side, Qright);
  4965 
  4966   CHECK_WINDOW (old);
  4967   o = XWINDOW (old);
  4968   frame = WINDOW_FRAME (o);
  4969   f = XFRAME (frame);
  4970 
  4971   CHECK_FIXNUM (pixel_size);
  4972   EMACS_INT total_size
  4973     = XFIXNUM (pixel_size) / (horflag
  4974                            ? FRAME_COLUMN_WIDTH (f)
  4975                            : FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f));
  4976 
  4977   /* Set combination_limit if we have to make a new parent window.
  4978      We do that if either `window-combination-limit' is t, or OLD has no
  4979      parent, or OLD is ortho-combined.  */
  4980   bool combination_limit
  4981     = (EQ (Vwindow_combination_limit, Qt)
  4982        || NILP (o->parent)
  4983        || (horflag
  4984            ? WINDOW_VERTICAL_COMBINATION_P (XWINDOW (o->parent))
  4985            : WINDOW_HORIZONTAL_COMBINATION_P (XWINDOW (o->parent))));
  4986 
  4987   /* We need a live reference window to initialize some parameters.  */
  4988   if (WINDOW_LIVE_P (old))
  4989     /* OLD is live, use it as reference window.  */
  4990     reference = old;
  4991   else
  4992     /* Use the frame's selected window as reference window.  */
  4993     reference = FRAME_SELECTED_WINDOW (f);
  4994   r = XWINDOW (reference);
  4995 
  4996   /* The following bugs are caught by `split-window'.  */
  4997   if (MINI_WINDOW_P (o))
  4998     error ("Attempt to split minibuffer window");
  4999   else if (total_size < (horflag ? 2 : 1))
  5000     error ("Size of new window too small (after split)");
  5001   else if (!combination_limit && !NILP (Vwindow_combination_resize))
  5002     /* `window-combination-resize' non-nil means try to resize OLD's siblings
  5003        proportionally.  */
  5004     {
  5005       p = XWINDOW (o->parent);
  5006       /* Temporarily pretend we split the parent window.  */
  5007       wset_new_pixel
  5008         (p, make_fixnum ((horflag ? p->pixel_width : p->pixel_height)
  5009                          - XFIXNUM (pixel_size)));
  5010       if (!window_resize_check (p, horflag))
  5011         error ("Window sizes don't fit");
  5012       else
  5013         /* Undo the temporary pretension.  */
  5014         wset_new_pixel (p, make_fixnum (horflag ? p->pixel_width : p->pixel_height));
  5015     }
  5016   else
  5017     {
  5018       if (!window_resize_check (o, horflag))
  5019         error ("Resizing old window failed");
  5020       else if (XFIXNUM (pixel_size) + XFIXNUM (o->new_pixel)
  5021                != (horflag ? o->pixel_width : o->pixel_height))
  5022         error ("Sum of sizes of old and new window don't fit");
  5023     }
  5024 
  5025   /* This is our point of no return.  */
  5026   if (combination_limit)
  5027     {
  5028       /* Save the old value of o->normal_cols/lines.  It gets corrupted
  5029          by make_parent_window and we need it below for assigning it to
  5030          p->new_normal.  */
  5031       Lisp_Object new_normal
  5032         = horflag ? o->normal_cols : o->normal_lines;
  5033 
  5034       make_parent_window (old, horflag);
  5035       p = XWINDOW (o->parent);
  5036       if (EQ (Vwindow_combination_limit, Qt))
  5037         /* Store t in the new parent's combination_limit slot to avoid
  5038            that its children get merged into another window.  */
  5039         wset_combination_limit (p, Qt);
  5040       /* These get applied below.  */
  5041       wset_new_pixel
  5042         (p, make_fixnum (horflag ? o->pixel_width : o->pixel_height));
  5043       wset_new_total
  5044         (p, make_fixnum (horflag ? o->total_cols : o->total_lines));
  5045       wset_new_normal (p, new_normal);
  5046     }
  5047   else
  5048     p = XWINDOW (o->parent);
  5049 
  5050   fset_redisplay (f);
  5051   new = make_window ();
  5052   n = XWINDOW (new);
  5053   wset_frame (n, frame);
  5054   wset_parent (n, o->parent);
  5055 
  5056   if (EQ (side, Qabove) || EQ (side, Qleft))
  5057     {
  5058       wset_prev (n, o->prev);
  5059       if (NILP (n->prev))
  5060         wset_combination (p, horflag, new);
  5061       else
  5062         wset_next (XWINDOW (n->prev), new);
  5063       wset_next (n, old);
  5064       wset_prev (o, new);
  5065     }
  5066   else
  5067     {
  5068       wset_next (n, o->next);
  5069       if (!NILP (n->next))
  5070         wset_prev (XWINDOW (n->next), new);
  5071       wset_prev (n, old);
  5072       wset_next (o, new);
  5073     }
  5074 
  5075   n->window_end_valid = false;
  5076   n->last_cursor_vpos = 0;
  5077 
  5078   /* Get special geometry settings from reference window.  */
  5079   n->left_margin_cols = r->left_margin_cols;
  5080   n->right_margin_cols = r->right_margin_cols;
  5081   n->left_fringe_width = r->left_fringe_width;
  5082   n->right_fringe_width = r->right_fringe_width;
  5083   n->fringes_outside_margins = r->fringes_outside_margins;
  5084   n->scroll_bar_width = r->scroll_bar_width;
  5085   n->scroll_bar_height = r->scroll_bar_height;
  5086   wset_vertical_scroll_bar_type (n, r->vertical_scroll_bar_type);
  5087   wset_horizontal_scroll_bar_type (n, r->horizontal_scroll_bar_type);
  5088 
  5089   /* Directly assign orthogonal coordinates and sizes.  */
  5090   if (horflag)
  5091     {
  5092       n->pixel_top = o->pixel_top;
  5093       n->top_line = o->top_line;
  5094       n->pixel_height = o->pixel_height;
  5095       n->total_lines = o->total_lines;
  5096     }
  5097   else
  5098     {
  5099       n->pixel_left = o->pixel_left;
  5100       n->left_col = o->left_col;
  5101       n->pixel_width = o->pixel_width;
  5102       n->total_cols = o->total_cols;
  5103     }
  5104 
  5105   /* Iso-coordinates and sizes are assigned by window_resize_apply,
  5106      get them ready here.  */
  5107   wset_new_pixel (n, pixel_size);
  5108   EMACS_INT sum = 0;
  5109   c = XWINDOW (p->contents);
  5110   while (c)
  5111     {
  5112       if (c != n)
  5113         sum = sum + XFIXNUM (c->new_total);
  5114       c = NILP (c->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (c->next);
  5115     }
  5116   wset_new_total (n, make_fixnum ((horflag
  5117                                    ? p->total_cols
  5118                                    : p->total_lines)
  5119                                   - sum));
  5120   wset_new_normal (n, normal_size);
  5121 
  5122   block_input ();
  5123   window_resize_apply (p, horflag);
  5124   adjust_frame_glyphs (f);
  5125   /* Set buffer of NEW to buffer of reference window.  */
  5126   set_window_buffer (new, r->contents, true, true);
  5127   FRAME_WINDOW_CHANGE (f) = true;
  5128   unblock_input ();
  5129 
  5130   return new;
  5131 }
  5132 
  5133 
  5134 DEFUN ("delete-window-internal", Fdelete_window_internal, Sdelete_window_internal, 1, 1, 0,
  5135        doc: /* Remove WINDOW from its frame.
  5136 WINDOW defaults to the selected window.  Return nil.
  5137 Signal an error when WINDOW is the only window on its frame.  */)
  5138      (Lisp_Object window)
  5139 {
  5140   Lisp_Object parent, sibling, frame, root;
  5141   struct window *w, *p, *s, *r;
  5142   struct frame *f;
  5143   bool horflag, before_sibling = false;
  5144 
  5145   w = decode_any_window (window);
  5146   XSETWINDOW (window, w);
  5147   if (NILP (w->contents))
  5148     /* It's a no-op to delete an already deleted window.  */
  5149     return Qnil;
  5150 
  5151   parent = w->parent;
  5152   if (NILP (parent))
  5153     /* Never delete a minibuffer or frame root window.  */
  5154     error ("Attempt to delete minibuffer or sole ordinary window");
  5155   else if (NILP (w->prev) && NILP (w->next))
  5156     /* Rather bow out here, this case should be handled on the Elisp
  5157        level.  */
  5158     error ("Attempt to delete sole window of parent");
  5159 
  5160   p = XWINDOW (parent);
  5161   horflag = WINDOW_HORIZONTAL_COMBINATION_P (p);
  5162 
  5163   frame = WINDOW_FRAME (w);
  5164   f = XFRAME (frame);
  5165 
  5166   root = FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f);
  5167   r = XWINDOW (root);
  5168 
  5169   /* Unlink WINDOW from window tree.  */
  5170   if (NILP (w->prev))
  5171     /* Get SIBLING below (on the right of) WINDOW.  */
  5172     {
  5173       /* before_sibling means WINDOW is the first child of its
  5174          parent and thus before the sibling.  */
  5175       before_sibling = true;
  5176       sibling = w->next;
  5177       s = XWINDOW (sibling);
  5178       wset_prev (s, Qnil);
  5179       wset_combination (p, horflag, sibling);
  5180     }
  5181   else
  5182     /* Get SIBLING above (on the left of) WINDOW.  */
  5183     {
  5184       sibling = w->prev;
  5185       s = XWINDOW (sibling);
  5186       wset_next (s, w->next);
  5187       if (!NILP (s->next))
  5188         wset_prev (XWINDOW (s->next), sibling);
  5189     }
  5190 
  5191   if (window_resize_check (r, horflag)
  5192       && (XFIXNUM (r->new_pixel)
  5193           == (horflag ? r->pixel_width : r->pixel_height)))
  5194     /* We can delete WINDOW now.  */
  5195     {
  5196 
  5197       /* Block input.  */
  5198       block_input ();
  5199       xwidget_view_delete_all_in_window (w);
  5200       window_resize_apply (p, horflag);
  5201       /* If this window is referred to by the dpyinfo's mouse
  5202          highlight, invalidate that slot to be safe (Bug#9904).  */
  5203       if (!FRAME_INITIAL_P (f))
  5204         {
  5205           Mouse_HLInfo *hlinfo = MOUSE_HL_INFO (f);
  5206 
  5207           if (EQ (hlinfo->mouse_face_window, window))
  5208             hlinfo->mouse_face_window = Qnil;
  5209         }
  5210 
  5211       fset_redisplay (f);
  5212       Vwindow_list = Qnil;
  5213 
  5214       wset_next (w, Qnil);  /* Don't delete w->next too.  */
  5215       free_window_matrices (w);
  5216 
  5217       if (WINDOWP (w->contents))
  5218         {
  5219           delete_all_child_windows (w->contents);
  5220           wset_combination (w, false, Qnil);
  5221         }
  5222       else
  5223         {
  5224           unshow_buffer (w);
  5225           unchain_marker (XMARKER (w->pointm));
  5226           unchain_marker (XMARKER (w->old_pointm));
  5227           unchain_marker (XMARKER (w->start));
  5228           wset_buffer (w, Qnil);
  5229         }
  5230 
  5231       if (NILP (s->prev) && NILP (s->next))
  5232           /* A matrjoshka where SIBLING has become the only child of
  5233              PARENT.  */
  5234         {
  5235           /* Put SIBLING into PARENT's place.  */
  5236           replace_window (parent, sibling, false);
  5237           /* Have SIBLING inherit the following three slot values from
  5238              PARENT (the combination_limit slot is not inherited).  */
  5239           wset_normal_cols (s, p->normal_cols);
  5240           wset_normal_lines (s, p->normal_lines);
  5241           /* Mark PARENT as deleted.  */
  5242           wset_combination (p, false, Qnil);
  5243           /* Try to merge SIBLING into its new parent.  */
  5244           recombine_windows (sibling);
  5245         }
  5246 
  5247       adjust_frame_glyphs (f);
  5248 
  5249       if (!WINDOW_LIVE_P (FRAME_SELECTED_WINDOW (f)))
  5250         /* We apparently deleted the frame's selected window; use the
  5251            frame's first window as substitute but don't record it yet.
  5252            `delete-window' may have something better up its sleeves.  */
  5253         {
  5254           /* Use the frame's first window as fallback ...  */
  5255           Lisp_Object new_selected_window = Fframe_first_window (frame);
  5256 
  5257           if (EQ (FRAME_SELECTED_WINDOW (f), selected_window))
  5258             Fselect_window (new_selected_window, Qt);
  5259           else
  5260             /* Do not clear f->select_mini_window_flag here.  If the
  5261                last selected window on F was an active minibuffer, we
  5262                want to return to it on a later Fselect_frame.  */
  5263             fset_selected_window (f, new_selected_window);
  5264         }
  5265 
  5266       unblock_input ();
  5267       FRAME_WINDOW_CHANGE (f) = true;
  5268     }
  5269   else
  5270     /* We failed: Relink WINDOW into window tree.  */
  5271     {
  5272       if (before_sibling)
  5273         {
  5274           wset_prev (s, window);
  5275           wset_combination (p, horflag, window);
  5276         }
  5277       else
  5278         {
  5279           wset_next (s, window);
  5280           if (!NILP (w->next))
  5281             wset_prev (XWINDOW (w->next), window);
  5282         }
  5283       error ("Deletion failed");
  5284     }
  5285 
  5286   return Qnil;
  5287 }
  5288 
  5289 /***********************************************************************
  5290                         Resizing Mini-Windows
  5291  ***********************************************************************/
  5292 
  5293 /**
  5294  * resize_mini_window_apply:
  5295  *
  5296  * Assign new window sizes after resizing a mini window W by DELTA
  5297  * pixels.  No error checking performed.
  5298   */
  5299 static void
  5300 resize_mini_window_apply (struct window *w, int delta)
  5301 {
  5302   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
  5303   Lisp_Object root = FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f);
  5304   struct window *r = XWINDOW (root);
  5305 
  5306   block_input ();
  5307   w->pixel_height = w->pixel_height + delta;
  5308   w->total_lines = w->pixel_height / FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f);
  5309 
  5310   window_resize_apply (r, false);
  5311 
  5312   w->pixel_top = r->pixel_top + r->pixel_height;
  5313   w->top_line = r->top_line + r->total_lines;
  5314 
  5315   /* Enforce full redisplay of the frame.  */
  5316   /* FIXME: Shouldn't some of the caller do it?  */
  5317   fset_redisplay (f);
  5318   adjust_frame_glyphs (f);
  5319   unblock_input ();
  5320 }
  5321 
  5322 /**
  5323  * grow_mini_window:
  5324  *
  5325  * Grow mini-window W by DELTA pixels.  If DELTA is negative, this may
  5326  * shrink the minibuffer window to the minimum height to display one
  5327  * line of text.
  5328  */
  5329 void
  5330 grow_mini_window (struct window *w, int delta)
  5331 {
  5332   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
  5333   int old_height = window_body_height (w, WINDOW_BODY_IN_PIXELS);
  5334   int min_height = FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f);
  5335 
  5336   eassert (MINI_WINDOW_P (w));
  5337 
  5338   /* Never shrink mini-window to less than its minimum height.  */
  5339   if (old_height + delta < min_height)
  5340     delta = old_height > min_height ? min_height - old_height : 0;
  5341 
  5342   if (delta != 0)
  5343     {
  5344       Lisp_Object root = FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f);
  5345       struct window *r = XWINDOW (root);
  5346       Lisp_Object grow;
  5347 
  5348       FRAME_WINDOWS_FROZEN (f) = true;
  5349       grow = call3 (Qwindow__resize_root_window_vertically,
  5350                     root, make_fixnum (- delta), Qt);
  5351 
  5352       if (FIXNUMP (grow) && window_resize_check (r, false))
  5353         resize_mini_window_apply (w, -XFIXNUM (grow));
  5354     }
  5355 }
  5356 
  5357 /**
  5358  * shrink_mini_window:
  5359  *
  5360  * Shrink mini-window W to the minimum height needed to display one
  5361  * line of text.
  5362  */
  5363 void
  5364 shrink_mini_window (struct window *w)
  5365 {
  5366   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
  5367   int delta = (window_body_height (w, WINDOW_BODY_IN_PIXELS)
  5368                - FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f));
  5369 
  5370   eassert (MINI_WINDOW_P (w));
  5371 
  5372   if (delta > 0)
  5373     {
  5374       Lisp_Object root = FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f);
  5375       struct window *r = XWINDOW (root);
  5376       Lisp_Object grow;
  5377 
  5378       FRAME_WINDOWS_FROZEN (f) = false;
  5379       grow = call3 (Qwindow__resize_root_window_vertically,
  5380                     root, make_fixnum (delta), Qt);
  5381 
  5382       if (FIXNUMP (grow) && window_resize_check (r, false))
  5383         resize_mini_window_apply (w, -XFIXNUM (grow));
  5384     }
  5385   else if (delta < 0)
  5386     /* delta can be less than zero after adding horizontal scroll
  5387        bar.  */
  5388     grow_mini_window (w, -delta);
  5389 
  5390 }
  5391 
  5392 DEFUN ("resize-mini-window-internal", Fresize_mini_window_internal,
  5393        Sresize_mini_window_internal, 1, 1, 0,
  5394        doc: /* Resize mini window WINDOW.  */)
  5395      (Lisp_Object window)
  5396 {
  5397   struct window *w = XWINDOW (window);
  5398   struct window *r;
  5399   struct frame *f;
  5400   int old_height, delta;
  5401 
  5402   CHECK_LIVE_WINDOW (window);
  5403   f = XFRAME (w->frame);
  5404 
  5405   if (!EQ (FRAME_MINIBUF_WINDOW (XFRAME (w->frame)), window))
  5406     error ("Not a valid minibuffer window");
  5407   else if (FRAME_MINIBUF_ONLY_P (f))
  5408     error ("Cannot resize a minibuffer-only frame");
  5409 
  5410   r = XWINDOW (FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f));
  5411   old_height = r->pixel_height + w->pixel_height;
  5412   delta = XFIXNUM (w->new_pixel) - w->pixel_height;
  5413   if (window_resize_check (r, false)
  5414       && XFIXNUM (w->new_pixel) > 0
  5415       && old_height == XFIXNUM (r->new_pixel) + XFIXNUM (w->new_pixel))
  5416     {
  5417       resize_mini_window_apply (w, delta);
  5418 
  5419       return Qt;
  5420     }
  5421   else
  5422     error ("Cannot resize mini window");
  5423 }
  5424 
  5425 /* Mark window cursors off for all windows in the window tree rooted
  5426    at W by setting their phys_cursor_on_p flag to zero.  Called from
  5427    xterm.c, e.g. when a frame is cleared and thereby all cursors on
  5428    the frame are cleared.  */
  5429 
  5430 void
  5431 mark_window_cursors_off (struct window *w)
  5432 {
  5433   while (w)
  5434     {
  5435       if (WINDOWP (w->contents))
  5436         mark_window_cursors_off (XWINDOW (w->contents));
  5437       else
  5438         w->phys_cursor_on_p = false;
  5439 
  5440       w = NILP (w->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (w->next);
  5441     }
  5442 }
  5443 
  5444 
  5445 /**
  5446  * window_wants_mode_line:
  5447  *
  5448  * Return 1 if window W wants a mode line and is high enough to
  5449  * accommodate it, 0 otherwise.
  5450  *
  5451  * W wants a mode line if it's a leaf window and neither a minibuffer
  5452  * nor a pseudo window.  Moreover, its 'window-mode-line-format'
  5453  * parameter must not be 'none' and either that parameter or W's
  5454  * buffer's 'mode-line-format' value must be non-nil.  Finally, W must
  5455  * be higher than its frame's canonical character height.
  5456  */
  5457 bool
  5458 window_wants_mode_line (struct window *w)
  5459 {
  5460   Lisp_Object window_mode_line_format =
  5461     window_parameter (w, Qmode_line_format);
  5462 
  5463   return (WINDOW_LEAF_P (w)
  5464           && !MINI_WINDOW_P (w)
  5465           && !WINDOW_PSEUDO_P (w)
  5466           && !EQ (window_mode_line_format, Qnone)
  5467           && (!NILP (window_mode_line_format)
  5468               || !NILP (BVAR (XBUFFER (WINDOW_BUFFER (w)), mode_line_format)))
  5469           && WINDOW_PIXEL_HEIGHT (w) > WINDOW_FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (w));
  5470 }
  5471 
  5472 
  5473 /**
  5474  * window_wants_header_line:
  5475  *
  5476  * Return 1 if window W wants a header line and is high enough to
  5477  * accommodate it, 0 otherwise.
  5478  *
  5479  * W wants a header line if it's a leaf window and neither a
  5480  * minibuffer nor a pseudo window.  Moreover, its
  5481  * 'window-header-line-format' parameter must not be 'none' and either
  5482  * that parameter or W's buffer's 'header-line-format' value must be
  5483  * non-nil.  Finally, W must be higher than its frame's canonical
  5484  * character height and be able to accommodate a mode line too if
  5485  * necessary (the mode line prevails).
  5486  */
  5487 bool
  5488 window_wants_header_line (struct window *w)
  5489 {
  5490   Lisp_Object window_header_line_format =
  5491     window_parameter (w, Qheader_line_format);
  5492 
  5493   return (WINDOW_LEAF_P (w)
  5494           && !MINI_WINDOW_P (w)
  5495           && !WINDOW_PSEUDO_P (w)
  5496           && !EQ (window_header_line_format, Qnone)
  5497           && (!NILP (window_header_line_format)
  5498               || !NILP (BVAR (XBUFFER (WINDOW_BUFFER (w)), header_line_format)))
  5499           && (WINDOW_PIXEL_HEIGHT (w)
  5500               > (window_wants_mode_line (w)
  5501                  ? 2 * WINDOW_FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (w)
  5502                  : WINDOW_FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (w))));
  5503 }
  5504 
  5505 
  5506 /**
  5507  * window_wants_tab_line:
  5508  *
  5509  * Return 1 if window W wants a tab line and is high enough to
  5510  * accommodate it, 0 otherwise.
  5511  *
  5512  * W wants a tab line if it's a leaf window and neither a minibuffer
  5513  * nor a pseudo window.  Moreover, its 'window-tab-line-format'
  5514  * parameter must not be 'none' and either that parameter or W's
  5515  * buffer's 'tab-line-format' value must be non-nil.  Finally, W must
  5516  * be higher than its frame's canonical character height and be able
  5517  * to accommodate a mode line and a header line too if necessary (the
  5518  * mode line and a header line prevail).
  5519  */
  5520 
  5521 bool
  5522 window_wants_tab_line (struct window *w)
  5523 {
  5524   Lisp_Object window_tab_line_format =
  5525     window_parameter (w, Qtab_line_format);
  5526 
  5527   return (WINDOW_LEAF_P (w)
  5528           && !MINI_WINDOW_P (w)
  5529           && !WINDOW_PSEUDO_P (w)
  5530           && !EQ (window_tab_line_format, Qnone)
  5531           && (!NILP (window_tab_line_format)
  5532               || !NILP (BVAR (XBUFFER (WINDOW_BUFFER (w)), tab_line_format)))
  5533           && (WINDOW_PIXEL_HEIGHT (w)
  5534               > (((window_wants_mode_line (w) ? 1 : 0)
  5535                   + (window_wants_header_line (w) ? 1 : 0)
  5536                   + 1) * WINDOW_FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (w))));
  5537 }
  5538 
  5539 /* Return number of lines of text in window W, not counting the mode
  5540    line and header line, if any.  Do NOT use this for windows on GUI
  5541    frames; use window_body_height instead.  This function is only for
  5542    windows on TTY frames, where it is much more efficient.  */
  5543 
  5544 int
  5545 window_internal_height (struct window *w)
  5546 {
  5547   int ht = w->total_lines;
  5548 
  5549   if (window_wants_mode_line (w))
  5550     --ht;
  5551 
  5552   if (window_wants_header_line (w))
  5553     --ht;
  5554 
  5555   if (window_wants_tab_line (w))
  5556     --ht;
  5557 
  5558   return ht;
  5559 }
  5560 
  5561 
  5562 /************************************************************************
  5563                            Window Scrolling
  5564  ***********************************************************************/
  5565 
  5566 /* Scroll contents of window WINDOW up.  If WHOLE, scroll
  5567    N screen-fulls, which is defined as the height of the window minus
  5568    next_screen_context_lines.  If WHOLE is zero, scroll up N lines
  5569    instead.  Negative values of N mean scroll down.  NOERROR
  5570    means don't signal an error if we try to move over BEGV or ZV,
  5571    respectively.  */
  5572 
  5573 static void
  5574 window_scroll (Lisp_Object window, EMACS_INT n, bool whole, bool noerror)
  5575 {
  5576   struct window *w = XWINDOW (window);
  5577   struct buffer *b = XBUFFER (w->contents);
  5578   bool long_lines_truncated =
  5579     b->long_line_optimizations_p && !NILP (BVAR (b, truncate_lines));
  5580   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  5581 
  5582   n = clip_to_bounds (INT_MIN, n, INT_MAX);
  5583 
  5584   wset_redisplay (w);
  5585 
  5586   /* Does this window's buffer have very long and truncated lines?  */
  5587   if (b->long_line_optimizations_p
  5588       && !long_lines_truncated
  5589       && !NILP (Vtruncate_partial_width_windows)
  5590       && w->total_cols < FRAME_COLS (XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w))))
  5591     {
  5592       if (FIXNUMP (Vtruncate_partial_width_windows))
  5593         long_lines_truncated =
  5594           w->total_cols < XFIXNAT (Vtruncate_partial_width_windows);
  5595       else
  5596         long_lines_truncated = true;
  5597     }
  5598 
  5599   if (whole && (fast_but_imprecise_scrolling || long_lines_truncated))
  5600     specbind (Qfontification_functions, Qnil);
  5601 
  5602   if (whole && long_lines_truncated)
  5603     window_scroll_for_long_lines (w, n, noerror);
  5604   else if (FRAME_WINDOW_P (XFRAME (XWINDOW (window)->frame)))
  5605     {
  5606 
  5607       /* On GUI frames, use the pixel-based version which is much
  5608          slower than the line-based one, but can handle varying
  5609          line heights.  */
  5610       record_unwind_protect_void (unwind_display_working_on_window);
  5611       display_working_on_window_p = true;
  5612       window_scroll_pixel_based (window, n, whole, noerror);
  5613     }
  5614   else
  5615     window_scroll_line_based (window, n, whole, noerror);
  5616 
  5617   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  5618 
  5619   /* Bug#15957.  */
  5620   XWINDOW (window)->window_end_valid = false;
  5621 }
  5622 
  5623 /* Compute scroll margin for WINDOW.
  5624    We scroll when point is within this distance from the top or bottom
  5625    of the window.  The result is measured in lines or in pixels
  5626    depending on the second parameter.  */
  5627 int
  5628 window_scroll_margin (struct window *window, enum margin_unit unit)
  5629 {
  5630   if (scroll_margin > 0)
  5631     {
  5632       int frame_line_height = default_line_pixel_height (window);
  5633       int window_lines = window_box_height (window) / frame_line_height;
  5634 
  5635       double ratio = 0.25;
  5636       if (FLOATP (Vmaximum_scroll_margin))
  5637         {
  5638           ratio = XFLOAT_DATA (Vmaximum_scroll_margin);
  5639           ratio = max (0.0, ratio);
  5640           ratio = min (ratio, 0.5);
  5641         }
  5642       int max_margin = min ((window_lines - 1)/2,
  5643                             (int) (window_lines * ratio));
  5644       int margin = clip_to_bounds (0, scroll_margin, max_margin);
  5645       return (unit == MARGIN_IN_PIXELS)
  5646         ? margin * frame_line_height
  5647         : margin;
  5648     }
  5649   else
  5650     return 0;
  5651 }
  5652 
  5653 static int
  5654 sanitize_next_screen_context_lines (void)
  5655 {
  5656   return clip_to_bounds (0, next_screen_context_lines, 1000000);
  5657 }
  5658 
  5659 /* Implementation of window_scroll for very long and truncated lines.
  5660    This is a simplified version, it only handles WHOLE window scrolls,
  5661    and doesn't honor scroll-preserve-screen-position nor scroll-margin.  */
  5662 static void
  5663 window_scroll_for_long_lines (struct window *w, int n, bool noerror)
  5664 {
  5665   ptrdiff_t startpos = marker_position (w->start);
  5666   ptrdiff_t startbyte = marker_byte_position (w->start);
  5667   int nscls = sanitize_next_screen_context_lines ();
  5668   register int ht = window_internal_height (w);
  5669 
  5670   n *= max (1, ht - nscls);
  5671 
  5672   /* If point is not visible in window, bring it inside window.  */
  5673   struct position pos;
  5674   int rtop, rbot, dummy_rowh, dummy_vpos, dummy_x, dummy_y;
  5675   if (!(PT >= startpos
  5676         && PT <= ZV
  5677         && startpos <= ZV
  5678         && pos_visible_p (w, PT, &dummy_x, &dummy_y, &rtop, &rbot, &dummy_rowh,
  5679                           &dummy_vpos)
  5680         && !rtop && !rbot))
  5681     {
  5682       pos = *vmotion (PT, PT_BYTE, - (ht / 2), w);
  5683       startpos = pos.bufpos;
  5684       startbyte = pos.bytepos;
  5685     }
  5686   SET_PT_BOTH (startpos, startbyte);
  5687 
  5688   bool lose = n < 0 && PT == BEGV;
  5689   pos = *vmotion (PT, PT_BYTE, n, w);
  5690   if (lose)
  5691     {
  5692       if (noerror)
  5693         return;
  5694       else
  5695         xsignal0 (Qbeginning_of_buffer);
  5696     }
  5697 
  5698   bool bolp = pos.bufpos == BEGV || FETCH_BYTE (pos.bytepos - 1) == '\n';
  5699   if (pos.bufpos < ZV)
  5700     {
  5701       set_marker_restricted_both (w->start, w->contents,
  5702                                   pos.bufpos, pos.bytepos);
  5703       w->start_at_line_beg = bolp;
  5704       wset_update_mode_line (w);
  5705       /* Set force_start so that redisplay_window will run
  5706          the window-scroll-functions.  */
  5707       w->force_start = true;
  5708       SET_PT_BOTH (pos.bufpos, pos.bytepos);
  5709       if (n > 0)
  5710         pos = *vmotion (PT, PT_BYTE, ht / 2, w);
  5711       else if (n < 0)
  5712         pos = *vmotion (PT, PT_BYTE, - (ht / 2), w);
  5713       SET_PT_BOTH (pos.bufpos, pos.bytepos);
  5714     }
  5715   else
  5716     {
  5717       if (noerror)
  5718         return;
  5719       else
  5720         xsignal0 (Qend_of_buffer);
  5721     }
  5722 }
  5723 
  5724 /* Implementation of window_scroll that works based on pixel line
  5725    heights.  See the comment of window_scroll for parameter
  5726    descriptions.  */
  5727 
  5728 static void
  5729 window_scroll_pixel_based (Lisp_Object window, int n, bool whole, bool noerror)
  5730 {
  5731   struct it it;
  5732   struct window *w = XWINDOW (window);
  5733   struct text_pos start;
  5734   int this_scroll_margin;
  5735   /* True if we fiddled the window vscroll field without really scrolling.  */
  5736   bool vscrolled = false;
  5737   int x, y, rtop, rbot, rowh, vpos;
  5738   void *itdata = NULL;
  5739   int frame_line_height = default_line_pixel_height (w);
  5740   bool adjust_old_pointm = !NILP (Fequal (Fwindow_point (window),
  5741                                           Fwindow_old_point (window)));
  5742 
  5743   SET_TEXT_POS_FROM_MARKER (start, w->start);
  5744   /* Scrolling a minibuffer window via scroll bar when the echo area
  5745      shows long text sometimes resets the minibuffer contents behind
  5746      our backs.  Also, someone might narrow-to-region and immediately
  5747      call a scroll function.  */
  5748   if (CHARPOS (start) > ZV || CHARPOS (start) < BEGV)
  5749     SET_TEXT_POS (start, BEGV, BEGV_BYTE);
  5750 
  5751   /* If PT is not visible in WINDOW, move back one half of
  5752      the screen.  Allow PT to be partially visible, otherwise
  5753      something like (scroll-down 1) with PT in the line before
  5754      the partially visible one would recenter.  */
  5755 
  5756   if (!pos_visible_p (w, PT, &x, &y, &rtop, &rbot, &rowh, &vpos))
  5757     {
  5758       itdata = bidi_shelve_cache ();
  5759       /* Move backward half the height of the window.  Performance note:
  5760          vmotion used here is about 10% faster, but would give wrong
  5761          results for variable height lines.  */
  5762       init_iterator (&it, w, PT, PT_BYTE, NULL, DEFAULT_FACE_ID);
  5763       it.current_y = it.last_visible_y;
  5764       move_it_vertically_backward (&it, window_box_height (w) / 2);
  5765 
  5766       /* The function move_iterator_vertically may move over more than
  5767          the specified y-distance.  If it->w is small, e.g. a
  5768          mini-buffer window, we may end up in front of the window's
  5769          display area.  Start displaying at the start of the line
  5770          containing PT in this case.  */
  5771       if (it.current_y <= 0)
  5772         {
  5773           init_iterator (&it, w, PT, PT_BYTE, NULL, DEFAULT_FACE_ID);
  5774           move_it_vertically_backward (&it, 0);
  5775           it.current_y = 0;
  5776         }
  5777 
  5778       start = it.current.pos;
  5779       bidi_unshelve_cache (itdata, false);
  5780     }
  5781   else if (auto_window_vscroll_p)
  5782     {
  5783       if (rtop || rbot)         /* Partially visible.  */
  5784         {
  5785           int px;
  5786           int dy = frame_line_height;
  5787           /* In the below we divide the window box height by the
  5788              frame's line height to make the result predictable when
  5789              the window box is not an integral multiple of the line
  5790              height.  This is important to ensure we get back to the
  5791              same position when scrolling up, then down.  */
  5792           if (whole)
  5793             {
  5794               int ht = window_box_height (w);
  5795               int nscls = sanitize_next_screen_context_lines ();
  5796               dy = max (dy, (ht / dy - nscls) * dy);
  5797             }
  5798           dy *= n;
  5799 
  5800           if (n < 0)
  5801             {
  5802               /* Only vscroll backwards if already vscrolled forwards.  */
  5803               if (w->vscroll < 0 && rtop > 0)
  5804                 {
  5805                   px = max (0, -w->vscroll - min (rtop, -dy));
  5806                   Fset_window_vscroll (window, make_fixnum (px), Qt,
  5807                                        Qnil);
  5808                   return;
  5809                 }
  5810             }
  5811           if (n > 0)
  5812             {
  5813               /* Do vscroll if already vscrolled or only display line.  */
  5814               if (rbot > 0 && (w->vscroll < 0 || vpos == 0))
  5815                 {
  5816                   px = max (0, -w->vscroll + min (rbot, dy));
  5817                   Fset_window_vscroll (window, make_fixnum (px), Qt,
  5818                                        Qnil);
  5819                   return;
  5820                 }
  5821 
  5822               /* Maybe modify window start instead of scrolling.  */
  5823               if (rbot > 0 || w->vscroll < 0)
  5824                 {
  5825                   ptrdiff_t spos;
  5826 
  5827                   Fset_window_vscroll (window, make_fixnum (0), Qt,
  5828                                        Qnil);
  5829                   /* If there are other text lines above the current row,
  5830                      move window start to current row.  Else to next row. */
  5831                   if (rbot > 0)
  5832                     spos = XFIXNUM (Fline_beginning_position (Qnil));
  5833                   else
  5834                     spos = min (XFIXNUM (Fline_end_position (Qnil)) + 1, ZV);
  5835                   set_marker_restricted (w->start, make_fixnum (spos),
  5836                                          w->contents);
  5837                   w->start_at_line_beg = true;
  5838                   wset_update_mode_line (w);
  5839                   /* Set force_start so that redisplay_window will run the
  5840                      window-scroll-functions.  */
  5841                   w->force_start = true;
  5842                   return;
  5843                 }
  5844             }
  5845         }
  5846       /* Cancel previous vscroll.  */
  5847       Fset_window_vscroll (window, make_fixnum (0), Qt, Qnil);
  5848     }
  5849 
  5850   itdata = bidi_shelve_cache ();
  5851   /* If scroll_preserve_screen_position is non-nil, we try to set
  5852      point in the same window line as it is now, so get that line.  */
  5853   if (!NILP (Vscroll_preserve_screen_position))
  5854     {
  5855       /* We preserve the goal pixel coordinate across consecutive
  5856          calls to scroll-up, scroll-down and other commands that
  5857          have the `scroll-command' property.  This avoids the
  5858          possibility of point becoming "stuck" on a tall line when
  5859          scrolling by one line.  */
  5860       if (window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y < 0
  5861           || !SYMBOLP (KVAR (current_kboard, Vlast_command))
  5862           || NILP (Fget (KVAR (current_kboard, Vlast_command), Qscroll_command)))
  5863         {
  5864           start_display (&it, w, start);
  5865           move_it_to (&it, PT, -1, -1, -1, MOVE_TO_POS);
  5866           window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y = it.current_y;
  5867           window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_x = it.current_x;
  5868         }
  5869     }
  5870   else
  5871     window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y
  5872       = window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_x = -1;
  5873
