  5874   /* Move iterator it from start the specified distance forward or
  5875      backward.  The result is the new window start.  */
  5876   start_display (&it, w, start);
  5877   if (whole)
  5878     {
  5879       ptrdiff_t start_pos = IT_CHARPOS (it);
  5880       int flh = frame_line_height;
  5881       int ht = window_box_height (w);
  5882       int nscls = sanitize_next_screen_context_lines ();
  5883       /* In the below we divide the window box height by the frame's
  5884          line height to make the result predictable when the window
  5885          box is not an integral multiple of the line height.  This is
  5886          important to ensure we get back to the same position when
  5887          scrolling up, then down.  */
  5888       int dy = n * max (flh, (ht / flh - nscls) * flh);
  5889       int goal_y;
  5890       void *it_data;
  5891 
  5892       /* Note that move_it_vertically always moves the iterator to the
  5893          start of a line.  So, if the last line doesn't have a newline,
  5894          we would end up at the start of the line ending at ZV.  */
  5895       if (dy <= 0)
  5896         {
  5897           goal_y = it.current_y + dy;
  5898           move_it_vertically_backward (&it, -dy);
  5899           /* move_it_vertically_backward above always overshoots if DY
  5900              cannot be reached exactly, i.e. if it falls in the middle
  5901              of a screen line.  But if that screen line is large
  5902              (e.g., a tall image), it might make more sense to
  5903              undershoot instead.  */
  5904           if (goal_y - it.current_y > 0.5 * flh)
  5905             {
  5906               it_data = bidi_shelve_cache ();
  5907               struct it it1 = it;
  5908               if (line_bottom_y (&it1) - goal_y < goal_y - it.current_y)
  5909                 move_it_by_lines (&it, 1);
  5910               bidi_unshelve_cache (it_data, true);
  5911             }
  5912           /* Ensure we actually do move, e.g. in case we are currently
  5913              looking at an image that is taller that the window height.  */
  5914           while (start_pos == IT_CHARPOS (it)
  5915                  && start_pos > BEGV)
  5916             move_it_by_lines (&it, -1);
  5917         }
  5918       else if (dy > 0)
  5919         {
  5920           goal_y = it.current_y + dy;
  5921           move_it_to (&it, ZV, -1, goal_y, -1, MOVE_TO_POS | MOVE_TO_Y);
  5922           /* Extra precision for people who want us to preserve the
  5923              screen position of the cursor: effectively round DY to the
  5924              nearest screen line, instead of rounding to zero; the latter
  5925              causes point to move by one line after C-v followed by M-v,
  5926              if the buffer has lines of different height.  */
  5927           if (!NILP (Vscroll_preserve_screen_position)
  5928               && goal_y - it.current_y  > 0.5 * flh)
  5929             {
  5930               it_data = bidi_shelve_cache ();
  5931               struct it it2 = it;
  5932 
  5933               move_it_by_lines (&it, 1);
  5934               if (it.current_y > goal_y + 0.5 * flh)
  5935                 {
  5936                   it = it2;
  5937                   bidi_unshelve_cache (it_data, false);
  5938                 }
  5939               else
  5940                 bidi_unshelve_cache (it_data, true);
  5941             }
  5942           /* Ensure we actually do move, e.g. in case we are currently
  5943              looking at an image that is taller that the window height.  */
  5944           while (start_pos == IT_CHARPOS (it)
  5945                  && start_pos < ZV)
  5946             move_it_by_lines (&it, 1);
  5947         }
  5948     }
  5949   else
  5950     move_it_by_lines (&it, n);
  5951 
  5952   /* We failed if we find ZV is already on the screen (scrolling up,
  5953      means there's nothing past the end), or if we can't start any
  5954      earlier (scrolling down, means there's nothing past the top).  */
  5955   if ((n > 0 && IT_CHARPOS (it) == ZV)
  5956       || (n < 0 && IT_CHARPOS (it) == CHARPOS (start)))
  5957     {
  5958       if (IT_CHARPOS (it) == ZV)
  5959         {
  5960           if (it.current_y < it.last_visible_y
  5961               && (it.current_y + it.max_ascent + it.max_descent
  5962                   > it.last_visible_y))
  5963             {
  5964               /* The last line was only partially visible, make it fully
  5965                  visible.  */
  5966               w->vscroll = (it.last_visible_y
  5967                             - it.current_y + it.max_ascent + it.max_descent);
  5968               adjust_frame_glyphs (it.f);
  5969             }
  5970           else
  5971             {
  5972               bidi_unshelve_cache (itdata, false);
  5973               if (noerror)
  5974                 return;
  5975               else if (n < 0)   /* could happen with empty buffers */
  5976                 xsignal0 (Qbeginning_of_buffer);
  5977               else
  5978                 xsignal0 (Qend_of_buffer);
  5979             }
  5980         }
  5981       else
  5982         {
  5983           if (w->vscroll != 0)
  5984             /* The first line was only partially visible, make it fully
  5985                visible. */
  5986             w->vscroll = 0;
  5987           else
  5988             {
  5989               bidi_unshelve_cache (itdata, false);
  5990               if (noerror)
  5991                 return;
  5992               else
  5993                 xsignal0 (Qbeginning_of_buffer);
  5994             }
  5995         }
  5996 
  5997       /* If control gets here, then we vscrolled.  */
  5998 
  5999       XBUFFER (w->contents)->prevent_redisplay_optimizations_p = true;
  6000 
  6001       /* Don't try to change the window start below.  */
  6002       vscrolled = true;
  6003     }
  6004 
  6005   if (! vscrolled)
  6006     {
  6007       ptrdiff_t pos = IT_CHARPOS (it);
  6008       ptrdiff_t bytepos;
  6009 
  6010       /* If in the middle of a multi-glyph character move forward to
  6011          the next character.  */
  6012       if (in_display_vector_p (&it))
  6013         {
  6014           ++pos;
  6015           move_it_to (&it, pos, -1, -1, -1, MOVE_TO_POS);
  6016         }
  6017 
  6018       /* Set the window start, and set up the window for redisplay.  */
  6019       set_marker_restricted_both (w->start, w->contents, IT_CHARPOS (it),
  6020                                   IT_BYTEPOS (it));
  6021       bytepos = marker_byte_position (w->start);
  6022       w->start_at_line_beg = (pos == BEGV || FETCH_BYTE (bytepos - 1) == '\n');
  6023       wset_update_mode_line (w);
  6024       /* Set force_start so that redisplay_window will run the
  6025          window-scroll-functions.  */
  6026       w->force_start = true;
  6027     }
  6028 
  6029   /* The rest of this function uses current_y in a nonstandard way,
  6030      not including the height of the header line if any.  */
  6031   it.current_y = it.vpos = 0;
  6032 
  6033   /* Move PT out of scroll margins.
  6034      This code wants current_y to be zero at the window start position
  6035      even if there is a header line.  */
  6036   this_scroll_margin = window_scroll_margin (w, MARGIN_IN_PIXELS);
  6037 
  6038   if (n > 0)
  6039     {
  6040       int last_y = it.last_visible_y - this_scroll_margin - 1;
  6041 
  6042       /* We moved the window start towards ZV, so PT may be now
  6043          in the scroll margin at the top.  */
  6044       if (IT_CHARPOS (it) < PT)
  6045         move_it_to (&it, PT, -1, -1, -1, MOVE_TO_POS);
  6046       if (IT_CHARPOS (it) == PT
  6047           && it.current_y >= this_scroll_margin
  6048           && it.current_y <= last_y - WINDOW_TAB_LINE_HEIGHT (w)
  6049                                     - WINDOW_HEADER_LINE_HEIGHT (w)
  6050           && (NILP (Vscroll_preserve_screen_position)
  6051               || EQ (Vscroll_preserve_screen_position, Qt)))
  6052         /* We found PT at a legitimate height.  Leave it alone.  */
  6053         ;
  6054       else
  6055         {
  6056           if (window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y >= 0)
  6057             {
  6058               /* Don't enter the scroll margin at the end of the window.  */
  6059               int goal_y = min (last_y, window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y);
  6060 
  6061               /* If we have a header line, take account of it.  This
  6062                  is necessary because we set it.current_y to 0, above.  */
  6063               move_it_to (&it, -1,
  6064                           window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_x,
  6065                           goal_y - WINDOW_TAB_LINE_HEIGHT (w)
  6066                                  - WINDOW_HEADER_LINE_HEIGHT (w),
  6067                           -1, MOVE_TO_Y | MOVE_TO_X);
  6068             }
  6069 
  6070           /* Get out of the scroll margin at the top of the window.  */
  6071           while (it.current_y < this_scroll_margin)
  6072             {
  6073               int prev = it.current_y;
  6074               move_it_by_lines (&it, 1);
  6075               if (prev == it.current_y)
  6076                 break;
  6077             }
  6078           SET_PT_BOTH (IT_CHARPOS (it), IT_BYTEPOS (it));
  6079           /* Fix up the Y position to preserve, if it is inside the
  6080              scroll margin at the window top.  */
  6081           if (window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y >= 0
  6082               && window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y < this_scroll_margin)
  6083             window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y = this_scroll_margin;
  6084         }
  6085     }
  6086   else if (n < 0)
  6087     {
  6088       ptrdiff_t charpos, bytepos;
  6089       bool partial_p;
  6090 
  6091       /* Save our position, for the
  6092          window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y case.  */
  6093       charpos = IT_CHARPOS (it);
  6094       bytepos = IT_BYTEPOS (it);
  6095 
  6096       /* We moved the window start towards BEGV, so PT may be now
  6097          in the scroll margin at the bottom.  */
  6098       move_it_to (&it, PT, -1,
  6099                   /* We subtract WINDOW_HEADER_LINE_HEIGHT because
  6100                      it.y is relative to the bottom of the header
  6101                      line, see above.  */
  6102                   (it.last_visible_y - WINDOW_TAB_LINE_HEIGHT (w)
  6103                                      - WINDOW_HEADER_LINE_HEIGHT (w)
  6104                    - partial_line_height (&it) - this_scroll_margin - 1),
  6105                   -1,
  6106                   MOVE_TO_POS | MOVE_TO_Y);
  6107 
  6108       /* Save our position, in case it's correct.  */
  6109       charpos = IT_CHARPOS (it);
  6110       bytepos = IT_BYTEPOS (it);
  6111 
  6112       /* If PT is in the screen line at the last fully visible line,
  6113          move_it_to will stop at X = 0 in that line, because the
  6114          required Y coordinate is reached there.  See if we can get to
  6115          PT without descending lower in Y, and if we can, it means we
  6116          reached PT before the scroll margin.  */
  6117       if (charpos != PT)
  6118         {
  6119           struct it it2;
  6120           void *it_data;
  6121 
  6122           it2 = it;
  6123           it_data = bidi_shelve_cache ();
  6124           move_it_to (&it, PT, -1, -1, -1, MOVE_TO_POS);
  6125           if (IT_CHARPOS (it) == PT && it.current_y == it2.current_y)
  6126             {
  6127               charpos = IT_CHARPOS (it);
  6128               bytepos = IT_BYTEPOS (it);
  6129               bidi_unshelve_cache (it_data, true);
  6130             }
  6131           else
  6132             {
  6133               it = it2;
  6134               bidi_unshelve_cache (it_data, false);
  6135             }
  6136         }
  6137 
  6138       /* See if point is on a partially visible line at the end.  */
  6139       if (it.what == IT_EOB)
  6140         partial_p =
  6141           it.current_y + it.ascent + it.descent
  6142           > it.last_visible_y - this_scroll_margin
  6143           - WINDOW_TAB_LINE_HEIGHT (w) - WINDOW_HEADER_LINE_HEIGHT (w);
  6144       else
  6145         {
  6146           move_it_by_lines (&it, 1);
  6147           partial_p =
  6148             it.current_y
  6149             > it.last_visible_y - this_scroll_margin
  6150               - WINDOW_TAB_LINE_HEIGHT (w) - WINDOW_HEADER_LINE_HEIGHT (w);
  6151         }
  6152 
  6153       if (charpos == PT && !partial_p
  6154           && (NILP (Vscroll_preserve_screen_position)
  6155               || EQ (Vscroll_preserve_screen_position, Qt)))
  6156         /* We found PT before we found the display margin, so PT is ok.  */
  6157         ;
  6158       else if (window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y >= 0)
  6159         {
  6160           int goal_y = min (it.last_visible_y - this_scroll_margin - 1,
  6161                             window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y);
  6162 
  6163           /* Don't let the preserved screen Y coordinate put us inside
  6164              any of the two margins.  */
  6165           if (goal_y < this_scroll_margin)
  6166             goal_y = this_scroll_margin;
  6167           SET_TEXT_POS_FROM_MARKER (start, w->start);
  6168           start_display (&it, w, start);
  6169           /* It would be wrong to subtract WINDOW_HEADER_LINE_HEIGHT
  6170              here because we called start_display again and did not
  6171              alter it.current_y this time.  */
  6172           move_it_to (&it, -1, window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_x,
  6173                       goal_y, -1, MOVE_TO_Y | MOVE_TO_X);
  6174           SET_PT_BOTH (IT_CHARPOS (it), IT_BYTEPOS (it));
  6175         }
  6176       else
  6177         {
  6178           if (partial_p)
  6179             /* The last line was only partially visible, so back up two
  6180                lines to make sure we're on a fully visible line.  */
  6181             {
  6182               move_it_by_lines (&it, -2);
  6183               SET_PT_BOTH (IT_CHARPOS (it), IT_BYTEPOS (it));
  6184             }
  6185           else
  6186             /* No, the position we saved is OK, so use it.  */
  6187             SET_PT_BOTH (charpos, bytepos);
  6188         }
  6189     }
  6190   bidi_unshelve_cache (itdata, false);
  6191 
  6192   if (adjust_old_pointm)
  6193     Fset_marker (w->old_pointm,
  6194                  ((w == XWINDOW (selected_window))
  6195                   ? make_fixnum (BUF_PT (XBUFFER (w->contents)))
  6196                   : Fmarker_position (w->pointm)),
  6197                  w->contents);
  6198 }
  6199 
  6200 
  6201 /* Implementation of window_scroll that works based on screen lines.
  6202    See the comment of window_scroll for parameter descriptions.  */
  6203 
  6204 static void
  6205 window_scroll_line_based (Lisp_Object window, int n, bool whole, bool noerror)
  6206 {
  6207   struct window *w = XWINDOW (window);
  6208   /* Fvertical_motion enters redisplay, which can trigger
  6209      fontification, which in turn can modify buffer text (e.g., if the
  6210      fontification functions replace escape sequences with faces, as
  6211      in `grep-mode-font-lock-keywords').  So we use a marker to record
  6212      the old point position, to prevent crashes in SET_PT_BOTH.  */
  6213   Lisp_Object opoint_marker = Fpoint_marker ();
  6214   register ptrdiff_t pos, pos_byte;
  6215   register int ht = window_internal_height (w);
  6216   register Lisp_Object tem;
  6217   bool lose;
  6218   Lisp_Object bolp;
  6219   ptrdiff_t startpos = marker_position (w->start);
  6220   ptrdiff_t startbyte = marker_byte_position (w->start);
  6221   Lisp_Object original_pos = Qnil;
  6222   bool adjust_old_pointm = !NILP (Fequal (Fwindow_point (window),
  6223                                           Fwindow_old_point (window)));
  6224 
  6225   /* If scrolling screen-fulls, compute the number of lines to
  6226      scroll from the window's height.  */
  6227   if (whole)
  6228     {
  6229       int nscls = sanitize_next_screen_context_lines ();
  6230       n *= max (1, ht - nscls);
  6231     }
  6232 
  6233   if (!NILP (Vscroll_preserve_screen_position))
  6234     {
  6235       if (window_scroll_preserve_vpos <= 0
  6236           || !SYMBOLP (KVAR (current_kboard, Vlast_command))
  6237           || NILP (Fget (KVAR (current_kboard, Vlast_command), Qscroll_command)))
  6238         {
  6239           struct position posit
  6240             = *compute_motion (startpos, startbyte, 0, 0, false,
  6241                                PT, ht, 0, -1, w->hscroll, 0, w);
  6242 
  6243           window_scroll_preserve_vpos = posit.vpos;
  6244           window_scroll_preserve_hpos = posit.hpos + w->hscroll;
  6245         }
  6246 
  6247       original_pos = Fcons (make_fixnum (window_scroll_preserve_hpos),
  6248                             make_fixnum (window_scroll_preserve_vpos));
  6249     }
  6250 
  6251   XSETFASTINT (tem, PT);
  6252   tem = Fpos_visible_in_window_p (tem, window, Qnil);
  6253 
  6254   if (NILP (tem))
  6255     {
  6256       Fvertical_motion (make_fixnum (- (ht / 2)), window, Qnil);
  6257       startpos = PT;
  6258       startbyte = PT_BYTE;
  6259     }
  6260 
  6261   SET_PT_BOTH (startpos, startbyte);
  6262   lose = n < 0 && PT == BEGV;
  6263   Fvertical_motion (make_fixnum (n), window, Qnil);
  6264   pos = PT;
  6265   pos_byte = PT_BYTE;
  6266   bolp = Fbolp ();
  6267   SET_PT_BOTH (marker_position (opoint_marker),
  6268                marker_byte_position (opoint_marker));
  6269 
  6270   if (lose)
  6271     {
  6272       if (noerror)
  6273         return;
  6274       else
  6275         xsignal0 (Qbeginning_of_buffer);
  6276     }
  6277 
  6278   if (pos < ZV)
  6279     {
  6280       int this_scroll_margin = window_scroll_margin (w, MARGIN_IN_LINES);
  6281 
  6282       set_marker_restricted_both (w->start, w->contents, pos, pos_byte);
  6283       w->start_at_line_beg = !NILP (bolp);
  6284       wset_update_mode_line (w);
  6285       /* Set force_start so that redisplay_window will run
  6286          the window-scroll-functions.  */
  6287       w->force_start = true;
  6288 
  6289       if (!NILP (Vscroll_preserve_screen_position)
  6290           && this_scroll_margin == 0
  6291           && (whole || !EQ (Vscroll_preserve_screen_position, Qt)))
  6292         {
  6293           SET_PT_BOTH (pos, pos_byte);
  6294           Fvertical_motion (original_pos, window, Qnil);
  6295         }
  6296       /* If we scrolled forward, put point enough lines down
  6297          that it is outside the scroll margin.  */
  6298       else if (n > 0)
  6299         {
  6300           int top_margin;
  6301 
  6302           if (this_scroll_margin > 0)
  6303             {
  6304               SET_PT_BOTH (pos, pos_byte);
  6305               Fvertical_motion (make_fixnum (this_scroll_margin), window, Qnil);
  6306               top_margin = PT;
  6307             }
  6308           else
  6309             top_margin = pos;
  6310 
  6311           if (top_margin <= marker_position (opoint_marker))
  6312             SET_PT_BOTH (marker_position (opoint_marker),
  6313                          marker_byte_position (opoint_marker));
  6314           else if (!NILP (Vscroll_preserve_screen_position))
  6315             {
  6316               int nlines = window_scroll_preserve_vpos;
  6317 
  6318               SET_PT_BOTH (pos, pos_byte);
  6319               if (window_scroll_preserve_vpos < this_scroll_margin)
  6320                 nlines = this_scroll_margin;
  6321               else if (window_scroll_preserve_vpos
  6322                        >= w->total_lines - this_scroll_margin)
  6323                 nlines = w->total_lines - this_scroll_margin - 1;
  6324               Fvertical_motion (Fcons (make_fixnum (window_scroll_preserve_hpos),
  6325                                        make_fixnum (nlines)), window, Qnil);
  6326             }
  6327           else
  6328             SET_PT (top_margin);
  6329         }
  6330       else if (n < 0)
  6331         {
  6332           int bottom_margin;
  6333 
  6334           /* If we scrolled backward, put point near the end of the window
  6335              but not within the scroll margin.  */
  6336           SET_PT_BOTH (pos, pos_byte);
  6337           tem = Fvertical_motion (make_fixnum (ht - this_scroll_margin), window,
  6338                                   Qnil);
  6339           if (XFIXNAT (tem) == ht - this_scroll_margin)
  6340             bottom_margin = PT;
  6341           else
  6342             bottom_margin = PT + 1;
  6343 
  6344           if (bottom_margin > marker_position (opoint_marker))
  6345             SET_PT_BOTH (marker_position (opoint_marker),
  6346                          marker_byte_position (opoint_marker));
  6347           else
  6348             {
  6349               if (!NILP (Vscroll_preserve_screen_position))
  6350                 {
  6351                   int nlines = window_scroll_preserve_vpos;
  6352 
  6353                   SET_PT_BOTH (pos, pos_byte);
  6354                   if (window_scroll_preserve_vpos < this_scroll_margin)
  6355                     nlines = this_scroll_margin;
  6356                   else if (window_scroll_preserve_vpos
  6357                            >= ht - this_scroll_margin)
  6358                     nlines = ht - this_scroll_margin - 1;
  6359                   Fvertical_motion (Fcons (make_fixnum (window_scroll_preserve_hpos),
  6360                                            make_fixnum (nlines)), window, Qnil);
  6361                 }
  6362               else
  6363                 Fvertical_motion (make_fixnum (-1), window, Qnil);
  6364             }
  6365         }
  6366     }
  6367   else
  6368     {
  6369       if (noerror)
  6370         return;
  6371       else
  6372         xsignal0 (Qend_of_buffer);
  6373     }
  6374 
  6375   if (adjust_old_pointm)
  6376     Fset_marker (w->old_pointm,
  6377                  ((w == XWINDOW (selected_window))
  6378                   ? make_fixnum (BUF_PT (XBUFFER (w->contents)))
  6379                   : Fmarker_position (w->pointm)),
  6380                  w->contents);
  6381 }
  6382 
  6383 
  6384 /* Scroll WINDOW up or down.  If N is nil, scroll upward by a
  6385    screen-full which is defined as the height of the window minus
  6386    next_screen_context_lines.  If N is the symbol `-', scroll downward
  6387    by a screen-full.  DIRECTION may be 1 meaning to scroll down, or -1
  6388    meaning to scroll up.  */
  6389 
  6390 static void
  6391 scroll_command (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object n, int direction)
  6392 {
  6393   struct window *w;
  6394   bool other_window;
  6395   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  6396 
  6397   eassert (eabs (direction) == 1);
  6398 
  6399   w = XWINDOW (window);
  6400   other_window = ! EQ (window, selected_window);
  6401 
  6402   /* If given window's buffer isn't current, make it current for the
  6403      moment.  If the window's buffer is the same, but it is not the
  6404      selected window, we need to save-excursion to avoid affecting
  6405      point in the selected window (which would cause the selected
  6406      window to scroll).  Don't screw up if window_scroll gets an
  6407      error.  */
  6408   if (other_window || XBUFFER (w->contents) != current_buffer)
  6409     {
  6410       record_unwind_protect_excursion ();
  6411       if (XBUFFER (w->contents) != current_buffer)
  6412         Fset_buffer (w->contents);
  6413     }
  6414 
  6415   if (other_window)
  6416     {
  6417       SET_PT_BOTH (marker_position (w->pointm),
  6418                    marker_byte_position (w->pointm));
  6419       SET_PT_BOTH (marker_position (w->old_pointm),
  6420                    marker_byte_position (w->old_pointm));
  6421     }
  6422 
  6423   if (NILP (n))
  6424     window_scroll (window, direction, true, false);
  6425   else if (EQ (n, Qminus))
  6426     window_scroll (window, -direction, true, false);
  6427   else
  6428     {
  6429       n = Fprefix_numeric_value (n);
  6430       window_scroll (window, XFIXNUM (n) * direction, false, false);
  6431     }
  6432 
  6433   if (other_window)
  6434     {
  6435       set_marker_both (w->pointm, Qnil, PT, PT_BYTE);
  6436       set_marker_both (w->old_pointm, Qnil, PT, PT_BYTE);
  6437     }
  6438 
  6439   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  6440 }
  6441 
  6442 DEFUN ("scroll-up", Fscroll_up, Sscroll_up, 0, 1, "^P",
  6443        doc: /* Scroll text of selected window upward ARG lines.
  6444 If ARG is omitted or nil, scroll upward by a near full screen.
  6445 A near full screen is `next-screen-context-lines' less than a full screen.
  6446 Negative ARG means scroll downward.
  6447 If ARG is the atom `-', scroll downward by nearly full screen.
  6448 When calling from a program, supply as argument a number, nil, or `-'.  */)
  6449   (Lisp_Object arg)
  6450 {
  6451   scroll_command (selected_window, arg, 1);
  6452   return Qnil;
  6453 }
  6454 
  6455 DEFUN ("scroll-down", Fscroll_down, Sscroll_down, 0, 1, "^P",
  6456        doc: /* Scroll text of selected window down ARG lines.
  6457 If ARG is omitted or nil, scroll down by a near full screen.
  6458 A near full screen is `next-screen-context-lines' less than a full screen.
  6459 Negative ARG means scroll upward.
  6460 If ARG is the atom `-', scroll upward by nearly full screen.
  6461 When calling from a program, supply as argument a number, nil, or `-'.  */)
  6462   (Lisp_Object arg)
  6463 {
  6464   scroll_command (selected_window, arg, -1);
  6465   return Qnil;
  6466 }
  6467 
  6468 DEFUN ("other-window-for-scrolling", Fother_window_for_scrolling, Sother_window_for_scrolling, 0, 0, 0,
  6469        doc: /* Return the other window for \"other window scroll\" commands.
  6470 If in the minibuffer, `minibuffer-scroll-window' if non-nil
  6471 specifies the window.
  6472 Otherwise, if `other-window-scroll-buffer' is non-nil, a window
  6473 showing that buffer is used, popping the buffer up if necessary.
  6474 Finally, look for a neighboring window on the selected frame,
  6475 followed by all visible frames on the current terminal.  */)
  6476   (void)
  6477 {
  6478   Lisp_Object window;
  6479 
  6480   if (MINI_WINDOW_P (XWINDOW (selected_window))
  6481       && !NILP (Vminibuf_scroll_window))
  6482     window = Vminibuf_scroll_window;
  6483   /* If buffer is specified and live, scroll that buffer.  */
  6484   else if (BUFFERP (Vother_window_scroll_buffer)
  6485            && BUFFER_LIVE_P (XBUFFER (Vother_window_scroll_buffer)))
  6486     {
  6487       window = Fget_buffer_window (Vother_window_scroll_buffer, Qnil);
  6488       if (NILP (window))
  6489         window = display_buffer (Vother_window_scroll_buffer, Qt, Qnil);
  6490     }
  6491   else if (FUNCTIONP (Vother_window_scroll_default))
  6492     /* Nothing specified; try to get a window from the function.  */
  6493     window = call0 (Vother_window_scroll_default);
  6494   else
  6495     {
  6496       /* Otherwise, look for a neighboring window on the same frame.  */
  6497       window = Fnext_window (selected_window, Qlambda, Qnil);
  6498 
  6499       if (EQ (window, selected_window))
  6500         /* That didn't get us anywhere; look for a window on another
  6501            visible frame on the current terminal.  */
  6502         window = Fnext_window (window, Qlambda, Qvisible);
  6503     }
  6504 
  6505   CHECK_LIVE_WINDOW (window);
  6506 
  6507   if (EQ (window, selected_window))
  6508     error ("There is no other window");
  6509 
  6510   return window;
  6511 }
  6512 
  6513 
  6514 DEFUN ("scroll-left", Fscroll_left, Sscroll_left, 0, 2, "^P\np",
  6515        doc: /* Scroll selected window display ARG columns left.
  6516 Default for ARG is window width minus 2.
  6517 Value is the total amount of leftward horizontal scrolling in
  6518 effect after the change.
  6519 If SET-MINIMUM is non-nil, the new scroll amount becomes the
  6520 lower bound for automatic scrolling, i.e. automatic scrolling
  6521 will not scroll a window to a column less than the value returned
  6522 by this function.  This happens in an interactive call.  */)
  6523   (register Lisp_Object arg, Lisp_Object set_minimum)
  6524 {
  6525   struct window *w = XWINDOW (selected_window);
  6526   EMACS_INT requested_arg =
  6527     (NILP (arg)
  6528      ? window_body_width (w, WINDOW_BODY_IN_CANONICAL_CHARS) - 2
  6529      : XFIXNUM (Fprefix_numeric_value (arg)));
  6530   Lisp_Object result = set_window_hscroll (w, w->hscroll + requested_arg);
  6531 
  6532   if (!NILP (set_minimum))
  6533     w->min_hscroll = w->hscroll;
  6534 
  6535   w->suspend_auto_hscroll = true;
  6536 
  6537   return result;
  6538 }
  6539 
  6540 DEFUN ("scroll-right", Fscroll_right, Sscroll_right, 0, 2, "^P\np",
  6541        doc: /* Scroll selected window display ARG columns right.
  6542 Default for ARG is window width minus 2.
  6543 Value is the total amount of leftward horizontal scrolling in
  6544 effect after the change.
  6545 If SET-MINIMUM is non-nil, the new scroll amount becomes the
  6546 lower bound for automatic scrolling, i.e. automatic scrolling
  6547 will not scroll a window to a column less than the value returned
  6548 by this function.  This happens in an interactive call.  */)
  6549   (register Lisp_Object arg, Lisp_Object set_minimum)
  6550 {
  6551   struct window *w = XWINDOW (selected_window);
  6552   EMACS_INT requested_arg =
  6553     (NILP (arg)
  6554      ? window_body_width (w, WINDOW_BODY_IN_CANONICAL_CHARS) - 2
  6555      : XFIXNUM (Fprefix_numeric_value (arg)));
  6556   Lisp_Object result = set_window_hscroll (w, w->hscroll - requested_arg);
  6557 
  6558   if (!NILP (set_minimum))
  6559     w->min_hscroll = w->hscroll;
  6560 
  6561   w->suspend_auto_hscroll = true;
  6562 
  6563   return result;
  6564 }
  6565 
  6566 DEFUN ("minibuffer-selected-window", Fminibuffer_selected_window, Sminibuffer_selected_window, 0, 0, 0,
  6567        doc: /* Return window selected just before minibuffer window was selected.
  6568 Return nil if the selected window is not a minibuffer window.  */)
  6569   (void)
  6570 {
  6571   if (minibuf_level > 0
  6572       && MINI_WINDOW_P (XWINDOW (selected_window))
  6573       && WINDOW_LIVE_P (minibuf_selected_window))
  6574     return minibuf_selected_window;
  6575 
  6576   return Qnil;
  6577 }
  6578 
  6579 /* Value is the number of lines actually displayed in window W,
  6580    as opposed to its height.  */
  6581 
  6582 static int
  6583 displayed_window_lines (struct window *w)
  6584 {
  6585   struct it it;
  6586   struct text_pos start;
  6587   int height = window_box_height (w);
  6588   struct buffer *old_buffer;
  6589   int bottom_y;
  6590   void *itdata = NULL;
  6591 
  6592   if (XBUFFER (w->contents) != current_buffer)
  6593     {
  6594       old_buffer = current_buffer;
  6595       set_buffer_internal (XBUFFER (w->contents));
  6596     }
  6597   else
  6598     old_buffer = NULL;
  6599 
  6600   /* In case W->start is out of the accessible range, do something
  6601      reasonable.  This happens in Info mode when Info-scroll-down
  6602      calls (recenter -1) while W->start is 1.  */
  6603   CLIP_TEXT_POS_FROM_MARKER (start, w->start);
  6604 
  6605   itdata = bidi_shelve_cache ();
  6606 
  6607   specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  6608   record_unwind_protect_void (unwind_display_working_on_window);
  6609   display_working_on_window_p = true;
  6610   start_display (&it, w, start);
  6611   move_it_vertically (&it, height);
  6612   bottom_y = line_bottom_y (&it);
  6613   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  6614   bidi_unshelve_cache (itdata, false);
  6615 
  6616   /* Add in empty lines at the bottom of the window.  */
  6617   if (bottom_y < height)
  6618     {
  6619       int uy = FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (it.f);
  6620       it.vpos += (height - bottom_y + uy - 1) / uy;
  6621     }
  6622   else if (bottom_y == height)
  6623     it.vpos++;
  6624 
  6625   if (old_buffer)
  6626     set_buffer_internal (old_buffer);
  6627 
  6628   return it.vpos;
  6629 }
  6630 
  6631 
  6632 DEFUN ("recenter", Frecenter, Srecenter, 0, 2, "P\np",
  6633        doc: /* Center point in selected window and maybe redisplay frame.
  6634 With a numeric prefix argument ARG, recenter putting point on screen line ARG
  6635 relative to the selected window.  If ARG is negative, it counts up from the
  6636 bottom of the window.  (ARG should be less than the height of the window.)
  6637 
  6638 If ARG is omitted or nil, then recenter with point on the middle line
  6639 of the selected window; if REDISPLAY & `recenter-redisplay' are
  6640 non-nil, also erase the entire frame and redraw it (when
  6641 `auto-resize-tool-bars' is set to `grow-only', this resets the
  6642 tool-bar's height to the minimum height needed); if
  6643 `recenter-redisplay' has the special value `tty', then only tty frames
  6644 are redrawn.  Interactively, REDISPLAY is always non-nil.
  6645 
  6646 Just C-u as prefix means put point in the center of the window
  6647 and redisplay normally--don't erase and redraw the frame.  */)
  6648   (Lisp_Object arg, Lisp_Object redisplay)
  6649 {
  6650   struct window *w = XWINDOW (selected_window);
  6651   struct buffer *buf = XBUFFER (w->contents);
  6652   bool center_p = false;
  6653   ptrdiff_t charpos, bytepos;
  6654   EMACS_INT iarg UNINIT;
  6655   int this_scroll_margin;
  6656 
  6657   /* For reasons why we signal an error here, see
  6658      https://lists.gnu.org/r/emacs-devel/2014-06/msg00053.html,
  6659      https://lists.gnu.org/r/emacs-devel/2014-06/msg00094.html.  */
  6660   if (buf != current_buffer)
  6661     error ("`recenter'ing a window that does not display current-buffer.");
  6662 
  6663   /* If redisplay is suppressed due to an error, try again.  */
  6664   buf->display_error_modiff = 0;
  6665 
  6666   if (NILP (arg))
  6667     {
  6668       if (!NILP (redisplay)
  6669           && !NILP (Vrecenter_redisplay)
  6670           && (!EQ (Vrecenter_redisplay, Qtty)
  6671               || !NILP (Ftty_type (selected_frame))))
  6672         {
  6673           ptrdiff_t i;
  6674 
  6675           /* Invalidate pixel data calculated for all compositions.  */
  6676           for (i = 0; i < n_compositions; i++)
  6677             composition_table[i]->font = NULL;
  6678 #if defined (HAVE_WINDOW_SYSTEM)
  6679           WINDOW_XFRAME (w)->minimize_tab_bar_window_p = 1;
  6680 #endif
  6681 #if defined (HAVE_WINDOW_SYSTEM) && ! defined (HAVE_EXT_TOOL_BAR)
  6682           WINDOW_XFRAME (w)->minimize_tool_bar_window_p = 1;
  6683 #endif
  6684           Fredraw_frame (WINDOW_FRAME (w));
  6685           SET_FRAME_GARBAGED (WINDOW_XFRAME (w));
  6686         }
  6687 
  6688       center_p = true;
  6689     }
  6690   else if (CONSP (arg)) /* Just C-u.  */
  6691     center_p = true;
  6692   else
  6693     {
  6694       arg = Fprefix_numeric_value (arg);
  6695       CHECK_FIXNUM (arg);
  6696       iarg = XFIXNUM (arg);
  6697     }
  6698 
  6699   /* Do this after making BUF current
  6700      in case scroll_margin is buffer-local.  */
  6701   this_scroll_margin = window_scroll_margin (w, MARGIN_IN_LINES);
  6702 
  6703   /* Don't use the display code for initial frames, as the necessary
  6704      data structures might not be set up yet then.  Also don't use it
  6705      for buffers with very long lines, as it tremdously slows down
  6706      redisplay, especially when lines are truncated.  */
  6707   if (!FRAME_INITIAL_P (XFRAME (w->frame))
  6708       && !current_buffer->long_line_optimizations_p)
  6709     {
  6710       specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  6711 
  6712       record_unwind_protect_void (unwind_display_working_on_window);
  6713       display_working_on_window_p = true;
  6714       if (center_p)
  6715         {
  6716           struct it it;
  6717           struct text_pos pt;
  6718           void *itdata = bidi_shelve_cache ();
  6719 
  6720           SET_TEXT_POS (pt, PT, PT_BYTE);
  6721           start_display (&it, w, pt);
  6722           move_it_vertically_backward (&it, window_box_height (w) / 2);
  6723           charpos = IT_CHARPOS (it);
  6724           bytepos = IT_BYTEPOS (it);
  6725           bidi_unshelve_cache (itdata, false);
  6726         }
  6727       else if (iarg < 0)
  6728         {
  6729           struct it it;
  6730           struct text_pos pt;
  6731           ptrdiff_t nlines = min (PTRDIFF_MAX, -iarg);
  6732           int extra_line_spacing;
  6733           int h = window_box_height (w);
  6734           int ht = window_internal_height (w);
  6735           void *itdata = bidi_shelve_cache ();
  6736 
  6737           nlines = clip_to_bounds (this_scroll_margin + 1, nlines,
  6738                                    ht - this_scroll_margin);
  6739 
  6740           SET_TEXT_POS (pt, PT, PT_BYTE);
  6741           start_display (&it, w, pt);
  6742 
  6743           /* Be sure we have the exact height of the full line containing PT.  */
  6744           move_it_by_lines (&it, 0);
  6745 
  6746           /* The amount of pixels we have to move back is the window
  6747              height minus what's displayed in the line containing PT,
  6748              and the lines below.  */
  6749           it.current_y = 0;
  6750           it.vpos = 0;
  6751           move_it_by_lines (&it, nlines);
  6752 
  6753           if (it.vpos == nlines)
  6754             h -= it.current_y;
  6755           else
  6756             {
  6757               /* Last line has no newline.  */
  6758               h -= line_bottom_y (&it);
  6759               it.vpos++;
  6760             }
  6761 
  6762           /* Don't reserve space for extra line spacing of last line.  */
  6763           extra_line_spacing = it.max_extra_line_spacing;
  6764 
  6765           /* If we can't move down NLINES lines because we hit
  6766              the end of the buffer, count in some empty lines.  */
  6767           if (it.vpos < nlines)
  6768             {
  6769               nlines -= it.vpos;
  6770               extra_line_spacing = it.extra_line_spacing;
  6771               h -= nlines * (FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (it.f) + extra_line_spacing);
  6772             }
  6773           if (h <= 0)
  6774             {
  6775               bidi_unshelve_cache (itdata, false);
  6776               unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  6777               return Qnil;
  6778             }
  6779 
  6780           /* Now find the new top line (starting position) of the window.  */
  6781           start_display (&it, w, pt);
  6782           it.current_y = 0;
  6783           move_it_vertically_backward (&it, h);
  6784 
  6785           /* If extra line spacing is present, we may move too far
  6786              back.  This causes the last line to be only partially
  6787              visible (which triggers redisplay to recenter that line
  6788              in the middle), so move forward.
  6789              But ignore extra line spacing on last line, as it is not
  6790              considered to be part of the visible height of the line.
  6791           */
  6792           h += extra_line_spacing;
  6793           while (-it.current_y > h && it.what != IT_EOB)
  6794             move_it_by_lines (&it, 1);
  6795 
  6796           charpos = IT_CHARPOS (it);
  6797           bytepos = IT_BYTEPOS (it);
  6798 
  6799           bidi_unshelve_cache (itdata, false);
  6800         }
  6801       else
  6802         {
  6803           struct it it;
  6804           struct text_pos pt;
  6805           ptrdiff_t nlines = min (PTRDIFF_MAX, iarg);
  6806           int ht = window_internal_height (w);
  6807           void *itdata = bidi_shelve_cache ();
  6808 
  6809           nlines = clip_to_bounds (this_scroll_margin, nlines,
  6810                                    ht - this_scroll_margin - 1);
  6811 
  6812           SET_TEXT_POS (pt, PT, PT_BYTE);
  6813           start_display (&it, w, pt);
  6814 
  6815           /* Move to the beginning of screen line containing PT.  */
  6816           move_it_by_lines (&it, 0);
  6817 
  6818           /* Move back to find the point which is ARG screen lines above PT.  */
  6819           if (nlines > 0)
  6820             {
  6821               it.current_y = 0;
  6822               it.vpos = 0;
  6823               move_it_by_lines (&it, -nlines);
  6824             }
  6825 
  6826           charpos = IT_CHARPOS (it);
  6827           bytepos = IT_BYTEPOS (it);
  6828 
  6829           bidi_unshelve_cache (itdata, false);
  6830         }
  6831       unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  6832     }
  6833   else
  6834     {
  6835       struct position pos;
  6836       int ht = window_internal_height (w);
  6837 
  6838       if (center_p)
  6839         iarg = ht / 2;
  6840       else if (iarg < 0)
  6841         iarg += ht;
  6842 
  6843       /* Don't let it get into the margin at either top or bottom.  */
  6844       iarg = clip_to_bounds (this_scroll_margin, iarg,
  6845                              ht - this_scroll_margin - 1);
  6846 
  6847       pos = *vmotion (PT, PT_BYTE, - iarg, w);
  6848       charpos = pos.bufpos;
  6849       bytepos = pos.bytepos;
  6850     }
  6851 
  6852   /* Set the new window start.  */
  6853   set_marker_both (w->start, w->contents, charpos, bytepos);
  6854   w->window_end_valid = false;
  6855 
  6856   w->optional_new_start = true;
  6857 
  6858   w->start_at_line_beg = (bytepos == BEGV_BYTE
  6859                           || FETCH_BYTE (bytepos - 1) == '\n');
  6860 
  6861   wset_redisplay (w);
  6862 
  6863   return Qnil;
  6864 }
  6865 
  6866 DEFUN ("window-text-width", Fwindow_text_width, Swindow_text_width,
  6867        0, 2, 0,
  6868        doc: /* Return the width in columns of the text display area of WINDOW.
  6869 WINDOW must be a live window and defaults to the selected one.
  6870 
  6871 The returned width does not include dividers, scrollbars, margins,
  6872 fringes, nor any partial-width columns at the right of the text
  6873 area.
  6874 
  6875 Optional argument PIXELWISE non-nil, means to return the width in
  6876 pixels.  */)
  6877   (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object pixelwise)
  6878 {
  6879   struct window *w = decode_live_window (window);
  6880 
  6881   if (NILP (pixelwise))
  6882     return make_fixnum (window_box_width (w, TEXT_AREA)
  6883                         / FRAME_COLUMN_WIDTH (WINDOW_XFRAME (w)));
  6884   else
  6885     return make_fixnum (window_box_width (w, TEXT_AREA));
  6886 }
  6887 
  6888 DEFUN ("window-text-height", Fwindow_text_height, Swindow_text_height,
  6889        0, 2, 0,
  6890        doc: /* Return the height in lines of the text display area of WINDOW.
  6891 WINDOW must be a live window and defaults to the selected one.
  6892 
  6893 The returned height does not include dividers, the mode line, any header
  6894 line, nor any partial-height lines at the bottom of the text area.
  6895 
  6896 Optional argument PIXELWISE non-nil, means to return the height in
  6897 pixels.  */)
  6898   (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object pixelwise)
  6899 {
  6900   struct window *w = decode_live_window (window);
  6901 
  6902   if (NILP (pixelwise))
  6903     return make_fixnum (window_box_height (w)
  6904                         / FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (WINDOW_XFRAME (w)));
  6905   else
  6906     return make_fixnum (window_box_height (w));
  6907 }
  6908 
  6909 DEFUN ("move-to-window-line", Fmove_to_window_line, Smove_to_window_line,
  6910        1, 1, "P",
  6911        doc: /* Position point relative to window.
  6912 ARG nil means position point at center of window.
  6913 Else, ARG specifies vertical position within the window;
  6914 zero means top of window, negative means relative to bottom
  6915 of window, -1 meaning the last fully visible display line
  6916 of the window.
  6917 
  6918 Value is the screen line of the window point moved to, counting
  6919 from the top of the window.  */)
  6920   (Lisp_Object arg)
  6921 {
  6922   struct window *w = XWINDOW (selected_window);
  6923   int lines, start;
  6924   Lisp_Object window;
  6925 #if false
  6926   int this_scroll_margin;
  6927 #endif
  6928 
  6929   if (!(BUFFERP (w->contents) && XBUFFER (w->contents) == current_buffer))
  6930     /* This test is needed to make sure PT/PT_BYTE make sense in w->contents
  6931        when passed below to set_marker_both.  */
  6932     error ("move-to-window-line called from unrelated buffer");
  6933 
  6934   window = selected_window;
  6935   start = marker_position (w->start);
  6936   if (start < BEGV || start > ZV)
  6937     {
  6938       int height = window_internal_height (w);
  6939       Fvertical_motion (make_fixnum (- (height / 2)), window, Qnil);
  6940       set_marker_both (w->start, w->contents, PT, PT_BYTE);
  6941       w->start_at_line_beg = !NILP (Fbolp ());
  6942       w->force_start = true;
  6943     }
  6944   else
  6945     Fgoto_char (w->start);
  6946 
  6947   lines = displayed_window_lines (w);
  6948 
  6949   if (NILP (arg))
  6950     XSETFASTINT (arg, lines / 2);
  6951   else
  6952     {
  6953       EMACS_INT iarg = XFIXNUM (Fprefix_numeric_value (arg));
  6954 
  6955       if (iarg < 0)
  6956         iarg = iarg + lines;
  6957 
  6958 #if false /* This code would prevent move-to-window-line from moving point
  6959              to a place inside the scroll margins (which would cause the
  6960              next redisplay to scroll).  I wrote this code, but then concluded
  6961              it is probably better not to install it.  However, it is here
  6962              inside #if false so as not to lose it.  -- rms.  */
  6963 
  6964       this_scroll_margin = window_scroll_margin (w, MARGIN_IN_LINES);
  6965 
  6966       /* Don't let it get into the margin at either top or bottom.  */
  6967       iarg = max (iarg, this_scroll_margin);
  6968       iarg = min (iarg, lines - this_scroll_margin - 1);
  6969 #endif
  6970 
  6971       arg = make_fixnum (iarg);
  6972     }
  6973 
  6974   /* Skip past a partially visible first line.  */
  6975   if (w->vscroll)
  6976     XSETINT (arg, XFIXNUM (arg) + 1);
  6977 
  6978   return Fvertical_motion (arg, window, Qnil);
  6979 }
  6980 
  6981 
  6982 
  6983 /***********************************************************************
  6984                          Window Configuration
  6985  ***********************************************************************/
  6986 
  6987 struct save_window_data
  6988   {
  6989     union vectorlike_header header;
  6990     Lisp_Object selected_frame;
  6991     Lisp_Object current_window;
  6992     Lisp_Object f_current_buffer;
  6993     Lisp_Object minibuf_scroll_window;
  6994     Lisp_Object minibuf_selected_window;
  6995     Lisp_Object root_window;
  6996     Lisp_Object focus_frame;
  6997     /* A vector, each of whose elements is a struct saved_window
  6998        for one window.  */
  6999     Lisp_Object saved_windows;
  7000 
  7001     /* All fields above are traced by the GC.
  7002        After saved_windows, the fields are ignored by the GC.  */
  7003 
  7004     /* We should be able to do without the following two.  */
  7005     int frame_cols, frame_lines;
  7006     /* These three should get eventually replaced by their pixel
  7007        counterparts.  */
  7008     int frame_menu_bar_lines, frame_tab_bar_lines, frame_tool_bar_lines;
  7009     int frame_text_width, frame_text_height;
  7010     /* These are currently unused.  We need them as soon as we convert
  7011        to pixels.  */
  7012     int frame_menu_bar_height, frame_tab_bar_height, frame_tool_bar_height;
  7013   } GCALIGNED_STRUCT;
  7014 
  7015 /* This is saved as a Lisp_Vector.  */
  7016 struct saved_window
  7017 {
  7018   union vectorlike_header header;
  7019 
  7020   Lisp_Object window, buffer, start, pointm, old_pointm;
  7021   Lisp_Object pixel_left, pixel_top, pixel_height, pixel_width;
  7022   Lisp_Object left_col, top_line, total_cols, total_lines;
  7023   Lisp_Object normal_cols, normal_lines;
  7024   Lisp_Object hscroll, min_hscroll, hscroll_whole, suspend_auto_hscroll;
  7025   Lisp_Object vscroll;
  7026   Lisp_Object parent, prev;
  7027   Lisp_Object start_at_line_beg;
  7028   Lisp_Object display_table;
  7029   Lisp_Object left_margin_cols, right_margin_cols;
  7030   Lisp_Object left_fringe_width, right_fringe_width;
  7031   Lisp_Object fringes_outside_margins, fringes_persistent;
  7032   Lisp_Object scroll_bar_width, vertical_scroll_bar_type;
  7033   Lisp_Object scroll_bar_height, horizontal_scroll_bar_type;
  7034   Lisp_Object scroll_bars_persistent, dedicated;
  7035   Lisp_Object combination_limit, window_parameters;
  7036 };
  7037 
  7038 #define SAVED_WINDOW_N(swv,n) \
  7039   ((struct saved_window *) (XVECTOR ((swv)->contents[(n)])))
  7040 
  7041 DEFUN ("window-configuration-p", Fwindow_configuration_p, Swindow_configuration_p, 1, 1, 0,
  7042        doc: /* Return t if OBJECT is a window-configuration object.  */)
  7043   (Lisp_Object object)
  7044 {
  7045   return WINDOW_CONFIGURATIONP (object) ? Qt : Qnil;
  7046 }
  7047 
  7048 DEFUN ("window-configuration-frame", Fwindow_configuration_frame, Swindow_configuration_frame, 1, 1, 0,
  7049        doc: /* Return the frame that CONFIG, a window-configuration object, is about.  */)
  7050   (Lisp_Object config)
  7051 {
  7052   register struct save_window_data *data;
  7053   struct Lisp_Vector *saved_windows;
  7054 
  7055   CHECK_WINDOW_CONFIGURATION (config);
  7056 
  7057   data = (struct save_window_data *) XVECTOR (config);
  7058   saved_windows = XVECTOR (data->saved_windows);
  7059   return XWINDOW (SAVED_WINDOW_N (saved_windows, 0)->window)->frame;
  7060 }
  7061 
  7062 DEFUN ("set-window-configuration", Fset_window_configuration,
  7063        Sset_window_configuration, 1, 3, 0,
  7064        doc: /* Set the configuration of windows and buffers as specified by CONFIGURATION.
  7065 CONFIGURATION must be a value previously returned
  7066 by `current-window-configuration' (which see).
  7067 
  7068 Normally, this function selects the frame of the CONFIGURATION, but if
  7069 DONT-SET-FRAME is non-nil, it leaves selected the frame which was
  7070 current at the start of the function.  If DONT-SET-MINIWINDOW is non-nil,
  7071 the mini-window of the frame doesn't get set to the corresponding element
  7072 of CONFIGURATION.
  7073 
  7074 If CONFIGURATION was made from a frame that is now deleted,
  7075 only frame-independent values can be restored.  In this case,
  7076 the return value is nil.  Otherwise the value is t.  */)
  7077   (Lisp_Object configuration, Lisp_Object dont_set_frame,
  7078    Lisp_Object dont_set_miniwindow)
  7079 {
  7080   register struct save_window_data *data;
  7081   struct Lisp_Vector *saved_windows;
  7082   Lisp_Object new_current_buffer;
  7083   Lisp_Object frame;
  7084   Lisp_Object old_frame = selected_frame;
  7085   struct frame *f;
  7086   ptrdiff_t old_point = -1;
  7087   USE_SAFE_ALLOCA;
  7088 
  7089   CHECK_WINDOW_CONFIGURATION (configuration);
  7090 
  7091   data = (struct save_window_data *) XVECTOR (configuration);
  7092   saved_windows = XVECTOR (data->saved_windows);
  7093 
  7094   new_current_buffer = data->f_current_buffer;
  7095   if (!BUFFER_LIVE_P (XBUFFER (new_current_buffer)))
  7096     new_current_buffer = Qnil;
  7097   else
  7098     {
  7099       if (XBUFFER (new_current_buffer) == current_buffer)
  7100         /* The code further down "preserves point" by saving here PT in
  7101            old_point and then setting it later back into PT.  When the
  7102            current-selected-window and the final-selected-window both show
  7103            the current buffer, this suffers from the problem that the
  7104            current PT is the window-point of the current-selected-window,
  7105            while the final PT is the point of the final-selected-window, so
  7106            this copy from one PT to the other would end up moving the
  7107            window-point of the final-selected-window to the window-point of
  7108            the current-selected-window.  So we have to be careful which
  7109            point of the current-buffer we copy into old_point.  */
  7110         if (EQ (XWINDOW (data->current_window)->contents, new_current_buffer)
  7111             && WINDOWP (selected_window)
  7112             && EQ (XWINDOW (selected_window)->contents, new_current_buffer)
  7113             && !EQ (selected_window, data->current_window))
  7114           old_point = marker_position (XWINDOW (data->current_window)->pointm);
  7115         else
  7116           old_point = PT;
  7117       else
  7118         /* BUF_PT (XBUFFER (new_current_buffer)) gives us the position of
  7119            point in new_current_buffer as of the last time this buffer was
  7120            used.  This can be non-deterministic since it can be changed by
  7121            things like jit-lock by mere temporary selection of some random
  7122            window that happens to show this buffer.
  7123            So if possible we want this arbitrary choice of "which point" to
  7124            be the one from the to-be-selected-window so as to prevent this
  7125            window's cursor from being copied from another window.  */
  7126         if (EQ (XWINDOW (data->current_window)->contents, new_current_buffer)
  7127             /* If current_window = selected_window, its point is in BUF_PT.  */
  7128             && !EQ (selected_window, data->current_window))
  7129           old_point = marker_position (XWINDOW (data->current_window)->pointm);
  7130         else
  7131           old_point = BUF_PT (XBUFFER (new_current_buffer));
  7132     }
  7133 
  7134   frame = XWINDOW (SAVED_WINDOW_N (saved_windows, 0)->window)->frame;
  7135   f = XFRAME (frame);
  7136 
  7137   /* If f is a dead frame, don't bother rebuilding its window tree.
  7138      However, there is other stuff we should still try to do below.  */
  7139   if (FRAME_LIVE_P (f))
  7140     {
  7141       Lisp_Object window;
  7142       Lisp_Object dead_windows = Qnil;
  7143       Lisp_Object tem, par, pers;
  7144       struct window *w;
  7145       struct saved_window *p;
  7146       struct window *root_window;
  7147       struct window **leaf_windows;
  7148       ptrdiff_t i, k, n_leaf_windows;
  7149 
  7150       /* Don't do this within the main loop below: This may call Lisp
  7151          code and is thus potentially unsafe while input is blocked.  */
  7152       for (k = 0; k < saved_windows->header.size; k++)
  7153         {
  7154           p = SAVED_WINDOW_N (saved_windows, k);
  7155           window = p->window;
  7156           w = XWINDOW (window);
  7157 
  7158           if (BUFFERP (w->contents)
  7159               && !EQ (w->contents, p->buffer)
  7160               && BUFFER_LIVE_P (XBUFFER (p->buffer))
  7161               && (NILP (Fminibufferp (p->buffer, Qnil))))
  7162             /* If a window we restore gets another buffer, record the
  7163                window's old buffer.  */
  7164             call1 (Qrecord_window_buffer, window);
  7165         }
  7166 
  7167       /* Disallow set_window_size_hook, temporarily.  */
  7168       f->can_set_window_size = false;
  7169       /* The mouse highlighting code could get screwed up
  7170          if it runs during this.  */
  7171       block_input ();
  7172 
  7173       /* "Swap out" point from the selected window's buffer
  7174          into the window itself.  (Normally the pointm of the selected
  7175          window holds garbage.)  We do this now, before
  7176          restoring the window contents, and prevent it from
  7177          being done later on when we select a new window.  */
  7178       if (! NILP (XWINDOW (selected_window)->contents))
  7179         {
  7180           w = XWINDOW (selected_window);
  7181           set_marker_both (w->pointm,
  7182                            w->contents,
  7183                            BUF_PT (XBUFFER (w->contents)),
  7184                            BUF_PT_BYTE (XBUFFER (w->contents)));
  7185         }
  7186 
  7187       fset_redisplay (f);
  7188 
  7189       /* Problem: Freeing all matrices and later allocating them again
  7190          is a serious redisplay flickering problem.  What we would
  7191          really like to do is to free only those matrices not reused
  7192          below.  */
  7193       root_window = XWINDOW (FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f));
  7194       ptrdiff_t nwindows = count_windows (root_window);
  7195       SAFE_NALLOCA (leaf_windows, 1, nwindows);
  7196       n_leaf_windows = get_leaf_windows (root_window, leaf_windows, 0);
  7197 
  7198       /* Kludge Alert!
  7199          Mark all windows now on frame as "deleted".
  7200          Restoring the new configuration "undeletes" any that are in it.
  7201 
  7202          Save their current buffers in their height fields, since we may
  7203          need it later, if a buffer saved in the configuration is now
  7204          dead.  */
  7205       delete_all_child_windows (FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f));
  7206 
  7207       for (k = 0; k < saved_windows->header.size; k++)
  7208         {
  7209           p = SAVED_WINDOW_N (saved_windows, k);
  7210           window = p->window;
  7211           w = XWINDOW (window);
  7212           wset_next (w, Qnil);
  7213 
  7214           if (!NILP (p->parent))
  7215             wset_parent
  7216               (w, SAVED_WINDOW_N (saved_windows, XFIXNAT (p->parent))->window);
  7217           else
  7218             wset_parent (w, Qnil);
  7219 
  7220           if (!NILP (p->prev))
  7221             {
  7222               wset_prev
  7223                 (w, SAVED_WINDOW_N (saved_windows, XFIXNAT (p->prev))->window);
  7224               wset_next (XWINDOW (w->prev), p->window);
  7225             }
  7226           else
  7227             {
  7228               wset_prev (w, Qnil);
  7229               if (!NILP (w->parent))
  7230                 wset_combination (XWINDOW (w->parent),
  7231                                   (XFIXNUM (p->total_cols)
  7232                                    != XWINDOW (w->parent)->total_cols),
  7233                                   p->window);
  7234             }
  7235 
  7236           /* If we squirreled away the buffer, restore it now.  */
  7237           if (BUFFERP (w->combination_limit))
  7238             wset_buffer (w, w->combination_limit);
  7239           w->pixel_left = XFIXNAT (p->pixel_left);
  7240           w->pixel_top = XFIXNAT (p->pixel_top);
  7241           w->pixel_width = XFIXNAT (p->pixel_width);
  7242           w->pixel_height = XFIXNAT (p->pixel_height);
  7243           w->left_col = XFIXNAT (p->left_col);
  7244           w->top_line = XFIXNAT (p->top_line);
  7245           w->total_cols = XFIXNAT (p->total_cols);
  7246           w->total_lines = XFIXNAT (p->total_lines);
  7247           wset_normal_cols (w, p->normal_cols);
  7248           wset_normal_lines (w, p->normal_lines);
  7249           w->hscroll = XFIXNAT (p->hscroll);
  7250           w->suspend_auto_hscroll = !NILP (p->suspend_auto_hscroll);
  7251           w->min_hscroll = XFIXNAT (p->min_hscroll);
  7252           w->hscroll_whole = XFIXNAT (p->hscroll_whole);
  7253           w->vscroll = -XFIXNAT (p->vscroll);
  7254           wset_display_table (w, p->display_table);
  7255           w->left_margin_cols = XFIXNUM (p->left_margin_cols);
  7256           w->right_margin_cols = XFIXNUM (p->right_margin_cols);
  7257           w->left_fringe_width = XFIXNUM (p->left_fringe_width);
  7258           w->right_fringe_width = XFIXNUM (p->right_fringe_width);
  7259           w->fringes_outside_margins = !NILP (p->fringes_outside_margins);
  7260           w->fringes_persistent = !NILP (p->fringes_persistent);
  7261           w->scroll_bar_width = XFIXNUM (p->scroll_bar_width);
  7262           w->scroll_bar_height = XFIXNUM (p->scroll_bar_height);
  7263           w->scroll_bars_persistent = !NILP (p->scroll_bars_persistent);
  7264           wset_vertical_scroll_bar_type (w, p->vertical_scroll_bar_type);
  7265           wset_horizontal_scroll_bar_type (w, p->horizontal_scroll_bar_type);
  7266           wset_dedicated (w, p->dedicated);
  7267           wset_combination_limit (w, p->combination_limit);
  7268           /* Restore any window parameters that have been saved.
  7269              Parameters that have not been saved are left alone.  */
  7270           for (tem = p->window_parameters; CONSP (tem); tem = XCDR (tem))
  7271             {
  7272               pers = XCAR (tem);
  7273               if (CONSP (pers))
  7274                 {
  7275                   if (NILP (XCDR (pers)))
  7276                     {
  7277                       par = Fassq (XCAR (pers), w->window_parameters);
  7278                       if (CONSP (par) && !NILP (XCDR (par)))
  7279                         /* Reset a parameter to nil if and only if it
  7280                            has a non-nil association.  Don't make new
  7281                            associations.  */
  7282                         Fsetcdr (par, Qnil);
  7283                     }
  7284                   else
  7285                     /* Always restore a non-nil value.  */
  7286                     Fset_window_parameter (window, XCAR (pers), XCDR (pers));
  7287                 }
  7288             }
  7289 
  7290           if ((NILP (dont_set_miniwindow) || !MINI_WINDOW_P (w))
  7291               && BUFFERP (p->buffer) && BUFFER_LIVE_P (XBUFFER (p->buffer)))
  7292             /* If saved buffer is alive, install it, unless it's a
  7293                minibuffer we explicitly prohibit.  */
  7294             {
  7295               wset_buffer (w, p->buffer);
  7296               w->start_at_line_beg = !NILP (p->start_at_line_beg);
  7297               set_marker_restricted (w->start, p->start, w->contents);
  7298               set_marker_restricted (w->pointm, p->pointm, w->contents);
  7299               set_marker_restricted (w->old_pointm, p->old_pointm, w->contents);
  7300               /* As documented in Fcurrent_window_configuration, don't
  7301                  restore the location of point in the buffer which was
  7302                  current when the window configuration was recorded.  */
  7303               if (!EQ (p->buffer, new_current_buffer)
  7304                   && XBUFFER (p->buffer) == current_buffer)
  7305                 Fgoto_char (w->pointm);
  7306             }
  7307           else if (BUFFERP (w->contents) && BUFFER_LIVE_P (XBUFFER (w->contents)))
  7308             /* Keep window's old buffer; make sure the markers are real.  */
  7309             {
  7310               /* Set window markers at start of visible range.  */
  7311               if (XMARKER (w->start)->buffer == 0)
  7312                 set_marker_restricted_both (w->start, w->contents, 0, 0);
  7313               if (XMARKER (w->pointm)->buffer == 0)
  7314                 set_marker_restricted_both
  7315                   (w->pointm, w->contents,
  7316                    BUF_PT (XBUFFER (w->contents)),
  7317                    BUF_PT_BYTE (XBUFFER (w->contents)));
  7318               if (XMARKER (w->old_pointm)->buffer == 0)
  7319                 set_marker_restricted_both
  7320                   (w->old_pointm, w->contents,
  7321                    BUF_PT (XBUFFER (w->contents)),
  7322                    BUF_PT_BYTE (XBUFFER (w->contents)));
  7323               w->start_at_line_beg = true;
  7324             }
  7325           else if (!NILP (w->start))
  7326             /* Leaf window has no live buffer, get one.  */
  7327             {
  7328               /* Get the buffer via other_buffer_safely in order to
  7329                  avoid showing an unimportant buffer and, if necessary, to
  7330                  recreate *scratch* in the course (part of Juanma's bs-show
  7331                  scenario from March 2011).  */
  7332               wset_buffer (w, other_buffer_safely (Fcurrent_buffer ()));
  7333               /* This will set the markers to beginning of visible
  7334                  range.  */
  7335               set_marker_restricted_both (w->start, w->contents, 0, 0);
  7336               set_marker_restricted_both (w->pointm, w->contents, 0, 0);
  7337               set_marker_restricted_both (w->old_pointm, w->contents, 0, 0);
  7338               w->start_at_line_beg = true;
  7339               if (!NILP (w->dedicated))
  7340                 /* Record this window as dead.  */
  7341                 dead_windows = Fcons (window, dead_windows);
  7342               /* Make sure window is no more dedicated.  */
  7343               wset_dedicated (w, Qnil);
  7344             }
  7345         }
  7346 
  7347       fset_root_window (f, data->root_window);
  7348       /* Arrange *not* to restore point in the buffer that was
  7349          current when the window configuration was saved.  */
  7350       if (EQ (XWINDOW (data->current_window)->contents, new_current_buffer))
  7351         set_marker_restricted (XWINDOW (data->current_window)->pointm,
  7352                                make_fixnum (old_point),
  7353                                XWINDOW (data->current_window)->contents);
  7354 
  7355       /* In the following call to select_window, prevent "swapping out
  7356          point" in the old selected window using the buffer that has
  7357          been restored into it.  We already swapped out that point
  7358          from that window's old buffer.
  7359 
  7360          Do not record the buffer here.  We do that in a separate call
  7361          to select_window below.  See also Bug#16207.  */
  7362       select_window (data->current_window, Qt, true);
  7363       BVAR (XBUFFER (XWINDOW (selected_window)->contents),
  7364             last_selected_window)
  7365         = selected_window;
  7366 
  7367       /* We may have deleted windows above.  Then again, maybe we
  7368          haven't: the functions we call to maybe delete windows can
  7369          decide a window cannot be deleted.  Force recalculation of
  7370          Vwindow_list next time it is needed, to make sure stale
  7371          windows with no buffers don't escape into the wild, which
  7372          will cause crashes elsewhere.  */
  7373       Vwindow_list = Qnil;
  7374 
  7375       if (NILP (data->focus_frame)
  7376           || (FRAMEP (data->focus_frame)
  7377               && FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (data->focus_frame))))
  7378         Fredirect_frame_focus (frame, data->focus_frame);
  7379 
  7380       /* Now, free glyph matrices in windows that were not reused.  */
  7381       for (i = 0; i < n_leaf_windows; i++)
  7382         if (NILP (leaf_windows[i]->contents))
  7383           free_window_matrices (leaf_windows[i]);
  7384 
  7385       /* Allow set_window_size_hook again and resize frame's windows
  7386          if necessary.  But change frame size only to preserve window
  7387          minimum sizes.  */
  7388       f->can_set_window_size = true;
  7389       adjust_frame_size (f, -1, -1, 4, false, Qset_window_configuration);
  7390 
  7391       adjust_frame_glyphs (f);
  7392       unblock_input ();
  7393 
  7394       /* Scan dead buffer windows.  */
  7395       for (; CONSP (dead_windows); dead_windows = XCDR (dead_windows))
  7396         {
  7397           window = XCAR (dead_windows);
  7398           if (WINDOW_LIVE_P (window) && !EQ (window, FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f)))
  7399             delete_deletable_window (window);
  7400         }
  7401 
  7402       /* Record the selected window's buffer here.  The window should
  7403          already be the selected one from the call above.  */
  7404       if (WINDOW_LIVE_P (data->current_window))
  7405         select_window (data->current_window, Qnil, false);
  7406 
  7407       /* select_window will have made f the selected frame, so we
  7408          reselect the proper frame here.  do_switch_frame will change
  7409          the selected window too, but that doesn't make the call to
  7410          select_window above totally superfluous; it still sets f's
  7411          selected window.  */
  7412       if (FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (data->selected_frame)))
  7413         do_switch_frame (NILP (dont_set_frame)
  7414                          ? data->selected_frame
  7415                          : old_frame
  7416                          , 0, 0, Qnil);
  7417     }
  7418 
  7419   FRAME_WINDOW_CHANGE (f) = true;
  7420 
  7421   if (!NILP (new_current_buffer))
  7422     {
  7423       Fset_buffer (new_current_buffer);
  7424       /* If the new current buffer doesn't appear in the selected
  7425          window, go to its old point (Bug#12208).
  7426 
  7427          The original fix used data->current_window below which caused
  7428          false positives (compare Bug#31695) when data->current_window
  7429          is not on data->selected_frame.  This happens, for example,
  7430          when read_minibuf restores the configuration of a stand-alone
  7431          minibuffer frame: After switching to the previously selected
  7432          "normal" frame, point of that frame's selected window jumped
  7433          unexpectedly because new_current_buffer is usually *not*
  7434          shown in data->current_window - the minibuffer frame's
  7435          selected window.  Using selected_window instead fixes this
  7436          because do_switch_frame has set up selected_window already to
  7437          the "normal" frame's selected window and that window *does*
  7438          show new_current_buffer.  */
  7439       if (!EQ (XWINDOW (selected_window)->contents, new_current_buffer))
  7440         Fgoto_char (make_fixnum (old_point));
  7441     }
  7442 
  7443   Vminibuf_scroll_window = data->minibuf_scroll_window;
  7444   minibuf_selected_window = data->minibuf_selected_window;
  7445 
  7446   SAFE_FREE ();
  7447   return FRAME_LIVE_P (f) ? Qt : Qnil;
  7448 }
  7449 
  7450 void
  7451 restore_window_configuration (Lisp_Object configuration)
  7452 {
  7453   if (CONSP (configuration))
  7454     Fset_window_configuration (XCAR (configuration),
  7455                                Fcar_safe (XCDR (configuration)),
  7456                                Fcar_safe (Fcdr_safe (XCDR (configuration))));
  7457   else
  7458     Fset_window_configuration (configuration, Qnil, Qnil);
  7459 }
  7460 
  7461 
  7462 /* If WINDOW is an internal window, recursively delete all child windows
  7463    reachable via the next and contents slots of WINDOW.  Otherwise setup
  7464    WINDOW to not show any buffer.  */
  7465 
  7466 void
  7467 delete_all_child_windows (Lisp_Object window)
  7468 {
  7469   register struct window *w;
  7470 
  7471   w = XWINDOW (window);
  7472 
  7473   if (!NILP (w->next))
  7474     /* Delete WINDOW's siblings (we traverse postorderly).  */
  7475     delete_all_child_windows (w->next);
  7476 
  7477   if (WINDOWP (w->contents))
  7478     {
  7479       delete_all_child_windows (w->contents);
  7480       wset_combination (w, false, Qnil);
  7481     }
  7482   else if (BUFFERP (w->contents))
  7483     {
  7484       unshow_buffer (w);
  7485       unchain_marker (XMARKER (w->pointm));
  7486       unchain_marker (XMARKER (w->old_pointm));
  7487       unchain_marker (XMARKER (w->start));
  7488       /* Since combination limit makes sense for an internal windows
  7489          only, we use this slot to save the buffer for the sake of
  7490          possible resurrection in Fset_window_configuration.  */
  7491       wset_combination_limit (w, w->contents);
  7492       wset_buffer (w, Qnil);
  7493     }
  7494 
  7495   Vwindow_list = Qnil;
  7496 }
  7497 
  7498 static ptrdiff_t
  7499 count_windows (struct window *window)
  7500 {
  7501   ptrdiff_t count = 1;
  7502   if (!NILP (window->next))
  7503     count += count_windows (XWINDOW (window->next));
  7504   if (WINDOWP (window->contents))
  7505     count += count_windows (XWINDOW (window->contents));
  7506   return count;
  7507 }
  7508 
  7509 
  7510 /* Fill vector FLAT with leaf windows under W, starting at index I.
  7511    Value is last index + 1.  */
  7512 static ptrdiff_t
  7513 get_leaf_windows (struct window *w, struct window **flat, ptrdiff_t i)
  7514 {
  7515   while (w)
  7516     {
  7517       if (WINDOWP (w->contents))
  7518         i = get_leaf_windows (XWINDOW (w->contents), flat, i);
  7519       else
  7520         flat[i++] = w;
  7521 
  7522       w = NILP (w->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (w->next);
  7523     }
  7524 
  7525   return i;
  7526 }
  7527 
  7528 
  7529 /* Return a pointer to the glyph W's physical cursor is on.  Value is
  7530    null if W's current matrix is invalid, so that no meaningful glyph
  7531    can be returned.  */
  7532 struct glyph *
  7533 get_phys_cursor_glyph (struct window *w)
  7534 {
  7535   struct glyph_row *row;
  7536   struct glyph *glyph;
  7537   int hpos = w->phys_cursor.hpos;
  7538 
  7539   if (!(w->phys_cursor.vpos >= 0
  7540         && w->phys_cursor.vpos < w->current_matrix->nrows))
  7541     return NULL;
  7542 
  7543   row = MATRIX_ROW (w->current_matrix, w->phys_cursor.vpos);
  7544   if (!row->enabled_p)
  7545     return NULL;
  7546 
  7547   if (w->hscroll)
  7548     {
  7549       /* When the window is hscrolled, cursor hpos can legitimately be
  7550          out of bounds, but we draw the cursor at the corresponding
  7551          window margin in that case.  */
  7552       if (!row->reversed_p && hpos < 0)
  7553         hpos = 0;
  7554       if (row->reversed_p && hpos >= row->used[TEXT_AREA])
  7555         hpos = row->used[TEXT_AREA] - 1;
  7556     }
  7557 
  7558   if (0 <= hpos && hpos < row->used[TEXT_AREA])
  7559     glyph = row->glyphs[TEXT_AREA] + hpos;
  7560   else
  7561     glyph = NULL;
  7562 
  7563   return glyph;
  7564 }
  7565 
  7566 
  7567 static ptrdiff_t
  7568 save_window_save (Lisp_Object window, struct Lisp_Vector *vector, ptrdiff_t i)
  7569 {
  7570   struct saved_window *p;
  7571   struct window *w;
  7572   Lisp_Object tem, pers, par;
  7573 
  7574   for (; !NILP (window); window = w->next)
  7575     {
  7576       p = SAVED_WINDOW_N (vector, i);
  7577       w = XWINDOW (window);
  7578 
  7579       wset_temslot (w, make_fixnum (i)); i++;
  7580       p->window = window;
  7581       p->buffer = (WINDOW_LEAF_P (w) ? w->contents : Qnil);
  7582       p->pixel_left = make_fixnum (w->pixel_left);
  7583       p->pixel_top = make_fixnum (w->pixel_top);
  7584       p->pixel_width = make_fixnum (w->pixel_width);
  7585       p->pixel_height = make_fixnum (w->pixel_height);
  7586       p->left_col = make_fixnum (w->left_col);
  7587       p->top_line = make_fixnum (w->top_line);
  7588       p->total_cols = make_fixnum (w->total_cols);
  7589       p->total_lines = make_fixnum (w->total_lines);
  7590       p->normal_cols = w->normal_cols;
  7591       p->normal_lines = w->normal_lines;
  7592       XSETFASTINT (p->hscroll, w->hscroll);
  7593       p->suspend_auto_hscroll = w->suspend_auto_hscroll ? Qt : Qnil;
  7594       XSETFASTINT (p->min_hscroll, w->min_hscroll);
  7595       XSETFASTINT (p->hscroll_whole, w->hscroll_whole);
  7596       XSETFASTINT (p->vscroll, -w->vscroll);
  7597       p->display_table = w->display_table;
  7598       p->left_margin_cols = make_fixnum (w->left_margin_cols);
  7599       p->right_margin_cols = make_fixnum (w->right_margin_cols);
  7600       p->left_fringe_width = make_fixnum (w->left_fringe_width);
  7601       p->right_fringe_width = make_fixnum (w->right_fringe_width);
  7602       p->fringes_outside_margins = w->fringes_outside_margins ? Qt : Qnil;
  7603       p->fringes_persistent = w->fringes_persistent ? Qt : Qnil;
  7604       p->scroll_bar_width = make_fixnum (w->scroll_bar_width);
  7605       p->scroll_bar_height = make_fixnum (w->scroll_bar_height);
  7606       p->scroll_bars_persistent = w->scroll_bars_persistent ? Qt : Qnil;
  7607       p->vertical_scroll_bar_type = w->vertical_scroll_bar_type;
  7608       p->horizontal_scroll_bar_type = w->horizontal_scroll_bar_type;
  7609       p->dedicated = w->dedicated;
  7610       p->combination_limit = w->combination_limit;
  7611       p->window_parameters = Qnil;
  7612 
  7613       if (!NILP (Vwindow_persistent_parameters))
  7614         {
  7615           /* Run cycle detection on Vwindow_persistent_parameters.  */
  7616           Lisp_Object tortoise, hare;
  7617 
  7618           hare = tortoise = Vwindow_persistent_parameters;
  7619           while (CONSP (hare))
  7620             {
  7621               hare = XCDR (hare);
  7622               if (!CONSP (hare))
  7623                 break;
  7624 
  7625               hare = XCDR (hare);
  7626               tortoise = XCDR (tortoise);
  7627 
  7628               if (BASE_EQ (hare, tortoise))
  7629                 /* Reset Vwindow_persistent_parameters to Qnil.  */
  7630                 {
  7631                   Vwindow_persistent_parameters = Qnil;
  7632                   break;
  7633                 }
  7634             }
  7635 
  7636           for (tem = Vwindow_persistent_parameters; CONSP (tem);
  7637                tem = XCDR (tem))
  7638             {
  7639               pers = XCAR (tem);
  7640               /* Save values for persistent window parameters. */
  7641               if (CONSP (pers) && !NILP (XCDR (pers)))
  7642                 {
  7643                   par = Fassq (XCAR (pers), w->window_parameters);
  7644                   if (NILP (par))
  7645                     /* If the window has no value for the parameter,
  7646                        make one.  */
  7647                     p->window_parameters = Fcons (Fcons (XCAR (pers), Qnil),
  7648                                                   p->window_parameters);
  7649                   else
  7650                     /* If the window has a value for the parameter,
  7651                        save it.  */
  7652                     p->window_parameters = Fcons (Fcons (XCAR (par),
  7653                                                          XCDR (par)),
  7654                                                   p->window_parameters);
  7655                 }
  7656             }
  7657         }
  7658 
  7659       if (BUFFERP (w->contents))
  7660         {
  7661           bool window_point_insertion_type
  7662             = !NILP (buffer_local_value
  7663                       (Qwindow_point_insertion_type, w->contents));
  7664 
  7665           /* Save w's value of point in the window configuration.  If w
  7666              is the selected window, then get the value of point from
  7667              the buffer; pointm is garbage in the selected window.  */
  7668           if (EQ (window, selected_window))
  7669             p->pointm = build_marker (XBUFFER (w->contents),
  7670                                       BUF_PT (XBUFFER (w->contents)),
  7671                                       BUF_PT_BYTE (XBUFFER (w->contents)));
