  7672           else
  7673             p->pointm = Fcopy_marker (w->pointm, Qnil);
  7674           p->old_pointm = Fcopy_marker (w->old_pointm, Qnil);
  7675           XMARKER (p->pointm)->insertion_type = window_point_insertion_type;
  7676           XMARKER (p->old_pointm)->insertion_type = window_point_insertion_type;
  7677 
  7678           p->start = Fcopy_marker (w->start, Qnil);
  7679           p->start_at_line_beg = w->start_at_line_beg ? Qt : Qnil;
  7680         }
  7681       else
  7682         {
  7683           p->pointm = Qnil;
  7684           p->old_pointm = Qnil;
  7685           p->start = Qnil;
  7686           p->start_at_line_beg = Qnil;
  7687         }
  7688 
  7689       p->parent = NILP (w->parent) ? Qnil : XWINDOW (w->parent)->temslot;
  7690       p->prev = NILP (w->prev) ? Qnil : XWINDOW (w->prev)->temslot;
  7691 
  7692       if (WINDOWP (w->contents))
  7693         i = save_window_save (w->contents, vector, i);
  7694     }
  7695 
  7696   return i;
  7697 }
  7698 
  7699 DEFUN ("current-window-configuration", Fcurrent_window_configuration,
  7700        Scurrent_window_configuration, 0, 1, 0,
  7701        doc: /* Return an object representing the current window configuration of FRAME.
  7702 If FRAME is nil or omitted, use the selected frame.
  7703 This describes the number of windows, their sizes and current buffers,
  7704 and for each displayed buffer, where display starts, and the position of
  7705 point.  An exception is made for point in the current buffer:
  7706 its value is -not- saved.
  7707 This also records the currently selected frame, and FRAME's focus
  7708 redirection (see `redirect-frame-focus').  The variable
  7709 `window-persistent-parameters' specifies which window parameters are
  7710 saved by this function.  */)
  7711   (Lisp_Object frame)
  7712 {
  7713   struct frame *f = decode_live_frame (frame);
  7714   ptrdiff_t n_windows = count_windows (XWINDOW (FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f)));
  7715   struct save_window_data *data
  7716     = ALLOCATE_PSEUDOVECTOR (struct save_window_data, saved_windows,
  7717                              PVEC_WINDOW_CONFIGURATION);
  7718   data->frame_cols = FRAME_COLS (f);
  7719   data->frame_lines = FRAME_LINES (f);
  7720   data->frame_menu_bar_lines = FRAME_MENU_BAR_LINES (f);
  7721   data->frame_tab_bar_lines = FRAME_TAB_BAR_LINES (f);
  7722   data->frame_tool_bar_lines = FRAME_TOOL_BAR_LINES (f);
  7723   data->frame_text_width = FRAME_TEXT_WIDTH (f);
  7724   data->frame_text_height = FRAME_TEXT_HEIGHT (f);
  7725   data->frame_menu_bar_height = FRAME_MENU_BAR_HEIGHT (f);
  7726   data->frame_tab_bar_height = FRAME_TAB_BAR_HEIGHT (f);
  7727   data->frame_tool_bar_height = FRAME_TOOL_BAR_HEIGHT (f);
  7728   data->selected_frame = selected_frame;
  7729   data->current_window = FRAME_SELECTED_WINDOW (f);
  7730   XSETBUFFER (data->f_current_buffer, current_buffer);
  7731   data->minibuf_scroll_window = minibuf_level > 0 ? Vminibuf_scroll_window : Qnil;
  7732   data->minibuf_selected_window = minibuf_level > 0 ? minibuf_selected_window : Qnil;
  7733   data->root_window = FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f);
  7734   data->focus_frame = FRAME_FOCUS_FRAME (f);
  7735   Lisp_Object tem = make_nil_vector (n_windows);
  7736   data->saved_windows = tem;
  7737   for (ptrdiff_t i = 0; i < n_windows; i++)
  7738     ASET (tem, i, make_nil_vector (VECSIZE (struct saved_window)));
  7739   save_window_save (FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f), XVECTOR (tem), 0);
  7740   XSETWINDOW_CONFIGURATION (tem, data);
  7741   return tem;
  7742 }
  7743 
  7744 /* Called after W's margins, fringes or scroll bars was adjusted.  */
  7745 
  7746 static void
  7747 apply_window_adjustment (struct window *w)
  7748 {
  7749   eassert (w);
  7750   clear_glyph_matrix (w->current_matrix);
  7751   w->window_end_valid = false;
  7752   wset_redisplay (w);
  7753   adjust_frame_glyphs (XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w)));
  7754 }
  7755 
  7756 
  7757 /***********************************************************************
  7758                             Marginal Areas
  7759  ***********************************************************************/
  7760 
  7761 static int
  7762 extract_dimension (Lisp_Object dimension)
  7763 {
  7764   if (NILP (dimension))
  7765     return -1;
  7766   return check_integer_range (dimension, 0, INT_MAX);
  7767 }
  7768 
  7769 static struct window *
  7770 set_window_margins (struct window *w, Lisp_Object left_width,
  7771                     Lisp_Object right_width)
  7772 {
  7773   int unit = WINDOW_FRAME_COLUMN_WIDTH (w);
  7774   int left = NILP (left_width) ? 0 : extract_dimension (left_width);
  7775   int right = NILP (right_width) ? 0 : extract_dimension (right_width);
  7776 
  7777   if (w->left_margin_cols != left || w->right_margin_cols != right)
  7778     {
  7779       /* Don't change anything if new margins won't fit.  */
  7780       if ((WINDOW_PIXEL_WIDTH (w)
  7781            - WINDOW_FRINGES_WIDTH (w)
  7782            - WINDOW_SCROLL_BAR_AREA_WIDTH (w)
  7783            - (left + right) * unit)
  7784           >= MIN_SAFE_WINDOW_PIXEL_WIDTH (w))
  7785         {
  7786           w->left_margin_cols = left;
  7787           w->right_margin_cols = right;
  7788 
  7789           return w;
  7790         }
  7791       else
  7792         return NULL;
  7793     }
  7794   else
  7795     return NULL;
  7796 }
  7797 
  7798 DEFUN ("set-window-margins", Fset_window_margins, Sset_window_margins,
  7799        2, 3, 0,
  7800        doc: /* Set width of marginal areas of window WINDOW.
  7801 WINDOW must be a live window and defaults to the selected one.
  7802 
  7803 Second arg LEFT-WIDTH specifies the number of character cells to
  7804 reserve for the left marginal area.  Optional third arg RIGHT-WIDTH
  7805 does the same for the right marginal area.  A nil width parameter
  7806 means no margin.
  7807 
  7808 Leave margins unchanged if WINDOW is not large enough to accommodate
  7809 margins of the desired width.  Return t if any margin was actually
  7810 changed and nil otherwise.  */)
  7811   (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object left_width, Lisp_Object right_width)
  7812 {
  7813   struct window *w = set_window_margins (decode_live_window (window),
  7814                                          left_width, right_width);
  7815   return w ? (apply_window_adjustment (w), Qt) : Qnil;
  7816 }
  7817 
  7818 
  7819 DEFUN ("window-margins", Fwindow_margins, Swindow_margins,
  7820        0, 1, 0,
  7821        doc: /* Get width of marginal areas of window WINDOW.
  7822 WINDOW must be a live window and defaults to the selected one.
  7823 
  7824 Value is a cons of the form (LEFT-WIDTH . RIGHT-WIDTH).
  7825 If a marginal area does not exist, its width will be returned
  7826 as nil.  */)
  7827   (Lisp_Object window)
  7828 {
  7829   struct window *w = decode_live_window (window);
  7830   return Fcons (w->left_margin_cols
  7831                 ? make_fixnum (w->left_margin_cols) : Qnil,
  7832                 w->right_margin_cols
  7833                 ? make_fixnum (w->right_margin_cols) : Qnil);
  7834 }
  7835 
  7836 
  7837 
  7838 /***********************************************************************
  7839                             Fringes
  7840  ***********************************************************************/
  7841 
  7842 static struct window *
  7843 set_window_fringes (struct window *w,
  7844                     Lisp_Object left_width, Lisp_Object right_width,
  7845                     Lisp_Object outside_margins, Lisp_Object persistent)
  7846 {
  7847   /* Do nothing on a tty.  */
  7848   if (!FRAME_WINDOW_P (WINDOW_XFRAME (w)))
  7849     return NULL;
  7850   else
  7851     {
  7852       struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w));
  7853       int old_left = WINDOW_LEFT_FRINGE_WIDTH (w);
  7854       int old_right = WINDOW_RIGHT_FRINGE_WIDTH (w);
  7855       int new_left = extract_dimension (left_width);
  7856       int new_right = extract_dimension (right_width);
  7857       bool outside = !NILP (outside_margins);
  7858       bool changed = false;
  7859       bool failed = false;
  7860 
  7861       /* Check dimensions of new fringes.  Make changes only if they
  7862          fit the window's dimensions.  */
  7863       if ((WINDOW_PIXEL_WIDTH (w)
  7864            - WINDOW_MARGINS_WIDTH (w)
  7865            - WINDOW_SCROLL_BAR_AREA_WIDTH (w)
  7866            - WINDOW_RIGHT_DIVIDER_WIDTH (w)
  7867            - (new_left == -1 ? FRAME_LEFT_FRINGE_WIDTH (f) : new_left)
  7868            - (new_right == -1 ? FRAME_RIGHT_FRINGE_WIDTH (f) : new_right))
  7869           >= MIN_SAFE_WINDOW_PIXEL_WIDTH (w))
  7870         {
  7871           w->left_fringe_width = new_left;
  7872           w->right_fringe_width = new_right;
  7873           changed = new_left != old_left || new_right != old_right;
  7874         }
  7875       else
  7876         failed = true;
  7877 
  7878       /* Placing fringes outside margins.  */
  7879       if (outside != w->fringes_outside_margins)
  7880         {
  7881           w->fringes_outside_margins = outside;
  7882           changed = true;
  7883         }
  7884 
  7885       /* Make settings persistent unless we failed to apply some
  7886          changes.  */
  7887       if (!failed)
  7888         w->fringes_persistent = !NILP (persistent);
  7889 
  7890       /* This is needed to trigger immediate redisplay of the window
  7891          when its fringes are changed, because fringes are redrawn
  7892          only if update_window is called, so we must trigger that even
  7893          if the window's glyph matrices did not change at all.  */
  7894       if (changed)
  7895         {
  7896           windows_or_buffers_changed = 35;
  7897           return w;
  7898         }
  7899       else
  7900         return NULL;
  7901     }
  7902 }
  7903 
  7904 DEFUN ("set-window-fringes", Fset_window_fringes, Sset_window_fringes,
  7905        2, 5, 0,
  7906        doc: /* Set fringes of specified WINDOW.
  7907 WINDOW must specify a live window and defaults to the selected one.
  7908 
  7909 Second arg LEFT-WIDTH specifies the number of pixels to reserve for
  7910 the left fringe.  Optional third arg RIGHT-WIDTH specifies the right
  7911 fringe width.  If a fringe width arg is nil, that means to use the
  7912 frame's default fringe width.  Default fringe widths can be set with
  7913 the command `set-fringe-style'.
  7914 
  7915 If optional fourth arg OUTSIDE-MARGINS is non-nil, draw the fringes
  7916 outside of the display margins.  By default, fringes are drawn between
  7917 display marginal areas and the text area.
  7918 
  7919 Optional fifth argument PERSISTENT non-nil means that fringe settings
  7920 for WINDOW are persistent, i.e., remain unchanged when another buffer
  7921 is shown in WINDOW.  PERSISTENT nil means that fringes are reset from
  7922 buffer local values when `set-window-buffer' is called on WINDOW with
  7923 the argument KEEP-MARGINS nil.
  7924 
  7925 Leave fringes unchanged if WINDOW is not large enough to accommodate
  7926 fringes of the desired width.  Return t if any fringe was actually
  7927 changed and nil otherwise.  */)
  7928   (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object left_width, Lisp_Object right_width,
  7929    Lisp_Object outside_margins, Lisp_Object persistent)
  7930 {
  7931   struct window *w
  7932     = set_window_fringes (decode_live_window (window), left_width,
  7933                           right_width, outside_margins, persistent);
  7934   return w ? (apply_window_adjustment (w), Qt) : Qnil;
  7935 }
  7936 
  7937 
  7938 DEFUN ("window-fringes", Fwindow_fringes, Swindow_fringes,
  7939        0, 1, 0,
  7940        doc: /* Return fringe settings for specified WINDOW.
  7941 WINDOW must be a live window and defaults to the selected one.
  7942 
  7943 Value is a list of the form (LEFT-WIDTH RIGHT-WIDTH OUTSIDE-MARGINS
  7944 PERSISTENT), see `set-window-fringes'.  */)
  7945   (Lisp_Object window)
  7946 {
  7947   struct window *w = decode_live_window (window);
  7948 
  7949   return list4 (make_fixnum (WINDOW_LEFT_FRINGE_WIDTH (w)),
  7950                 make_fixnum (WINDOW_RIGHT_FRINGE_WIDTH (w)),
  7951                 WINDOW_HAS_FRINGES_OUTSIDE_MARGINS (w) ? Qt : Qnil,
  7952                 w->fringes_persistent ? Qt : Qnil);
  7953 }
  7954 
  7955 
  7956 
  7957 /***********************************************************************
  7958                             Scroll bars
  7959  ***********************************************************************/
  7960 
  7961 static struct window *
  7962 set_window_scroll_bars (struct window *w, Lisp_Object width,
  7963                         Lisp_Object vertical_type, Lisp_Object height,
  7964                         Lisp_Object horizontal_type, Lisp_Object persistent)
  7965 {
  7966   /* Do nothing on a tty.  */
  7967   if (!FRAME_WINDOW_P (WINDOW_XFRAME (w)))
  7968     return NULL;
  7969   else
  7970     {
  7971       struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w));
  7972       int new_width = extract_dimension (width);
  7973       bool changed = false;
  7974       bool failed = false;
  7975 
  7976       if (new_width == 0)
  7977         vertical_type = Qnil;
  7978       else if (!(NILP (vertical_type)
  7979                  || EQ (vertical_type, Qleft)
  7980                  || EQ (vertical_type, Qright)
  7981                  || EQ (vertical_type, Qt)))
  7982         error ("Invalid type of vertical scroll bar");
  7983 
  7984       /* Check dimension of new scroll bar.  Make changes only if it
  7985          fit the window's dimensions.  */
  7986       if ((WINDOW_PIXEL_WIDTH (w)
  7987            - WINDOW_MARGINS_WIDTH (w)
  7988            - WINDOW_FRINGES_WIDTH (w)
  7989            - WINDOW_RIGHT_DIVIDER_WIDTH (w)
  7990            - (new_width == -1 ? FRAME_SCROLL_BAR_AREA_WIDTH (f) : new_width))
  7991           >= MIN_SAFE_WINDOW_PIXEL_WIDTH (w))
  7992         {
  7993           changed = (!EQ (vertical_type, w->vertical_scroll_bar_type)
  7994                      || new_width != WINDOW_SCROLL_BAR_AREA_WIDTH (w));
  7995           wset_vertical_scroll_bar_type (w, vertical_type);
  7996           w->scroll_bar_width = new_width;
  7997         }
  7998       else
  7999         failed = true;
  8000 
  8001 #if USE_HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BARS
  8002       int new_height = extract_dimension (height);
  8003 
  8004       if ((MINI_WINDOW_P (w) && !EQ (horizontal_type, Qbottom))
  8005           || new_height == 0)
  8006         horizontal_type = Qnil;
  8007 
  8008       if (!(NILP (horizontal_type)
  8009             || EQ (horizontal_type, Qbottom)
  8010             || EQ (horizontal_type, Qt)))
  8011         error ("Invalid type of horizontal scroll bar");
  8012 
  8013       /* Don't change anything if new scroll bar won't fit.  */
  8014       if ((WINDOW_PIXEL_HEIGHT (w)
  8015            - WINDOW_TAB_LINE_HEIGHT (w)
  8016            - WINDOW_HEADER_LINE_HEIGHT (w)
  8017            - WINDOW_MODE_LINE_HEIGHT (w)
  8018            - (new_height == -1 ? FRAME_SCROLL_BAR_AREA_HEIGHT (f) : new_height))
  8019           >= MIN_SAFE_WINDOW_PIXEL_HEIGHT (w))
  8020         {
  8021           changed = (changed
  8022                      || !EQ (horizontal_type, w->horizontal_scroll_bar_type)
  8023                      || new_height != WINDOW_SCROLL_BAR_AREA_HEIGHT (w));
  8024           wset_horizontal_scroll_bar_type (w, horizontal_type);
  8025           w->scroll_bar_height = new_height;
  8026         }
  8027       else
  8028         failed = true;
  8029 #else
  8030       wset_horizontal_scroll_bar_type (w, Qnil);
  8031 #endif
  8032 
  8033       /* Make settings persistent unless we failed to apply some
  8034          changes.  */
  8035       if (!failed)
  8036         w->scroll_bars_persistent = !NILP (persistent);
  8037 
  8038       /* This is needed to trigger immediate redisplay of the window when
  8039          scroll bars are changed, because scroll bars are redisplayed only
  8040          if more than a single window needs to be considered, see
  8041          redisplay_internal.  */
  8042       if (changed)
  8043         wset_redisplay (w);
  8044 
  8045       return changed ? w : NULL;
  8046     }
  8047 }
  8048 
  8049 DEFUN ("set-window-scroll-bars", Fset_window_scroll_bars,
  8050        Sset_window_scroll_bars, 1, 6, 0,
  8051        doc: /* Set width and type of scroll bars of specified WINDOW.
  8052 WINDOW must specify a live window and defaults to the selected one.
  8053 
  8054 Second argument WIDTH specifies the pixel width for the vertical scroll
  8055 bar.  If WIDTH is nil, use the scroll bar width of WINDOW's frame.
  8056 Third argument VERTICAL-TYPE specifies the type of the vertical scroll
  8057 bar: left, right, nil or t where nil means to not display a vertical
  8058 scroll bar on WINDOW and t means to use WINDOW frame's vertical scroll
  8059 bar type.
  8060 
  8061 Fourth argument HEIGHT specifies the pixel height for the horizontal
  8062 scroll bar.  If HEIGHT is nil, use the scroll bar height of WINDOW's
  8063 frame.  Fifth argument HORIZONTAL-TYPE specifies the type of the
  8064 horizontal scroll bar: bottom, nil, or t where nil means to not
  8065 display a horizontal scroll bar on WINDOW and t means to use WINDOW
  8066 frame's horizontal scroll bar type.  If WINDOW is a mini window, t
  8067 effectively behaves like nil.  HORIZONTAL-TYPE must equal bottom in
  8068 order to show a scroll bar for mini windows.
  8069 
  8070 Optional sixth argument PERSISTENT non-nil means that scroll bar
  8071 settings for WINDOW are persistent, i.e., remain unchanged when
  8072 another buffer is shown in WINDOW.  PERSISTENT nil means that scroll
  8073 bars are reset from buffer local values when `set-window-buffer' is
  8074 called on WINDOW with the argument KEEP-MARGINS nil.
  8075 
  8076 If WINDOW is not large enough to accommodate a scroll bar of the
  8077 desired dimension, leave the corresponding scroll bar unchanged.
  8078 Return t if scroll bars were actually changed and nil otherwise.  */)
  8079   (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object width, Lisp_Object vertical_type,
  8080    Lisp_Object height, Lisp_Object horizontal_type, Lisp_Object persistent)
  8081 {
  8082   struct window *w
  8083     = set_window_scroll_bars (decode_live_window (window),
  8084                               width, vertical_type, height,
  8085                               horizontal_type, persistent);
  8086   return w ? (apply_window_adjustment (w), Qt) : Qnil;
  8087 }
  8088 
  8089 
  8090 DEFUN ("window-scroll-bars", Fwindow_scroll_bars, Swindow_scroll_bars,
  8091        0, 1, 0,
  8092        doc: /* Get width and type of scroll bars of window WINDOW.
  8093 WINDOW must be a live window and defaults to the selected one.
  8094 
  8095 Value is a list of the form (WIDTH COLUMNS VERTICAL-TYPE HEIGHT LINES
  8096 HORIZONTAL-TYPE PERSISTENT), see `set-window-scroll-bars'.  If WIDTH
  8097 or HEIGHT is nil or VERTICAL-TYPE or HORIZONTAL-TYPE is t, WINDOW is
  8098 using the frame's corresponding value.  */)
  8099   (Lisp_Object window)
  8100 {
  8101   struct window *w = decode_live_window (window);
  8102 
  8103   return Fcons (((w->scroll_bar_width >= 0)
  8104                  ? make_fixnum (w->scroll_bar_width)
  8105                  : Qnil),
  8106                 Fcons (make_fixnum (WINDOW_SCROLL_BAR_COLS (w)),
  8107                        list5 (w->vertical_scroll_bar_type,
  8108                               ((w->scroll_bar_height >= 0)
  8109                                ? make_fixnum (w->scroll_bar_height)
  8110                                : Qnil),
  8111                               make_fixnum (WINDOW_SCROLL_BAR_LINES (w)),
  8112                               w->horizontal_scroll_bar_type,
  8113                               w->scroll_bars_persistent ? Qt : Qnil)));
  8114 }
  8115 
  8116 /***********************************************************************
  8117                            Smooth scrolling
  8118  ***********************************************************************/
  8119 
  8120 DEFUN ("window-vscroll", Fwindow_vscroll, Swindow_vscroll, 0, 2, 0,
  8121        doc: /* Return the amount by which WINDOW is scrolled vertically.
  8122 This takes effect when displaying tall lines or images.
  8123 
  8124 If WINDOW is omitted or nil, it defaults to the selected window.
  8125 Normally, value is a multiple of the canonical character height of WINDOW;
  8126 optional second arg PIXELS-P means value is measured in pixels.  */)
  8127   (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object pixels_p)
  8128 {
  8129   Lisp_Object result;
  8130   struct window *w = decode_live_window (window);
  8131   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
  8132 
  8133   if (FRAME_WINDOW_P (f))
  8134     result = (NILP (pixels_p)
  8135               ? FRAME_CANON_Y_FROM_PIXEL_Y (f, -w->vscroll)
  8136               : make_fixnum (-w->vscroll));
  8137   else
  8138     result = make_fixnum (0);
  8139   return result;
  8140 }
  8141 
  8142 
  8143 DEFUN ("set-window-vscroll", Fset_window_vscroll, Sset_window_vscroll,
  8144        2, 4, 0,
  8145        doc: /* Set amount by which WINDOW should be scrolled vertically to VSCROLL.
  8146 This takes effect when displaying tall lines or images.
  8147 
  8148 WINDOW nil means use the selected window.  Normally, VSCROLL is a
  8149 non-negative multiple of the canonical character height of WINDOW;
  8150 optional third arg PIXELS-P non-nil means that VSCROLL is in pixels.
  8151 If PIXELS-P is nil, VSCROLL may have to be rounded so that it
  8152 corresponds to an integral number of pixels.  The return value is the
  8153 result of this rounding.
  8154 If PIXELS-P is non-nil, the return value is VSCROLL.
  8155 
  8156 PRESERVE-VSCROLL-P makes setting the start of WINDOW preserve the
  8157 vscroll if its start is "frozen" due to a resized mini-window.  */)
  8158   (Lisp_Object window, Lisp_Object vscroll, Lisp_Object pixels_p,
  8159    Lisp_Object preserve_vscroll_p)
  8160 {
  8161   struct window *w = decode_live_window (window);
  8162   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
  8163 
  8164   CHECK_NUMBER (vscroll);
  8165 
  8166   if (FRAME_WINDOW_P (f))
  8167     {
  8168       int old_dy = w->vscroll;
  8169 
  8170       w->vscroll = - (NILP (pixels_p)
  8171                       ? FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f) * XFLOATINT (vscroll)
  8172                       : XFLOATINT (vscroll));
  8173       w->vscroll = min (w->vscroll, 0);
  8174 
  8175       if (w->vscroll != old_dy)
  8176         {
  8177           /* Adjust glyph matrix of the frame if the virtual display
  8178              area becomes larger than before.  */
  8179           if (w->vscroll < 0 && w->vscroll < old_dy)
  8180             adjust_frame_glyphs (f);
  8181 
  8182           /* Prevent redisplay shortcuts.  */
  8183           XBUFFER (w->contents)->prevent_redisplay_optimizations_p = true;
  8184 
  8185           /* Mark W for redisplay.  (bug#55299) */
  8186           wset_redisplay (w);
  8187         }
  8188 
  8189       w->preserve_vscroll_p = !NILP (preserve_vscroll_p);
  8190     }
  8191 
  8192   return Fwindow_vscroll (window, pixels_p);
  8193 }
  8194 
  8195 
  8196 /* Call FN for all leaf windows on frame F.  FN is called with the
  8197    first argument being a pointer to the leaf window, and with
  8198    additional argument USER_DATA.  Stops when FN returns 0.  */
  8199 
  8200 static void
  8201 foreach_window (struct frame *f, bool (*fn) (struct window *, void *),
  8202                 void *user_data)
  8203 {
  8204   /* delete_frame may set FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f) to Qnil.  */
  8205   if (WINDOWP (FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f)))
  8206     foreach_window_1 (XWINDOW (FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f)), fn, user_data);
  8207 }
  8208 
  8209 
  8210 /* Helper function for foreach_window.  Call FN for all leaf windows
  8211    reachable from W.  FN is called with the first argument being a
  8212    pointer to the leaf window, and with additional argument USER_DATA.
  8213    Stop when FN returns false.  Value is false if stopped by FN.  */
  8214 
  8215 static bool
  8216 foreach_window_1 (struct window *w, bool (*fn) (struct window *, void *),
  8217                   void *user_data)
  8218 {
  8219   bool cont;
  8220 
  8221   for (cont = true; w && cont;)
  8222     {
  8223       if (WINDOWP (w->contents))
  8224         cont = foreach_window_1 (XWINDOW (w->contents), fn, user_data);
  8225       else
  8226         cont = fn (w, user_data);
  8227 
  8228       w = NILP (w->next) ? 0 : XWINDOW (w->next);
  8229     }
  8230 
  8231   return cont;
  8232 }
  8233 
  8234 /***********************************************************************
  8235                             Initialization
  8236  ***********************************************************************/
  8237 
  8238 /* Return true if window configurations CONFIGURATION1 and CONFIGURATION2
  8239    describe the same state of affairs.  This is used by Fequal.
  8240 
  8241    Ignore non-matching scroll positions and the like.
  8242 
  8243    This ignores a couple of things like the dedication status of
  8244    window, combination_limit and the like.  This might have to be
  8245    fixed.  */
  8246 
  8247 static bool
  8248 compare_window_configurations (Lisp_Object configuration1,
  8249                                Lisp_Object configuration2)
  8250 {
  8251   struct save_window_data *d1, *d2;
  8252   struct Lisp_Vector *sws1, *sws2;
  8253   ptrdiff_t i;
  8254 
  8255   CHECK_WINDOW_CONFIGURATION (configuration1);
  8256   CHECK_WINDOW_CONFIGURATION (configuration2);
  8257 
  8258   d1 = (struct save_window_data *) XVECTOR (configuration1);
  8259   d2 = (struct save_window_data *) XVECTOR (configuration2);
  8260   sws1 = XVECTOR (d1->saved_windows);
  8261   sws2 = XVECTOR (d2->saved_windows);
  8262 
  8263   /* Frame settings must match.  */
  8264   if (d1->frame_cols != d2->frame_cols
  8265       || d1->frame_lines != d2->frame_lines
  8266       || d1->frame_menu_bar_lines != d2->frame_menu_bar_lines
  8267       || !EQ (d1->selected_frame, d2->selected_frame)
  8268       || !EQ (d1->f_current_buffer, d2->f_current_buffer)
  8269       || !EQ (d1->focus_frame, d2->focus_frame)
  8270       /* Verify that the two configurations have the same number of windows.  */
  8271       || sws1->header.size != sws2->header.size)
  8272     return false;
  8273 
  8274   for (i = 0; i < sws1->header.size; i++)
  8275     {
  8276       struct saved_window *sw1, *sw2;
  8277 
  8278       sw1 = SAVED_WINDOW_N (sws1, i);
  8279       sw2 = SAVED_WINDOW_N (sws2, i);
  8280 
  8281       if (
  8282            /* The "current" windows in the two configurations must
  8283               correspond to each other.  */
  8284           EQ (d1->current_window, sw1->window)
  8285           != EQ (d2->current_window, sw2->window)
  8286           /* Windows' buffers must match.  */
  8287           || !EQ (sw1->buffer, sw2->buffer)
  8288           || !EQ (sw1->pixel_left, sw2->pixel_left)
  8289           || !EQ (sw1->pixel_top, sw2->pixel_top)
  8290           || !EQ (sw1->pixel_height, sw2->pixel_height)
  8291           || !EQ (sw1->pixel_width, sw2->pixel_width)
  8292           || !EQ (sw1->left_col, sw2->left_col)
  8293           || !EQ (sw1->top_line, sw2->top_line)
  8294           || !EQ (sw1->total_cols, sw2->total_cols)
  8295           || !EQ (sw1->total_lines, sw2->total_lines)
  8296           || !EQ (sw1->display_table, sw2->display_table)
  8297           /* The next two disjuncts check the window structure for
  8298              equality.  */
  8299           || !EQ (sw1->parent, sw2->parent)
  8300           || !EQ (sw1->prev, sw2->prev)
  8301           || !EQ (sw1->left_margin_cols, sw2->left_margin_cols)
  8302           || !EQ (sw1->right_margin_cols, sw2->right_margin_cols)
  8303           || !EQ (sw1->left_fringe_width, sw2->left_fringe_width)
  8304           || !EQ (sw1->right_fringe_width, sw2->right_fringe_width)
  8305           || !EQ (sw1->fringes_outside_margins, sw2->fringes_outside_margins)
  8306           || !EQ (sw1->fringes_persistent, sw2->fringes_persistent)
  8307           || !EQ (sw1->scroll_bar_width, sw2->scroll_bar_width)
  8308           || !EQ (sw1->scroll_bar_height, sw2->scroll_bar_height)
  8309           || !EQ (sw1->vertical_scroll_bar_type, sw2->vertical_scroll_bar_type)
  8310           || !EQ (sw1->horizontal_scroll_bar_type, sw2->horizontal_scroll_bar_type)
  8311           || !EQ (sw1->scroll_bars_persistent, sw2->scroll_bars_persistent))
  8312         return false;
  8313     }
  8314 
  8315   return true;
  8316 }
  8317 
  8318 DEFUN ("window-configuration-equal-p", Fwindow_configuration_equal_p,
  8319        Swindow_configuration_equal_p, 2, 2, 0,
  8320        doc: /* Say whether two window configurations have the same window layout.
  8321 This function ignores details such as the values of point and
  8322 scrolling positions.  */)
  8323   (Lisp_Object x, Lisp_Object y)
  8324 {
  8325   if (compare_window_configurations (x, y))
  8326     return Qt;
  8327   return Qnil;
  8328 }
  8329 
  8330 
  8331 static void init_window_once_for_pdumper (void);
  8332 
  8333 void
  8334 init_window_once (void)
  8335 {
  8336   minibuf_window = Qnil;
  8337   staticpro (&minibuf_window);
  8338 
  8339   selected_window = Qnil;
  8340   staticpro (&selected_window);
  8341 
  8342   Vwindow_list = Qnil;
  8343   staticpro (&Vwindow_list);
  8344 
  8345   minibuf_selected_window = Qnil;
  8346   staticpro (&minibuf_selected_window);
  8347   old_selected_window = Qnil;
  8348   staticpro (&old_selected_window);
  8349 
  8350   pdumper_do_now_and_after_late_load (init_window_once_for_pdumper);
  8351 }
  8352 
  8353 static void init_window_once_for_pdumper (void)
  8354 {
  8355   window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_x = -1;
  8356   window_scroll_pixel_based_preserve_y = -1;
  8357   window_scroll_preserve_hpos = -1;
  8358   window_scroll_preserve_vpos = -1;
  8359   PDUMPER_IGNORE (sequence_number);
  8360 
  8361   PDUMPER_RESET_LV (minibuf_window, Qnil);
  8362   PDUMPER_RESET_LV (selected_window, Qnil);
  8363   PDUMPER_RESET_LV (Vwindow_list, Qnil);
  8364   PDUMPER_RESET_LV (minibuf_selected_window, Qnil);
  8365 
  8366   /* Hack: if mode_line_in_non_selected_windows is true (which it may
  8367      be, if we're restoring from a dump) the guts of
  8368      make_initial_frame will try to access selected_window, which is
  8369      invalid at this point, and lose.  For the purposes of creating
  8370      the initial frame and window, this variable must be false.  */
  8371   bool old_mode_line_in_non_selected_windows;
  8372 
  8373   /* Snapshot dumped_with_pdumper to suppress compiler warning.  */
  8374   bool saved_dumped_with_pdumper = dumped_with_pdumper_p ();
  8375   if (saved_dumped_with_pdumper)
  8376     {
  8377       old_mode_line_in_non_selected_windows
  8378         = mode_line_in_non_selected_windows;
  8379       mode_line_in_non_selected_windows = false;
  8380     }
  8381   struct frame *f = make_initial_frame ();
  8382   if (saved_dumped_with_pdumper)
  8383     mode_line_in_non_selected_windows =
  8384       old_mode_line_in_non_selected_windows;
  8385   XSETFRAME (selected_frame, f);
  8386   old_selected_frame = Vterminal_frame = selected_frame;
  8387   minibuf_window = f->minibuffer_window;
  8388   old_selected_window = selected_window = f->selected_window;
  8389 }
  8390 
  8391 void
  8392 init_window (void)
  8393 {
  8394   Vwindow_list = Qnil;
  8395 }
  8396 
  8397 void
  8398 syms_of_window (void)
  8399 {
  8400   DEFSYM (Qscroll_up, "scroll-up");
  8401   DEFSYM (Qscroll_down, "scroll-down");
  8402   DEFSYM (Qscroll_command, "scroll-command");
  8403 
  8404   Fput (Qscroll_up, Qscroll_command, Qt);
  8405   Fput (Qscroll_down, Qscroll_command, Qt);
  8406 
  8407   DEFSYM (Qwindow_configuration_change_hook, "window-configuration-change-hook");
  8408   DEFSYM (Qwindow_state_change_hook, "window-state-change-hook");
  8409   DEFSYM (Qwindow_state_change_functions, "window-state-change-functions");
  8410   DEFSYM (Qwindow_size_change_functions, "window-size-change-functions");
  8411   DEFSYM (Qwindow_buffer_change_functions, "window-buffer-change-functions");
  8412   DEFSYM (Qwindow_selection_change_functions, "window-selection-change-functions");
  8413   DEFSYM (Qwindowp, "windowp");
  8414   DEFSYM (Qwindow_configuration_p, "window-configuration-p");
  8415   DEFSYM (Qwindow_live_p, "window-live-p");
  8416   DEFSYM (Qwindow_valid_p, "window-valid-p");
  8417   DEFSYM (Qwindow_deletable_p, "window-deletable-p");
  8418   DEFSYM (Qdelete_window, "delete-window");
  8419   DEFSYM (Qwindow__resize_root_window, "window--resize-root-window");
  8420   DEFSYM (Qwindow__resize_root_window_vertically,
  8421           "window--resize-root-window-vertically");
  8422   DEFSYM (Qwindow__resize_mini_frame, "window--resize-mini-frame");
  8423   DEFSYM (Qwindow__pixel_to_total, "window--pixel-to-total");
  8424   DEFSYM (Qsafe, "safe");
  8425   DEFSYM (Qdisplay_buffer, "display-buffer");
  8426   DEFSYM (Qreplace_buffer_in_windows, "replace-buffer-in-windows");
  8427   DEFSYM (Qrecord_window_buffer, "record-window-buffer");
  8428   DEFSYM (Qget_mru_window, "get-mru-window");
  8429   DEFSYM (Qwindow_size, "window-size");
  8430   DEFSYM (Qtemp_buffer_show_hook, "temp-buffer-show-hook");
  8431   DEFSYM (Qabove, "above");
  8432   DEFSYM (Qclone_of, "clone-of");
  8433   DEFSYM (Qfloor, "floor");
  8434   DEFSYM (Qceiling, "ceiling");
  8435   DEFSYM (Qmark_for_redisplay, "mark-for-redisplay");
  8436   DEFSYM (Qmode_line_format, "mode-line-format");
  8437   DEFSYM (Qheader_line_format, "header-line-format");
  8438   DEFSYM (Qtab_line_format, "tab-line-format");
  8439   DEFSYM (Qno_other_window, "no-other-window");
  8440 
  8441   DEFVAR_LISP ("temp-buffer-show-function", Vtemp_buffer_show_function,
  8442                doc: /* Non-nil means call as function to display a help buffer.
  8443 The function is called with one argument, the buffer to be displayed.
  8444 Used by `with-output-to-temp-buffer'.
  8445 If this function is used, then it must do the entire job of showing
  8446 the buffer; `temp-buffer-show-hook' is not run unless this function runs it.  */);
  8447   Vtemp_buffer_show_function = Qnil;
  8448 
  8449   DEFVAR_LISP ("minibuffer-scroll-window", Vminibuf_scroll_window,
  8450                doc: /* Non-nil means it is the window that C-M-v in minibuffer should scroll.  */);
  8451   Vminibuf_scroll_window = Qnil;
  8452 
  8453   DEFVAR_BOOL ("mode-line-in-non-selected-windows", mode_line_in_non_selected_windows,
  8454                doc: /* Non-nil means to use `mode-line-inactive' face in non-selected windows.
  8455 If the minibuffer is active, the `minibuffer-scroll-window' mode line
  8456 is displayed in the `mode-line' face.  */);
  8457   mode_line_in_non_selected_windows = true;
  8458 
  8459   DEFVAR_LISP ("other-window-scroll-buffer", Vother_window_scroll_buffer,
  8460                doc: /* If this is a live buffer, \\[scroll-other-window] should scroll its window.  */);
  8461   Vother_window_scroll_buffer = Qnil;
  8462 
  8463   DEFVAR_LISP ("other-window-scroll-default", Vother_window_scroll_default,
  8464                doc: /* Function that provides the window to scroll by \\[scroll-other-window].
  8465 The function `other-window-for-scrolling' first tries to use
  8466 `minibuffer-scroll-window' and `other-window-scroll-buffer'.
  8467 But when both are nil, then by default it uses a neighboring window.
  8468 This variable is intended to get another default instead of `next-window'.  */);
  8469   Vother_window_scroll_default = Qnil;
  8470 
  8471   DEFVAR_BOOL ("auto-window-vscroll", auto_window_vscroll_p,
  8472                doc: /* Non-nil means to automatically adjust `window-vscroll' to view tall lines.  */);
  8473   auto_window_vscroll_p = true;
  8474 
  8475   DEFVAR_INT ("next-screen-context-lines", next_screen_context_lines,
  8476               doc: /* Number of lines of continuity when scrolling by screenfuls.  */);
  8477   next_screen_context_lines = 2;
  8478 
  8479   DEFVAR_LISP ("scroll-preserve-screen-position",
  8480                Vscroll_preserve_screen_position,
  8481                doc: /* Controls if scroll commands move point to keep its screen position unchanged.
  8482 
  8483 A value of nil means point does not keep its screen position except
  8484 at the scroll margin or window boundary respectively.
  8485 
  8486 A value of t means point keeps its screen position if the scroll
  8487 command moved it vertically out of the window, e.g. when scrolling
  8488 by full screens.  If point is within `next-screen-context-lines' lines
  8489 from the edges of the window, point will typically not keep its screen
  8490 position when doing commands like `scroll-up-command'/`scroll-down-command'
  8491 and the like.
  8492 
  8493 Any other value means point always keeps its screen position.
  8494 Scroll commands should have the `scroll-command' property
  8495 on their symbols to be controlled by this variable.  */);
  8496   Vscroll_preserve_screen_position = Qnil;
  8497 
  8498   DEFVAR_LISP ("window-point-insertion-type", Vwindow_point_insertion_type,
  8499                doc: /* Insertion type of marker to use for `window-point'.
  8500 See `marker-insertion-type' for the meaning of the possible values.  */);
  8501   Vwindow_point_insertion_type = Qnil;
  8502   DEFSYM (Qwindow_point_insertion_type, "window-point-insertion-type");
  8503 
  8504   DEFVAR_LISP ("window-buffer-change-functions", Vwindow_buffer_change_functions,
  8505                doc: /* Functions called during redisplay when window buffers have changed.
  8506 The value should be a list of functions that take one argument.
  8507 
  8508 Functions specified buffer-locally are called for each window showing
  8509 the corresponding buffer if and only if that window has been added or
  8510 changed its buffer since the last redisplay.  In this case the window
  8511 is passed as argument.
  8512 
  8513 Functions specified by the default value are called for each frame if
  8514 at least one window on that frame has been added, deleted or changed
  8515 its buffer since the last redisplay.  In this case the frame is passed
  8516 as argument.  */);
  8517   Vwindow_buffer_change_functions = Qnil;
  8518 
  8519   DEFVAR_LISP ("window-size-change-functions", Vwindow_size_change_functions,
  8520                doc: /* Functions called during redisplay when window sizes have changed.
  8521 The value should be a list of functions that take one argument.
  8522 
  8523 Functions specified buffer-locally are called for each window showing
  8524 the corresponding buffer if and only if that window has been added or
  8525 changed its buffer or its total or body size since the last redisplay.
  8526 In this case the window is passed as argument.
  8527 
  8528 Functions specified by the default value are called for each frame if
  8529 at least one window on that frame has been added or changed its buffer
  8530 or its total or body size since the last redisplay.  In this case the
  8531 frame is passed as argument.
  8532 
  8533 For instance, to hide the title bar when the frame is maximized, you
  8534 can add `frame-hide-title-bar-when-maximized' to this variable.  */);
  8535   Vwindow_size_change_functions = Qnil;
  8536 
  8537   DEFVAR_LISP ("window-selection-change-functions", Vwindow_selection_change_functions,
  8538                doc: /* Functions called during redisplay when the selected window has changed.
  8539 The value should be a list of functions that take one argument.
  8540 
  8541 Functions specified buffer-locally are called for each window showing
  8542 the corresponding buffer if and only if that window has been selected
  8543 or deselected since the last redisplay.  In this case the window is
  8544 passed as argument.
  8545 
  8546 Functions specified by the default value are called for each frame if
  8547 the frame's selected window has changed since the last redisplay.  In
  8548 this case the frame is passed as argument.  */);
  8549   Vwindow_selection_change_functions = Qnil;
  8550 
  8551   DEFVAR_LISP ("window-state-change-functions", Vwindow_state_change_functions,
  8552                doc: /* Functions called during redisplay when the window state changed.
  8553 The value should be a list of functions that take one argument.
  8554 
  8555 Functions specified buffer-locally are called for each window showing
  8556 the corresponding buffer if and only if that window has been added,
  8557 resized, changed its buffer or has been (de-)selected since the last
  8558 redisplay.  In this case the window is passed as argument.
  8559 
  8560 Functions specified by the default value are called for each frame if
  8561 at least one window on that frame has been added, deleted, changed its
  8562 buffer or its total or body size or the frame has been (de-)selected,
  8563 its selected window has changed or the window state change flag has
  8564 been set for this frame since the last redisplay.  In this case the
  8565 frame is passed as argument.  */);
  8566   Vwindow_state_change_functions = Qnil;
  8567 
  8568   DEFVAR_LISP ("window-state-change-hook", Vwindow_state_change_hook,
  8569                doc: /* Functions called during redisplay when the window state changed.
  8570 The value should be a list of functions that take no argument.
  8571 
  8572 This hook is called during redisplay when at least one window has been
  8573 added, deleted, (de-)selected, changed its buffer or its total or body
  8574 size or the window state change flag has been set for at least one
  8575 frame.  This hook is called after all other window change functions
  8576 have been run and should be used only if a function should react to
  8577 changes that happened on at least two frames since last redisplay or
  8578 the function intends to change the window configuration.  */);
  8579   Vwindow_state_change_hook = Qnil;
  8580 
  8581   DEFVAR_LISP ("window-configuration-change-hook", Vwindow_configuration_change_hook,
  8582                doc: /* Functions called during redisplay when window configuration has changed.
  8583 The value should be a list of functions that take no argument.
  8584 
  8585 Functions specified buffer-locally are called for each window showing
  8586 the corresponding buffer if at least one window on that frame has been
  8587 added, deleted or changed its buffer or its total or body size since
  8588 the last redisplay.  Each call is performed with the window showing
  8589 the buffer temporarily selected.
  8590 
  8591 Functions specified by the default value are called for each frame if
  8592 at least one window on that frame has been added, deleted or changed
  8593 its buffer or its total or body size since the last redisplay.  Each
  8594 call is performed with the frame temporarily selected.  */);
  8595   Vwindow_configuration_change_hook = Qnil;
  8596 
  8597   DEFVAR_LISP ("recenter-redisplay", Vrecenter_redisplay,
  8598                doc: /* Non-nil means `recenter' redraws entire frame.
  8599 If this option is non-nil, then the `recenter' command with a nil
  8600 argument will redraw the entire frame; the special value `tty' causes
  8601 the frame to be redrawn only if it is a tty frame.  */);
  8602   Vrecenter_redisplay = Qtty;
  8603 
  8604   DEFVAR_LISP ("window-combination-resize", Vwindow_combination_resize,
  8605                doc: /* If t, resize window combinations proportionally.
  8606 If this variable is nil, splitting a window gets the entire screen space
  8607 for displaying the new window from the window to split.  Deleting and
  8608 resizing a window preferably resizes one adjacent window only.
  8609 
  8610 If this variable is t, splitting a window tries to get the space
  8611 proportionally from all windows in the same combination.  This also
  8612 allows splitting a window that is otherwise too small or of fixed size.
  8613 Resizing and deleting a window proportionally resize all windows in the
  8614 same combination.
  8615 
  8616 Other values are reserved for future use.
  8617 
  8618 A specific split operation may ignore the value of this variable if it
  8619 is affected by a non-nil value of `window-combination-limit'.  */);
  8620   Vwindow_combination_resize = Qnil;
  8621 
  8622   DEFVAR_LISP ("window-combination-limit", Vwindow_combination_limit,
  8623                doc: /* If non-nil, splitting a window makes a new parent window.
  8624 The following values are recognized:
  8625 
  8626 nil means splitting a window will create a new parent window only if the
  8627     window has no parent window or the window shall become part of a
  8628     combination orthogonal to the one it is part of.
  8629 
  8630 `window-size' means that splitting a window for displaying a buffer
  8631     makes a new parent window provided `display-buffer' is supposed to
  8632     explicitly set the window's size due to the presence of a
  8633     `window-height' or `window-width' entry in the alist used by
  8634     `display-buffer'.  Otherwise, this value is handled like nil.
  8635 
  8636 `temp-buffer-resize' means that splitting a window for displaying a
  8637     temporary buffer via `with-temp-buffer-window' makes a new parent
  8638     window only if `temp-buffer-resize-mode' is enabled.  Otherwise,
  8639     this value is handled like nil.
  8640 
  8641 `temp-buffer' means that splitting a window for displaying a temporary
  8642     buffer via `with-temp-buffer-window' always makes a new parent
  8643     window.  Otherwise, this value is handled like nil.
  8644 
  8645 `display-buffer' means that splitting a window for displaying a buffer
  8646     always makes a new parent window.  Since temporary buffers are
  8647     displayed by the function `display-buffer', this value is stronger
  8648     than `temp-buffer'.  Splitting a window for other purpose makes a
  8649     new parent window only if needed.
  8650 
  8651 t means that splitting a window always creates a new parent window.  If
  8652     all splits behave this way, each frame's window tree is a binary
  8653     tree and every window but the frame's root window has exactly one
  8654     sibling.
  8655 
  8656 The default value is `window-size'.  Other values are reserved for
  8657 future use.  */);
  8658   Vwindow_combination_limit = Qwindow_size;
  8659 
  8660   DEFVAR_LISP ("window-persistent-parameters", Vwindow_persistent_parameters,
  8661                doc: /* Alist of persistent window parameters.
  8662 This alist specifies which window parameters shall get saved by
  8663 `current-window-configuration' and `window-state-get' and subsequently
  8664 restored to their previous values by `set-window-configuration' and
  8665 `window-state-put'.
  8666 
  8667 The car of each entry of this alist is the symbol specifying the
  8668 parameter.  The cdr is one of the following:
  8669 
  8670 nil means the parameter is neither saved by `window-state-get' nor by
  8671 `current-window-configuration'.
  8672 
  8673 t means the parameter is saved by `current-window-configuration' and,
  8674 provided its WRITABLE argument is nil, by `window-state-get'.
  8675 
  8676 The symbol `writable' means the parameter is saved unconditionally by
  8677 both `current-window-configuration' and `window-state-get'.  Do not use
  8678 this value for parameters without read syntax (like windows or frames).
  8679 
  8680 Parameters not saved by `current-window-configuration' or
  8681 `window-state-get' are left alone by `set-window-configuration'
  8682 respectively are not installed by `window-state-put'.  */);
  8683   Vwindow_persistent_parameters = list1 (Fcons (Qclone_of, Qt));
  8684 
  8685   DEFVAR_BOOL ("window-resize-pixelwise", window_resize_pixelwise,
  8686                doc: /*  Non-nil means resize windows pixelwise.
  8687 This currently affects the functions: `split-window', `maximize-window',
  8688 `minimize-window', `fit-window-to-buffer' and `fit-frame-to-buffer', and
  8689 all functions that symmetrically resize a parent window.
  8690 
  8691 Note that when a frame's pixel size is not a multiple of the
  8692 frame's character size, at least one window may get resized
  8693 pixelwise even if this option is nil.  */);
  8694   window_resize_pixelwise = false;
  8695 
  8696   DEFVAR_BOOL ("fast-but-imprecise-scrolling",
  8697                fast_but_imprecise_scrolling,
  8698                doc: /* When non-nil, accelerate scrolling operations.
  8699 This comes into play when scrolling rapidly over previously
  8700 unfontified buffer regions.  Only those portions of the buffer which
  8701 are actually going to be displayed get fontified.
  8702 
  8703 Note that this optimization can cause the portion of the buffer
  8704 displayed after a scrolling operation to be somewhat inaccurate.  */);
  8705   fast_but_imprecise_scrolling = false;
  8706
